Sparsely populated in relation to its area, the Democratic Republic of the Congo ( DRC ) is घर to a विशाल संभावित of प्राकृतिक संसाधन and mineral wealth, its untapped deposits of raw minerals are estimated to be worth in excess of US $ 24 trillion, yet the economy of the DRC has declined drastically since the mid-1980s.
At the time of इसके स्वतंत्रता in 1960, DRC was the second most industrialized country in Africa after South Africa ; it boasted a thriving mining sector and its agriculture sector was relatively productive.
If the दर्शक stares at this image for 20–60 seconds and stares at a white object, a negative afterimage will appear ( in this case, it will be cyan on magenta ).
This can also be achieved by the दर्शक closing his/her eyes and tilting their head up.
An afterimage or ghost image or image burn-in is an optical illusion that refers to an image continuing to appear in one 's vision after the exposure to the original चित्र has ceased.
One of the most common afterimages is the उज्जवल glow that seems to float before one 's eyes after looking into a light source for a few seconds.
Closing the eye can help achieve a better sense of the color in इसके अपना aspect.
Afterimages come in two forms, negative ( inverted ) and positive ( retaining original color ).
The प्रक्रम पीछे positive afterimages is unknown, though thought to be related to neural adaptation.
On the other hand, negative afterimages हैं a retinal घटना and are well understood.
Lost is an American serial drama television series that premiered on सितंबर 22, 2004 on the अमरीकी Broadcasting Company ( ABC ).
The series was created by J. J. Abrams and Damon Lindelof, based upon an original pilot script titled nowhere लिखा by जेफरी Lieber.
Six seasons of the show aired, in addition to numerous clip shows to recap previous episodes.
ABC announced that Lost would end after six seasons, having produced a कुल of 121 episodes.
The series follows the past, present, and future experience ( s ) of the survivors of a plane crash on a passenger जेट, oceanic उड़ान 815, flying from Sydney to Los Angeles after it crashes on a tropical island in the South Pacific.
The series also includes stories of the lives of people already living on the island — they include the `` Others ``, who initially antagonize the survivors, as well as a समूह of लोगों जो arrive on the freighter Kahana.
Each episode typically features action on the island as well as a secondary कथानक इससे another पाइंट in a अक्षर 's life.
Season 6 features a detailing of the जीवनदान of the survivors in a अलग reality, as if the flight had never crashed.
In the following list, the term `` featured character ( s ) '' refers to the अक्षर or characters who are featured in the secondary storyline of each episode.
`` No.
in श्रेणी '' refers to the episode 's number in the overall series, whereas `` No.
in season '' refers to the episode 's number in each particular ऋतु.
`` U.S. viewers ( लाख ) '' refers to the number of Americans in millions who watched the episode live.
A total of 121 episodes of Lost were produced, the last of which aired on may 23, 2010.
All seasons are available on DVD in Regions 1–4 and on Blu-ray in Regions A and B.
Flat feet ( भी पुकारा pes planus or गिरे arches ) is a formal reference to a medical condition in which the arch of the foot collapses, with the entire sole of the foot coming into complete or near-complete contact with the ground.
In some individuals ( an estimated 20–30 % of the general population ) the arch simply never develops in one foot ( unilaterally ) or both feet ( bilaterally ).
Three studies ( see citations below in military section ) of military recruits have shown no evidence of later increased चोट, or पैर समस्याएं, due to चपटा feet, in a population of people who reach military service age without prior foot problems.
However, these studies can not be used to judge possible future damage from this condition when diagnosed at younger ages.
They also can not be applied to persons whose flat feet are associated with foot symptoms, or certain symptoms in other parts of the body ( such as the leg or back ) संभवतः referable to the foot.
Generation X, commonly abbreviated to gen x, is the पीढी born after the Western post-World War II baby boom.
Demographers, historians and commentators use beginning birth dates from the early 1960s to the जल्दी 1980s.
The term was popularized by Douglas Coupland 's 1991 novel Generation X : किस्से लिये an Accelerated Culture.
Before that, it had been used for विभिन्न subcultures or countercultures after the 1950s.
Pressure ulcers, also known as decubitus ulcers or bedsores, are localized injuries to the skin and/or underlying tissue usually over a bony prominence, as a result of दबाव, or दबाव in संयोजन साथ shear and/or friction.
Most commonly this will be the sacrum, coccyx, heels or the hips, but other sites such as the elbows, knees, ankles or the back of the cranium can be affected.
The cause of pressure ulcers is pressure applied to soft tissue so कि रक्त flow to the soft tissue is completely or partially obstructed.
shear is also a cause ; shear pulls on blood vessels that feed the skin.
Pressure ulcers most commonly develop in व्यक्तियों who are not moving about or are confined to wheelchairs.
It is widely believed that other factors can influence the tolerance of skin for pressure and shear thereby increasing the risk of pressure ulcer development.
These factors are protein-calorie malnutrition, microclimate ( skin wetness caused by sweating or incontinence ), रोगों कि reduce blood flow to the skin, such as arteriosclerosis or diseases that reduce the feeling in the skin, such as paralysis or neuropathy.
The healing of pressure ulcers may be slowed by the age of the person, medical conditions ( such as arteriosclerosis, मधुमेह or infection ), smoking or medications such as antiinflammatory drugs.
Although often prevented and treatable if found early, pressure ulcers can be very मुश्किल to prevent in critically ill patients, frail elders, wheelchair users ( especially where spinal injury is involved ) and terminally ill patients.
Primary prevention is to redistribute pressure by turning the रोगी regularly.
The benefit of turning to avoid further sores is well documented since at least the 19th century.
In addition to turning and re-positioning the patient in bed or wheelchair, eating a balanced diet with adequate protein and keeping the skin free from exposure to मूत्र and stool is very important.
The prevalence of pressure ulcers in hospital settings is high, but improvements are being made.
According to the 2010 IPUP ( International Pressure Ulcer Prevalence Survey ) conducted in Canada, there was a significant decrease in the overall facility-acquired व्यापकता of दबाव छाले इससे 2009-2010.
Ulcers were most commonly identified at the sacral/coccyx ulcer location ; however, एड़ी छाले यहूद the most common facility-acquired location in the survey.

In turn, overboard थी adapted into the 2006 South Korean television series, Couple or Trouble.
Green Bay is a city in and the county सीट of भूरा काउंटी in the u.S. state of Wisconsin, located at the head of Green Bay, a sub-basin of Lake Michigan, at the mouth of the Fox River.
It has an elevation of ऊपर sea level and is located north of Milwaukee.
The जनसांख्यिकी थी 104,057 at the 2010 census.
It is the third-largest city in the state of Wisconsin, बाद मिल्वौकी and Madison.
it is भी the third-largest city on the west shore of Lake Michigan, after Chicago and Milwaukee.
Green खाड़ी is घर to the ग्रीन खाड़ी पैकर्स of the National Football League, making it by far the smallest metropolitan area in the USA to host a major professional sports franchise.
Green Bay is the principal city of the Green Bay Metropolitan Statistical Area, which covers Brown, Kewaunee, and Oconto Counties and था a संयुक्त जनसांख्यिकी of 282,599 at the 2000 census.
Green Bay is an industrial city with several meatpacking and paper plants, and a port on ग्रीन Bay, an arm of Lake Michigan that locals call the Bay of Green Bay, to avoid conflating it with the eponymous city.
It is home to the National Railroad Museum ; the Neville Public Museum, with exhibitions of आर्ट, इतिहास, और विज्ञान ; और the University of Wisconsin–Green Bay.
Luteinizing hormone ( LH, also known as lutropin and sometimes lutrophin ) is a hormone produced by gonadotroph cells in the anterior pituitary gland.
In females, an acute rise of LH ( `` LH surge '' ) triggers ovulation and विकास of the कॉर्पस luteum.
In males, जहाँ lh था भी महरूम पुकारा अंतरालीय cell-stimulating hormone ( ICSH ), it stimulates Leydig cell production of testosterone.
It acts synergistically साथ FSH.
Selena Quintanilla-Pérez ( April 16, 1971 – March 31, 1995 ), ज्ञात बस as Selena, was an American singer-songwriter.
She was named the `` top लैटिन कलाकार of the '90s '' और `` बेहतरीन selling लैटिन कलाकार of the decade '' by Billboard for her fourteen top-ten singles in the Top Latin Songs chart, including seven number-one hits.
Selena had the most कामयाब singles of 1994 and 1995, `` Amor Prohibido `` and `` No Me Queda Más ``.
वो थी पुकारा `` the Queen of Tejano music `` and the Mexican equivalent of Madonna.
Selena released her first album, सेलिना y Los Dinos, at the age of twelve.
She जीती मादा Vocalist of the Year at the 1987 Tejano Music Awards and landed a recording contract with EMI a few years later.
Her fame grew throughout the early 1990s, especially in Spanish-speaking countries, and she had begun रिकॉर्डिंग in अंग्रेज़ी as well.
Selena was murdered at the age of 23 on March 31, 1995 by Yolanda Saldívar, the पूर्व अध्यक्ष of उसके प्रशंसक क्लबों.
On April 12, 1995, two weeks after उसके मौत, जार्ज W. Bush, governor of Texas at the time, declared her birthday `` Selena Day '' in Texas.
Warner Bros. produced Selena, a film based on her life starring Jennifer Lopez, in 1997.
Selena 's life was also the basis of the musical Selena Forever starring Veronica Vazquez as Selena.
In June 2006 Selena was commemorated with a life-sized bronze statue ( Mirador de la Flor in कॉर्पस christi, Texas ) and a Selena museum opened there.
She has sold over 60 million albums worldwide, बनाना उसके एक of the best-selling artists of all time.
She is also the only female artist to have five albums in U.S. बिलबोर्ड 200 at the same time.
German stahlhelm from World War II
Insignia of the Bolivian Army Colorados regiment, showing a Stahlhelm and two crossed bayonets
Stahlhelm ( बहुवचन, stahlhelme ) is German for `` steel helmet ''.
The Imperial German Army began to replace the traditional boiled-leather Pickelhaube ( spiked कॉम्बैट हेल्मेट ) साथ the stahlhelm during World War I in 1916.
The term Stahlhelm refers both to a जेनेरिक steel helmet, and more specifically to the distinctive ( and iconic ) German design.
The Stahlhelm, with its distinctive `` coal scuttle `` shape, was an instantly recognizable icon for military imagery और became a आम तत्व of सैन्य प्रचार on both sides, just like the Pickelhaube before it.
Its name was also used by the stahlhelm, a paramilitary nationalist organization established at the end of 1918.
glow-in-the-dark may refer to:
Bioluminescence, the production and emission of light by a living organism
Chemiluminescence, is the उत्सर्जन of लाइट ( संदीप्ति ) without emission of heat
स्फुरदीप्ति, a विशिष्ट type of photoluminescence related to fluorescence
radioluminescence, production of luminescence in a material by the bombardment of ionizing radiation
Glow in the अंधेरा दौरे, a 2008 concert tour by Kanye West
Frankfurt Airport serves as a hub city for Lufthansa and receives flights from Star Alliance carriers.
Airline hubs are airports क्रमित as विशाल, मीडियम, छोटी, and non-hubs as one of the FAA airport categories which are re-evaluated every year based on number of commercial passengers.
The more आम लकिन अनौपचारिक use for the phrase airline hub is an airport that an airline uses as a transfer point to get passengers to their intended destination.
It is part of a hub and spoke model, where travelers moving between airports नहीं served by direct flights change planes en route to their destinations.
This is as opposed to the Point to Point model.
Many hubs of the airlines are also situated at एयरपोर्ट in the cities of the respective head offices.
Some airlines may use only a single हब, जबकि other airlines use multiple hubs.
Hubs are used for both passenger flights as well as कार्गो फ़्लाइट.
Many airlines भी उपयोग फ़ोकस cities, which function much the same as hubs.
एयरलाइंस may भी उपयोग secondary hubs, a non-technical term for large focus cities.
A hub in the मध्य of a रूट is अधिक प्रभावी than at either समाप्त as connecting traffic more easily fills the plane - passengers prefer a one-stop ( two-leg ) route over a two-stop ( three-leg ) route.
Hollow lacedaemon.
Site of the Menelaion, the shrine to Helen and Menelaus constructed anciently in the Bronze Age city that stood on the hill of Therapne on the left bank of the Eurotas River overlooking the future site of Dorian Sparta.
Across the valley the successive ridges of Mount Taygetus are in evidence.
Sparta ( Doric Greek : ; Attic यूनानी : ), or Lacedaemon, was a prominent city-state in ancient Greece, situated on the banks of the Eurotas River in Laconia, in south-eastern Peloponnese.
It emerged as a political entity around the 10th century BC, when the आक्रमणकारी dorians subjugated the लोकल, non-dorian population.
Around 650 BC, it rose to become the dominant सैन्य land-power in ancient Greece.
Given its military pre-eminence, Sparta was recognized as the overall नेता of the combined Greek forces during the Greco-Persian Wars.
Between 431 और 404 bc, Sparta was the principal enemy of Athens during the Peloponnesian War, from which it emerged victorious, though at great cost.
Sparta 's defeat by Thebes in the बैटल of leuctra in 371 BC ended Sparta 's prominent role in Greece.
However, it maintained its राजनैतिक स्वतंत्रता जबतक the Roman conquest of Greece in 146 BC.
It then underwent a long period of decline, especially in the Middle Ages, जब अनेक spartans moved to live in Mystras.
Modern Sparta is the capital of the Greek regional unit of Laconia and a center for the processing of goods such as citrus and olives.
Sparta was unique in ancient Greece for its social system and constitution, which completely focused on military training and excellence.
Its inhabitants were classified as Spartiates ( Spartan citizens, who enjoyed full rights ), Mothakes ( non-Spartan फ़्री मेन उठाया as spartans ), perioikoi ( freedmen ), and Helots ( state-owned serfs, enslaved non-Spartan local population ).
Spartiates underwent the rigorous agoge training and education regimen, and Spartan phalanges were widely considered to be among the best in battle.
Spartan women enjoyed considerably अधिक अधिकारों और समता to men than elsewhere in the classical world.
Sparta was the विषय of fascination in its own day, as well as in the West following the revival of classical learning.
This love or admiration of Sparta is known as Laconism or laconophilia.
Fantasy football is an interactive competition in which users compete against each other as general managers of virtual teams.
The players that an individual is able to manage are professional American फ़ुटबॉल खिलाड़ी in the National Football League.
The different actions people are able to make are drafting, व्यापार, adding or dropping players, and changing rosters.
Due to the growth of the Internet, Fantasy football has vastly increased in popularity, particularly because Fantasy फ़ुटबॉल प्रदाताओं ऐसे as ईएसपीएन, याहू, सीबीएस, और the NFL itself are able to keep track of statistics entirely online, eliminating the need to check box scores and newspapers regularly to keep track of players.
Most leagues have a single week चैंपियनशिप in Week 16 of the NFL season.
World population estimates from 1800 to 2100, based on UN 2010 projections ( red, नारंगी, ग्रीन ) और us जनसांख्यिकी Bureau historical estimates ( black ).
Actual अंकित जनसांख्यिकी figures are in blue.
According to the highest estimate, the world population may rise to 16 billion by 2100 ; according to the lowest अनुमान, it may decline to 6 billion.
The world population is the कुल number of living humans on Earth.
As of today, it is अनुमानित to number billion by the United States Census Bureau ( USCB ).
the uscb estimates कि the संसार जनसांख्यिकी exceeded 7 अरब on कूच 12, 2012.
According to a पृथक अनुमान by the United Nations Population Fund, it reached this milestone on October 31, 2011.
The world population has experienced continuous growth since the end of the ग्रेट अकाल और the ब्लैक मौत in 1350, when it stood at around 370 million.
The highest rates of growth – global population increases ऊपर 1.8 % प्रति साल – यहूद seen briefly during the 1950s, and for a longer period during the 1960s and 1970s.
The growth rate peaked at 2.2 % in 1963, and had declined to 1.1 % by 2011.
Total annual births were highest in the late 1980s at about 138 million, and are now expected to remain essentially constant at their 2011 level of 134 million, while deaths number 56 million per year, and are expected to बढ़ाएँ to 80 million per year by 2040.
Current projections show a continued increase in population in the near future ( but a स्थिर मनाही in the जनसांख्यिकी growth rate ), with the global population expected to reach between 7.5 and 10.5 billion by 2050.
Various longer-term estimates predict further growth, stagnation, or भी overall decline in the global population by 2150.
Some analysts have questioned the sustainability of further world population growth, citing the growing pressures on the environment, global food supplies, and energy resources.
Skeletal मांसपेशियां होमो sapiens
This is a table of muscles of the इंसान anatomy.
There are approximately 642 skeletal muscles within the typical human, and almost every muscle constitutes one part of a pair of identical द्विपक्षीय मांसपेशियां, मिला on दोनो पहलू, resulting in approximately 320 pairs of muscles, as presented in this article.
Nevertheless, the exact number is difficult to define क्युकी different sources group muscles differently, e.g. regarding what is defined as different parts of a single muscle or as several muscles.
Examples दायरा इससे 640 to 850.
The muscles of the human body can be categorized into a number of groups which include muscles relating to the head and neck, muscles of the torso or ट्रंक, मांसपेशियां of the upper limbs, and muscles of the lower limbs.
The action refers to the action of each muscle from the standard anatomical स्थिति.
In other positions, other actions may be performed.
A gold bar is a quantity of refined metallic gold of any shape that is made by a bar producer बैठक मानक शर्तें of manufacture, labeling, and record keeping.
Larger gold bars that are produced by pouring the molten मेटल into molds are called ingots.
Smaller बार may be manufactured by minting or stamping from appropriately rolled gold sheets.
The standard gold bar held as gold reserves by सेंट्रल banks and traded among bullion dealers is the 400-troy-ounce ( 12.4 kg or 438.9 ounces ) Good Delivery gold bar.
The kilobar, which is to say 1000 grams in mass, is the bar that is more manageable and is used extensively for trading and investment.
The प्रीमियम on ये बार जब traded is बहुत कम over the spot value of the gold making it ideal for small transfers between banks and traders.
Most kilobars are flat, although some investors, particularly in Europe, prefer the brick shape.
Elisha Archibald `` Archie '' Manning III ( born May 19, 1949 ) is a former American football quarterback in the National Football League, playing for the New Orleans Saints from 1971 to 1982, then for the Houston Oilers and Minnesota Vikings.
He is the father of current Denver Broncos quarterback Peyton Manning, current नई यॉर्क दिग्गज starting क्वार्टरबैक Eli Manning, and former Ole Miss receiver Cooper Manning.
वकालत is a राजनैतिक प्रक्रम by an व्यक्तिगत or group which aims to influence public-policy and resource allocation decisions within political, economic, and social systems and institutions.
Advocacy can include many activities that a person or organization undertakes including media campaigns, पब्लिक बोलना, commissioning और प्रकाशन research or polls or the filing of an amicus brief.
Lobbying ( often by lobby groups ) is a form of advocacy where a direct approach is made to legislators on an issue which plays a significant भूमिका in आधुनिक राजनीती.
Research is beginning to explore how advocacy groups in the U.S. and Canada are using सोशल media to facilitate civic engagement and collective action.
The flag of Mexico ( Spanish : Bandera de México ) is a vertical तिरंगा of ग्रीन, श्वेत, and red with the national coat of arms charged in the center of the white stripe.
While the meaning of the colors has changed over time, these three colors were adopted by Mexico following स्वतंत्रता इससे स्पेन during the country 's War of Independence, and subsequent First Mexican Empire.
The current flag was adopted in 1968, but the overall design has been used since 1821, when the First National Flag was created.
The current law of national symbols, Law on the National Arms, Flag, and Anthem, that governs the उपयोग of the नेशनल flag has been in place since 1984.
Red, white, and ग्रीन are the colors of the national liberation army in Mexico.
The central emblem is the Aztec pictogram for tenochtitlan ( अभी Mexico City ), the center of their empire.
It recalls the legend that inspired the Aztecs to settle on what was originally a lake-island.
The form of the coat of arms was most recently संशोधित in 1968.
A ribbon in the नेशनल रंगों is at the bottom of the coat of arms.
Throughout history, the flag has changed four times, as the design of the coat of arms and the length-width ratios of the ध्वज have been modified.
However, the coat of arms रै था the वही सुविधाएँ throughout : an त्रिभुज, पकड़कर a serpent in its talon, is perched on top of a prickly pear cactus ; the cactus is situated on a rock that rises above a lake.
The coat of arms is derived from an Aztec legend that their देवताओं बताई उन्हें to निर्माण a नगर जहाँ वे स्पॉट an eagle on a nopal eating a serpent, which is now Mexico City.
The current national flag, the Fourth National Flag, is also used as the Mexican naval ensign by जहाजों पंजीकृत in Mexico.
A destination विपणन संगठन or सम्मेलन and visitor bureau promotes a town, city, region, or country in order to increase the number of visitors.
It promotes the development and marketing of a destination, focusing on convention sales, tourism marketing, and services.
Such organizations promote economic development of a destination by increasing visits from tourists and business travelers, जिससे generates overnight आवास लिये a गंतव्य, visits to restaurants, and shopping revenues.
Convention and visitor bureaus are the most important tourism marketing organizations in their respective tourist destinations, as वे are directly responsible for marketing the destination brand through travel and tourism `` product awareness '' to visitors.
DMOs produce billions of dollars in direct and indirect revenue and taxes for their गंतव्यों ' economies साथ their marketing and sales expertise.
Destination marketing organizations are often called travel, सम्मेलन, visitors, or tourism bureaux, welcome centers, information centers and more.
regardless of the नाम, these organizations offer many services to the traveling public.
The elk or wapiti ( Cervus canadensis ) is एक of the largest species of deer in the world, and one of the largest land mammals in North America and eastern Asia.
It was long believed to be a subspecies of the European red deer ( Cervus elaphus ), but evidence from a 2004 study of the mitochondrial DNA indicates that the two are distinct species.
This एनिमल चाहिए नहीं be उलझन with the larger moose ( Alces alces ), to which the name `` elk '' applies in Eurasia.
Apart from the moose, the only other member of the deer family to rival the elk in size is the south Asian sambar ( rusa unicolor ).
Elk range in forest and forest-edge आवास, feeding on grasses, plants, leaves, and bark.
Although native to North America and पूर्वी एशिया, they have adapted well to countries where they have been introduced, including Argentina, Australia, and New Zealand.
Their great adaptability may threaten endemic species and ecosystems into which they have been introduced.
Male elk have large antlers which are शेड प्रत्येक year.
Males also engage in ritualized mating व्यवहार दौरान the rut, including posturing, antler wrestling ( sparring ), and bugling, a loud series of vocalizations which establishes dominance over other males and attracts females.
Elk are susceptible to a number of infectious diseases, some of which can be transmitted to livestock.
Efforts to eliminate infectious diseases from elk populations, largely through vaccination, have had mixed success.
Some cultures revere the elk as a आध्यात्मिक force.
In parts of Asia, antlers and their velvet are used in परंपरागत दवाइयाँ.
Elk are hunted as a खेल प्रजाति ; the मांस is leaner और उच्चतर in प्रोटीन than बीफ or मुर्गा.
The George Washington University ( GW, GWU, or George Washington ) is a comprehensive private, coeducational research university located in Washington, D.C..
It पुरस्कार certificates, Bachelor degrees, Masters degrees, and PhDs across several dozen disciplines.
The university was chartered by an Act of Congress on फ़रवरी 9, 1821 as The Columbian College in the District of Columbia.
The lion ( Panthera leo ) is one of the four big cats in the genus Panthera and a member of the family Felidae.
With some males exceeding in वज़न, it is the second-largest living cat after the tiger.
Wild lions currently exist in sub-Saharan Africa and in Asia ( where an endangered remnant जनसांख्यिकी resides in Gir Forest National Park in India ) while other types of lions have disappeared from North Africa and Southwest Asia in historic times.
Until the late Pleistocene, about 10,000 years ago, the lion was the सबसे फैली विशाल जमीन स्तनधारी after humans.
They were मिला in most of Africa, across Eurasia from western Europe to India, and in the Americas from the Yukon to Peru.
The lion is a vulnerable प्रजाति, having देखी a प्रमुख जनसांख्यिकी decline of 30–50 % over the past two decades in its African range.
Lion populations are untenable बाहर designated reserves and national parks.
Although the cause of the decline is नहीं fully समझा, habitat loss and conflicts with humans are currently the greatest causes of concern.
Within Africa, the West अफ़्रीकी शेर जनसांख्यिकी is particularly endangered.
Lions live for 10–14 years in the wild, while in captivity they can live longer than 20 years.
In the wild, males seldom live longer than 10 years, as injuries sustained from continual fighting with rival males greatly reduce their longevity.
They typically inhabit सवाना and grassland, although they may take to bush and forest.
Lions are unusually social compared to other cats.
A pride of lions consists of related females and औलाद और a छोटी number of adult males.
Groups of female lions typically hunt together, preying mostly on large ungulates.
Lions are apex and keystone परभक्षी, हालांकि वे scavenge as opportunity allows.
While lions do not typically hunt humans, कुछ have been known to do so.
Sleeping mainly during the day, lions are primarily nocturnal, हालांकि bordering on crepuscular in nature.
Highly distinctive, the पुरूष शेर is easily recognised by its mane, and its face is one of the most widely recognised animal symbols in human culture.
Depictions have existed इससे the अपर paleolithic काल, साथ उत्कीर्णन and paintings from the Lascaux and Chauvet Caves, through virtually all ancient and medieval cultures where they once occurred.
It has been extensively depicted in sculptures, in paintings, on नेशनल ध्वज, और in समकालीन films and literature.
Lions have been kept in menageries since the time of the Roman Empire, and have been a key species sought for प्रदर्शनी in zoos over the संसार since the late 18th century.
Zoos are cooperating worldwide in breeding programs for the endangered Asiatic subspecies.
In the history of video games, the seventh generation of consoles is the previous generation, and शामिल consoles released since late by Nintendo, Microsoft, and Sony.
For home consoles, the seventh generation began on 22 November 2005 with the release of Xbox 360 and continued with the release of PlayStation 3 on 11 November 2006, and Wii on 19 November 2006.
Each new console introduced a new type of भेदन in technology.
The Xbox 360 offered games rendered natively at HD रिज़ॉल्यूशन, the प्लेस्टेशन 3 offered, in addition to FHD gaming, HD movie playback via a built-in 3D Blu-ray Disc player, and the Wii focused on integrating controllers with movement sensors as well as joysticks.
Joining Nintendo in the गति मार्केट, सोनी released the PlayStation Move in September 2010.
The PlayStation Move features motion sensing gaming, similar to कि of the Wii.
microsoft भी joined Sony and Nintendo, with its Kinect.
Unlike the other two systems ( PlayStation 3 and Wii ), Kinect does not उपयोग कोई परिरक्षक of any sort and makes the users the `` controller. ''
Having sold 8 million units in its first 60 days on the market, Kinect has claimed the Guinness संसार रिकार्ड of होने the `` तीव्रतम selling consumer electronics device ''.
While the एक्सबॉक्स 360 offers wired controllers as a standalone product, all PlayStation 3 controllers can be used in wired and wireless configurations.
starting साथ हैंडहेल्ड consoles, the सातवाँ पीढी began on 21 नवम्बर 2004 साथ the उत्तर अमरीकी परिचय of the निन्टेंडो ds as a `` तीसरा pillar '', alongside निन्टेंडो 's मौजूदा खेल लड़के अग्रिम और gamecube consoles.
The Nintendo DS ( NDS ) सुविधाएँ a टच स्क्रीन और built-in माइक्रोफोन, and supports wireless IEEE 802.11 ( Wi-Fi ) standards.
Additionally, the revised version of the NDS, the DSi, features two built in cameras, the ability to download games from the DSi store, and a web browser.
The PlayStation Portable, or psp, released बाद the वही साल on 12 December 2004, followed a different pattern.
It became the first handheld video game console to use an optical disc format, Universal Media Disc ( UMD ), as its primary भंडार media.
Sony also gave the PSP robust multi-media capability, connectivity with the PlayStation 3 and other PSPs, and Internet कनेक्टिविटी.
The Nintendo DS likewise has connectivity to the internet through the निन्टेंडो wi-fi कनेक्शन और Nintendo DS Browser, as well as wireless connectivity to other DS systems and Wii consoles.
Despite high sales numbers for both consoles, PlayStation Portable sales have consistently lagged behind those of the Nintendo DS ; nevertheless, the PlayStation Portable has the भेद of होने the best-selling non-Nintendo handheld gaming system.
Sgt. Pepper 's Lonely Hearts Club Band ( often shortened to sgt. pepper ) is the eighth studio album by English rock band the Beatles.
Released in June 1967, the album included songs such as `` साथ a छोटी सहायता इससे My Friends ``, `` Lucy in the Sky with Diamonds ``, and `` A Day in the Life ``.
Continuing the artistic maturation seen on the band 's album Revolver ( 1966 ), Sgt. Pepper further departed from the conventional pop rock idiom of the time and incorporated balladry, साइकेडेलिक, music hall, and symphonic influences.
During the Sgt. Pepper sessions, the group improved upon the quality of their music 's production while exploring experimental रिकॉर्डिंग techniques.
Producer George मार्टिन 's अभिनव दृष्टिकोण included the use of an orchestra.
Widely acclaimed and imitated, the album cover, designed by English pop artists Peter Blake and Jann Haworth, was inspired by a sketch by Paul McCartney that depicted the band posing in front of a collage of some of their पसंदीदा हस्तियाँ.
Sgt. Pepper was a worldwide critical and commercial success, spending 27 weeks at the top of the UK Album चार्ट और 15 सप्ताह at number one on the US Billboard 200.
A seminal work in the emerging psychedelic rock style, the album was critically acclaimed upon रिलीज और जीती four Grammy Awards in 1968.
With an अनुमानित 32 million copies sold, it is one of the world 's best selling albums.
Sgt. Pepper is considered by many to be the most influential and famous rock album ever, and has been named the greatest album of all time by both All Time Top 1000 Albums and Rolling Stone.
The temporal lobe is a region of the cerebral cortex that is located beneath the lateral fissure on both cerebral बांटती of the mammalian brain.
The temporal lobes are involved in the retention of visual memories, processing sensory input, comprehending language, storing new memories, emotion, and deriving meaning.
The human lungs are the organs of श्वसन in humans.
Humans have two lungs, a सही lung and a left lung.
The right lung consists of three lobes while the left lung is थोड़ा smaller consisting of only two lobes ( the left lung has a `` cardiac notch '' allowing space for the heart within the chest ).
Together, the lungs contain approximately of airways and 300 to 500 लाख alveoli, having a total surface area of about ( ) in adults — roughly the same area as one side of a tennis court.
Furthermore, if all of the capillaries that surround the alveoli were unwound और रखी समाप्त to समाप्त, वे होता extend for about.
Each lung weighs, इसलिए बनाना the संपूर्ण organ about.
Human फेफड़े
The trachea divides into two bronchi ( one for each side ) at the level of T4.
This junction is also known as the carina.
The conducting zone contains the trachea, the bronchi, the bronchioles, and the terminal bronchioles The respiratory zone contains the respiratory bronchioles, the alveolar ducts, and the alveoli.
The conducting zone and the respiratory stuffers ( but not the alveoli ) are made up of airways.
The conducting zone has no gas एक्सचेंज साथ the रक्त, and is reinforced with cartilage in order to hold open the airways.
The conducting zone warms the एयर to और humidifies the air.
It also cleanses the एयर by निकालना अणु via cilia located on the walls of all the passageways.
The फेफड़े हैं surrounded by the rib cage.
The respiratory zone is the साईट of gas exchange with blood.
The sympathetic nervous system via noradrenaline acting on the बीटा receptors causes bronchodilation.
The parasympathetic nervous system via acetylcholine, which acts on the M-3 muscarinic receptors, maintains the resting टोन of the bronchiolar smooth muscle.
इस कार्रवाई is related, although considered distinct from bronchoconstriction.
Many other non-autonomic nervous और biochemical stimuli, including carbon dioxide and oxygen, are also involved in the regulation process.
The pleural cavity is the potential space between the parietal pleura, अस्तर the भीतरी वॉल of the thoracic cage, and the visceral pleura lining the lungs.
The lung parenchyma is strictly used to refer solely to alveolar tissue साथ respiratory bronchioles, alveolar ducts and terminal bronchioles.
However, it often includes any form of lung tissue, also including bronchioles, bronchi, blood vessels and lung interstitium.
The margarita is a Mexican कॉकटेल consisting of tequila mixed with Cointreau or similar orange -flavoured liqueur and lime or lemon juice, often served with salt on the glass rim.
It is the most common tequila-based कॉकटेल in the United States.
The drink is served shaken with ice ( on the rocks ), blended with ice ( frozen margarita ), or without ice ( सीधा up ).

Burgundy is a dark red रंग संबद्ध साथ the Burgundy wine of the same name, which in turn is named after the Burgundy region of France.
The रंग बरगंडी is similar to other shades of dark red such as maroon.
When referring to the color, `` बरगंडी '' is प्रायः नहीं capitalized.
The first recorded use of `` burgundy '' as a color name in English was in 1881.

Missing in action ( MIA ) is a casualty Category assigned अंतर्गत the Status of Missing to armed services personnel who are reported missing during active service.
They may have महरूम killed, wounded, become a prisoner of war, or deserted.
If deceased, neither उनके remains nor संगीन can be positively identified.
Becoming MIA has been an occupational risk for सेवा कर्मियों लिये as long as there has been warfare.

Intense red-eye effect in blue eyes with dilated pupil
The red-eye effect in photography is the common appearance of red pupils in color photographs of eyes.
It occurs जब using a फ़ोटोग्राफ़िक flash very close to the camera lens ( as with most compact cameras ), in ambient low light.
The effect appears in the eyes of इंसानो और पशु that have tapetum lucidum.
Theatrical followspot operators, positioned nearly coincidentally with a very bright light and somewhat distant from the actors, occasionally witness red-eye in actors on stage.
The effect is not visible to the rest of the दर्शक क्युकी it is reliant on the very small angle between the followspot operator and the light.
The University of California, Santa Barbara ( commonly referred to as uc सांता बारबरा or ucsb ) is a public research university and one of the ten general campuses of the University of California system.
The main campus is located on a site in Goleta, California, United States, from Santa Barbara and northwest of Los एंजिल्स.
Tracing its roots back to 1891 as an independent teachers ' college, UCSB joined the University of California system in 1944 and is the third-oldest general-education campus in the system.
UCSB is one of America 's Public आइवी विश्वविद्यालयों, which recognizes top public research universities in the United States.
The university is a व्यापक डॉक्टरेट विश्वविद्यालयों और is organized into five colleges and schools offering 87 undergraduate degrees and 55 graduate degrees.
The campus is the 6th-largest in the UC system by enrollment with 18,977 undergraduate and 2,950 graduate students.
In 2012, UCSB was ranked 41st among `` National Universities '' and 10th among पब्लिक universities by U.S. News & World Report.
The university was also ranked 35th worldwide by the टाइम्स उच्चतर शिक्षा संसार विश्वविद्यालयों Rankings and 34th worldwide ( 6th worldwide for engineering ) by the Academic Ranking of World Universities in 2012. < ref name= '' Shanghairanking.com/FieldENG2012 '' >
UC Santa Barbara is a `` very high activity '' research university and spent $ 191.2 million on research expenditures in the 2007 fiscal year, 97th-largest in the United States.
UCSB houses twelve national research centers, सहित the प्रसिद्ध Kavli Institute for Theoretical Physics.
UCSB faculty includes five Nobel Prize laureates, one Fields Medalist, 29 members of the National अकादमी of Sciences, 27 members of the National Academy of Engineering, and 31 members of the American Academy of Arts and Sciences.
UCSB was the No. 3 host on the arpanet और थी निर्वाचित to the Association of American Universities in 1995.
The UC Santa Barbara Gauchos compete in the NCAA प्रभाग i बिग West Conference.
The Gauchos have जीती ncaa नेशनल championships in men 's soccer and men 's water polo.

Saint Joseph 's Day, March 19, the Feast of St. Joseph is in Western Christianity the principal feast day of Saint जोसेफ, Spouse of the Blessed Virgin Mary.
He is also the step-father of Jesus of नासरत /jesus Christ.
It has the rank of a solemnity in the Roman Catholic Church ; Catholics who follow the Missal of 1962 celebrate it as a first class feast.
Previous to 1962 it थी मनाये as a feast of the rank of double of the first class.
It is a feast or commemoration in the provinces of the Anglican Communion, and a feast or पर्व in the लूथरन गिरिजाघर.
Saint Joseph 's Day is the Patronal Feast day लिये कैंडल as खूब as for Canada, persons named Joseph, Josephine, etc., for religious institutes, schools and parishes bearing his name, and for carpenters.
It is also पिता 's दिन in some Catholic countries, mainly Spain, Portugal, and Italy.
March 19 was dedicated to Saint जोसेफ in अनेक पश्चिमी पंचांग by the दसवाँ century, and this custom was established in Rome by 1479.
Pope St. Pius V extended इसके उपयोग to the entire Roman Rite by his Apostolic Constitution Quo Primum ( July 14, 1570 ).
Since 1969, एपिस्कोपल Conferences may, if they wish, transfer it to a date outside Lent.
Between 1870 and 1955, a feast was celebrated in honor of St. जोसेफ as जीवनसाथी of the धन्य Virgin Mary and Patron of the Universal Church, the latter title having been given to him by Pope Pius IX.
Originally celebrated on the third Sunday after Easter with an अष्टक, after Divino Afflatu of St. Pius X ( see Reform of the Roman Breviary by Pope Pius X ), it was moved to the preceding Wednesday.
The feast was also retitled the solemnity of Saint Joseph.
This celebration and its accompanying अष्टक was abolished during the modernisation and simplification of rubrics under Pope Pius XII in 1955.
it is स्टिल कायम by catholics जो follow the missal of 1962 or पहले missals.
As the traditional holiday of the Apostles Ss. Philip and जेम्स, may 1, had faded from the memory of most Catholics by the mid-twentieth century, that of Joseph the Worker was created in order to coincide with the celebration of international Labour Day ( May Day ) in many countries.
The feast of Ss. Philip and James, which had been celebrated on that date चूंकि the छठे सदी, was moved from its traditional place.
In the new calendar published in 1969, the feast, which at one time occupied the highest possible rank in the Church calendar, was reduced to an optional मेमोरियल, the न्यूनतम rank for a saint 's day.
The पूर्वी परंपरागत गिरिजाघर celebrates Saint Joseph on the Sunday after Christmas.
Mariah Carey ( born March 27, 1970 ) is an American singer, songwriter, record producer, actress, and philanthropist.
Under the guidance of Columbia Records executive Tommy Mottola, Carey released her self-titled debut studio album Mariah Carey in 1990 ; it गई multi-platinum और शाखित चार consecutive number one singles on the U.S. Billboard Hot 100 chart.
Following her marriage to Mottola in 1993 and success with hit records Emotions ( 1991 ), Music Box ( 1993 ), and Merry Christmas ( 1994 ), Carey was established as Columbia 's highest-selling act.
Daydream ( 1995 ) made music history when its second single `` One Sweet Day ``, a duet with Boyz II Men, spent a रिकार्ड सोलह सप्ताह on शीर्ष of the बिलबोर्ड hot 100, और remains the longest-running number-one song in U.S. chart history.
During the रिकॉर्डिंग of the album, Carey began to deviate from her R & B and pop beginnings and slowly traversed into hip hop.
This musical बदलें became evident साथ the रिलीज of तितली ( 1997 ), at which time Carey had separated from Mottola.
Carey left Columbia in 2000, and signed a record-breaking $ 100 million recording अनुबंध साथ Virgin Records.
Before the release of her first feature film Glitter ( 2001 ), she suffered a physical and emotional विश्लेषण और थी hospitalized लिये कठोर exhaustion.
Following the film 's poor reception, she was bought out of her recording contract for $ 50 लाख, जिससे led to a decline in her career.
She signed a multi-million dollar contract deal with Island Records in 2002, और after an unsuccessful period, returned to the top of music charts with The Emancipation of Mimi ( 2005 ).
Its second single `` We Belong साथ `` became her most successful single of the 2000s, and was later named `` Song of the Decade '' by Billboard.
Carey once again ventured into film with a well-received starring role in ( 2009 ) ; she was awarded the `` Breakthrough Performance Award '' at the ताड़ स्रोतों अंतरराष्ट्रीय फिल्मी पर्व, और ब्लैक Reel and NAACP Image Award nominations.
In a career spanning over two decades, कैरी रै बेची more than 200 million records worldwide, making her one of the best-selling music artists of all time.
In 1998, वो थी सम्मानित as the world 's best-selling recording artist of the 1990s at the World Music Awards.
Carey was also named the best-selling मादा कलाकार of the millennium in 2000.
According to the Recording Industry Association of America, वो is the तीसरा best-selling female artist in the United States, with 63.5 million certified albums.
साथ the रिलीज of `` Touch My Body `` ( 2008 ), Carey gained her eighteenth number one single in the United States, more than any other solo artist.
In 2012, Carey was ranked second on VH1 's list of the `` 100 Greatest Women in Music ''.
Aside from her commercial accomplishments, Carey रै won five Grammy Awards, 17 World Music Awards, 11 American Music Awards, and 31 Billboard Music Awards.
Referred to as the `` songbird supreme '' by the गिनीज संसार Records, she is famed for her five-octave vocal range, power, melismatic style and signature use of the whistle register.
A bumblebee is any member of the bee genus bombus, in the family Apidae.
There are over 250 known species, existing primarily in the Northern Hemisphere हालांकि वे भी occur in South America.
They have महरूम introduced to नई जीलैंड और the Australian state of Tasmania.
Bumblebees are social insects that are characterised by ब्लैक और पीला देह hairs, often in bands.
However, some species have orange or red on their bodies, or may be entirely black.
Another obvious ( but not unique ) characteristic is the soft nature of the बाल ( long, branched setae ), पुकारा pile, that covers their entire body, making them appear and feel fuzzy.
They are best विशिष्ट इससे similarly विशाल, फजी मधुमक्खियों by the रूप of the मादा हिन्द लेग, जिससे is modified to form a corbicula : a shiny concave surface that is bare, but surrounded by a fringe of hairs used to transport pollen ( in similar bees, the hind leg is completely hairy, and pollen grains are wedged into the hairs for transport ).
Like their relatives the honey bees, bumblebees feed on nectar and gather pollen to फीड their young.
A man openly carrying a handgun in a Burger King in Eagle, Colorado.
In the United States, open carry is shorthand terminology for `` openly carrying a firearm in public '', as विशिष्ट from concealed carry, where firearms can not be seen by the casual observer.
The practice of open carry, where gun owners openly carry firearms जबकि वे go परिचय उनके daily business, has seen an increase in the U.S. in recent years.
This has been marked by a number of organized events intended to increase the visibility of open carry and public awareness परिचय the अभ्यास.
Proponents of open carry point to history and statistics, noting that criminals usually conceal their weapons.
Encouraged by groups like OpenCarry.org, GeorgiaCarry.org and some भागीदार of the फ़्री राज्य प्रोजेक्ट, open carry has seen a revival in recent years, but it is not yet clear if this represents just a short-term trend.
The gun rights community has been मिश्रित in इसके response.
Alan Gottlieb of the Second Amendment Foundation and the NRA have been cautious in expressing support, जबकि special-interest समूह ऐसे as the aforementioned opencarry.org और georgiacarry.org, and certain national groups such as the Gun Owners of America ( GOA ) have been more outspoken in favor of the practice.
Open carry is strongly opposed by gun control groups such as the Brady Campaign and the Coalition to Stop Gun Violence.
The Cattenom नाभिकीय शक्ति Plant in France.
France produces around three quarters of its विद्युत by nuclear power.
The Grafenrheinfeld Nuclear Power Plant in Germany.
Chancellor Angela Merkel 's coalition announced on May 30, 2011, that Germany’s 17 nuclear शक्ति स्टेशन will be shut down by 2022, in a policy reversal following Japan 's Fukushima Daiichi nuclear disaster.
Currently, 68 reactors are under निर्माण in 15 countries.
Nuclear power stations operate in तीस countries.
In 2010, before the Fukushima Daiichi nuclear disaster, it was reported that an average of about 10 nuclear reactors were expected to become operational per year, although according to the संसार नाभिकीय संघ, of the 17 civilian रिएक्टरों नियोजित to become operational between 2007 and 2009, only five actually came on stream.
As of June 2011, Germany and स्विट्ज़रलैंड are phasing-out nuclear power.
As of June 2011, देशों ऐसे as ऑस्ट्रेलिया, Austria, Denmark, Greece, Ireland, Italy, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Luxembourg, Malaysia, Malta, New Zealand, Norway and Portugal remain opposed to nuclear power.
Color motion चित्र फिल्मी refers both to unexposed color photographic film in a format suitable for use in a motion picture camera, and to finished motion picture film, ready for use in a projector, which bears images in color.
The first color cinematography was by means of additive color systems such as the one patented in England by Edward Raymond Turner in 1899 and tested in 1902.
A simplified additive system was विकसित by जार्ज अल्बर्ट Smith and successfully commercialized in 1909 as Kinemacolor.
These early systems used black-and-white film to फोटोग्राफ और project two or more component images through different color filters.
स्टिल from footage recorded by Edward Turner in 1902
With the present-day technology, there are two distinct processes : Eastman Color Negative 2 chemistry ( camera negative stocks, duplicating interpositive and internegative stocks ) और eastman रंग धनात्मक 2 रसायन ( धनात्मक prints लिये सीधा प्रक्षेप ), प्रायः abbreviated as ECN-2 and ECP-2.
Fuji 's products are compatible with ECN-2 and ECP-2.
Ashanti Shequoiya Douglas ( born October 13, 1980 ) is an अमरीकी singer-songwriter, record producer, and actress.
Ashanti is most famous for her eponymous debut album, which featured the hit song `` Foolish ``, और बेची over 503,000 नक़ल in its first week of release throughout the U.S. in April 2002.
The album set a Soundscan रिकार्ड as the biggest opening week sales for a new female artist, outselling debuts by Alicia Keys and Lauryn Hill.
In the same week, she became the first female performer to simultaneously hold the top two places on the Billboard Hot 100 singles chart साथ `` foolish '', और `` कया 's Luv ? ``
( साथ Fat Joe ).
Ashanti broke records again by having three top ten songs, `` Foolish, '' `` What 's Luv ? '' and `` Always on Time ``, on the बिलबोर्ड Hot 100 charts in the same week, being the first woman to accomplish this feat and being second only to the Beatles.
In 2003, the self-titled debut album won Ashanti her first Grammy Award for Best समकालीन r & b एल्बम.
As of April 1st 2013, Ashanti has sold over 27.7 million records worldwide.
Ashanti ended the decade ( 2000–09 ) as the third top new R & B artist behind Alicia Keys and Beyoncé.
She भी ended the दशक at number 38 on the Top Artist of the Decade list.
She is currently on the list of The Twenty Best Selling Music Singles Since 1990 for her single foolish लिये selling 7.2 million copies to-date.
Ashanti has an estimated net worth of $ 40 million डॉलर [ usd ].
Ashanti wrote and sang background on Jennifer Lopez 's `` Ai n't It Funny ( Murder Remix ) ``, which reached number one on Billboard Hot 100, which was also in the शीर्ष 10 चार्ट at the वही समय as `` foolish '', `` सदा on Time '' ( with Ja Rule ), and `` What 's Luv '' ( with Fat Joe ).
Later that year, she was acclaimed as the `` Princess of hip-hop & r & b '' by her label and capped off her successful debut by winning eight Billboard awards and two American Music Awards.
Within seven सालो of ashanti 's करियर, वो has scored 16 top 40 hits on the Hot 100.
Ashanti has endorsed numerous products सहित गैप, Herbal Essences and Mudd Jeans.
Ashanti cites Whitney Houston, Janet Jackson, Prince, Madonna, Tupac Shakur, Mary J. Blige, Ella Fitzgerald, Smokey रॉबिन्सन, डोना Summer, and Blue Magic as her musical influences.
Praised as a gifted songwriter by her peers and critics alike, Ashanti has written/co-written the bulk of all her music.
She is फिलहाल working on her own publishing company entitled Written Entertainment.
She released her fourth studio album entitled The Declaration on June 3, 2008 and is currently in the studio working on her fifth.
She also performed the charity tune `` Just Stand Up `` alongside 15 other female singers for the `` Stand Up to Cancer '' live television special which helped raise $ 100 लाख डॉलर लिये कर्कट research.
The United States Army Air Forces ( USAAF or AAF ) was the military aviation arm of the United States of America during and immediately after World War II, and the सीधा पूर्ववर्ती of the संयुक्त States Air Force.
The AAF was a component of the United States Army, which in 1942 was divided functionally by कार्यपालिका अनुक्रम into तीन autonomous forces : the Army Ground Forces, the Services of Supply ( which in 1943 became the Army Service Forces ), and the AAF.
Each of these forces had a commanding general who reported सीधे to the Chief of Staff of the United States Army.
The AAF administered all parts of military aviation formerly distributed among the Army Air Corps, General Headquarters Air Force, and ground forces corps area commanders, and thus became the first air organization of the U.S. Army to control its own installations and support personnel.
In practice, the AAF was virtually autonomous अंदर the Army.
The peak size of the AAF was over 2.4 million men and women in service and nearly 80,000 aircraft in 1944, और 783 घरेलू bases in दिसम्बर 1943.
By VE Day it had 1.25 million men stationed overseas and operated from अधिक than 1,600 airfields विश्वव्यापी.
The Air Corps became the Army Air Forces in June 1941 to provide the air arm a वृहद स्वायत्तता in जिससे to विस्तार more efficiently, and to provide a structure for the additional command echelons required by a vastly increased force.
Although other nations already था पृथक एयर शक्तियां स्वतंत्र of the फौज or नेवी ( ऐसे as the अंग्रेजों Royal Air Force and the German Luftwaffe ), the AAF remained a part of the United States Army until the United States Air Force came into being in September 1947.
However, in its expansion and conduct of the युद्ध, the aaf became more than just an arm of the greater organization.
By the समाप्त of संसार युद्ध II the AAF had become virtually an independent service.
By regulation and कार्यपालिका अनुक्रम, the AAF was a subordinate agency of the War Department tasked only with organizing, training, and equipping combat units, limited in responsibility to the continental United States, as were the Army Ground Forces and the Army Service Forces.
In reality, Headquarters AAF controlled the conduct of all aspects of the air war in every part of the world, determining air policy and issuing orders बगैर transmitting उन्हें through the Chief of Staff.
This `` contrast between theory and fact is... fundamental to an understanding of the AAF. ''
The Freedom of Information अधिनियम ( foia ) is a संघीय स्वतंत्रता of information law that allows for the full or partial disclosure of previously unreleased information and documents controlled by the United States government.
The Act defines agency records subject to disclosure, outlines mandatory disclosure procedures और अनुदान नौ छूटों to the statute.
It was originally signed into law by अध्यक्ष lyndon B. जॉनसन, despite his misgivings, on July 4, 1966 as and went into effect the following year.
The Federal Government 's Freedom of Information Act should not be confused with the different and varying Freedom of Information Acts passed by the individual states.
Many of those state अधिनियमों may be similar but not identical to the federal act.
The European Union ( EU ) is an economic and political union of 27 member राज्य कि हैं स्तिथ primarily in Europe.
The EU operates through a system of supranational independent institutions and intergovernmental negotiated decisions by the member states.
Institutions of the EU include the European Commission, the परिषद of the European Union, the European Council, the Court of Justice of the European Union, the European Central Bank, the Court of Auditors, and the European Parliament.
the यूरोपीय Parliament is elected every five years by EU citizens.
the EU 's de facto capital is Brussels.
The EU traces इसके origins इससे the European Coal and Steel Community ( ECSC ) and the European Economic Community ( EEC ), formed by the Inner Six countries in 1951 and 1958 respectively.
In the intervening years the जातियाँ और इसके successors have grown in size by the accession of new member states and in power by the addition of policy areas to its remit.
The Maastricht Treaty स्थापित the European Union under its current name in 1993.
The latest major amendment to the constitutional basis of the EU, the Treaty of Lisbon, आए into force in 2009.
The eu रै विकसित a single market through a standardised system of laws that apply in all member states.
Within the शेंगेन क्षेत्रफल ( which includes 22 EU and 4 non-EU states ) passport controls have been abolished.
EU policies aim to ensure the free movement of people, goods, सेवाएं, और पूंजी, enact विधान in इंसाफ and home affairs, and maintain common policies on trade, agriculture, fisheries and regional development.
A monetary union, the eurozone, was established in 1999 and is composed of 17 member राज्य.
Through the Common Foreign और सुरक्षा Policy the EU has developed a role in external relations and defence.
Permanent diplomatic missions have महरूम established around the world.
The EU is represented at the United राष्ट्र, the WTO, the G8 and the G-20.
With a combined population of over 500 million inhabitants, or 7.3 % of the world population, the EU, in 2012, generated a nominal gross domestic उत्पाद ( जीडीपी ) of 16.584 खरब us डॉलर, representing approximately 20 % of the global GDP when measured in terms of purchasing power parity, and represents the largest nominal GDP and GDP PPP in the world.
The EU was the recipient of the 2012 नोबेल सलाम पुरस्कार.
The Wales national rugby league team represent वेल्स in international rugby league football matches.
Currently the team is seventh in the rlif World Rankings.
The team were run under the auspices of the रग्बी फ़ुटबॉल League, but an independent body, Wales Rugby League, now runs the team from Cardiff.
A total of three Welsh players have महरूम entered into the Rugby League Hall Of Fame.
Similar to many other Welsh national sporting teams, Wales strip has been primarily red for many years, including now.
However in their last World कप अभियान in 2000 they did wear a shirt featuring the Welsh flag, adding a touch of green and white.
The team is known as `` The Dragons '' and so the टीमों logo on the shirt is a red dragon.
The team date back to 1907, making them the third oldest नेशनल side after England and New Zealand.
और it थी a touring New Zealand side that Wales first played against in 1908, winning 9-8 at Aberdare.
Since then Wales have regularly played England, since 1935 France, as well as welcomed the touring Australia and New Zealand teams, although they rarely toured themselves, not playing a मैच in the दक्षिणी Hemisphere until 1975.
For twenty-six years Wales competed against their दो biggest विरोधियों, इंग्लैण्ड और फ़्रांस, in the European Nations Cup, winning the trophy four times.
Wales have also competed in the World Cup on तीन अवसरों, the first time being in 1975.
In 1995 and 2000 they had their most successful tournaments to date, surprisingly making the Semi-Finals on both occasions before being beaten by इंग्लैण्ड और ऑस्ट्रेलिया क्रमशः.
Wales failed to qualify for the 2008 World Cup, being the दूसरी उच्चतम ranked side not to do so, having lost to Scotland on points difference over two matches.
In 2008 Australian John Dixon became the new सिर कोच और appointed Lee Briers as captain, having played for Wales since 1998.
In हाल सीज़न वेल्स have लिया विशाल strides under former player Iestyn Harris who has coached Wales to back to back European Cup successes, which culminated in a Four Nations appearance in 2011.
Cardiomyopathy ( literally `` heart muscle disease '' ) is the measurable deterioration of the फलन of the myocardium ( the दिल मांसपेशी ) लिये कोई कारण, usually leading to heart failure ; common symptoms are dyspnea ( breathlessness ) and peripheral edema ( swelling of the legs ).
People with cardiomyopathy are often at risk of dangerous forms of irregular दिल ताल और sudden cardiac death.
The most आम रूप of cardiomyopathy is dilated cardiomyopathy.
Fuck in its literal meaning refers to the act of sexual intercourse.
It is an English word that is often used as a profanity, either to denote तिरस्कार or as an intensifier.
The उत्पत्ति of the word is obscure.
It is usually considered to be first attested to around 1475, but it may be considerably older.
In modern usage, fuck and its डेरिवेटिव ( ऐसे as कमीने and fucking ) can be used in the position of a noun, a verb, an adjective or an adverb.
There are many common phrases which make use of the word, as well as a number of compounds incorporating it, such as motherfucker.

the संयुक्त राज्य is घर to the largest यात्री गाडी मार्केट of कोई देश in the संसार.
Overall, there were an estimated 254.4 million registered passenger vehicles in the United States according to a 2007 DOT study.
This number, along with the average age of vehicles, has increased steadily since 1960, indicating a growing क्रमांक of vehicles per capita.
The Chinese car market, however, is poised to soon exceed the United राज्य ; by the end of 2012, there were over 240 million cars on the road in China.
The United States is also home to three large गाडी निर्माताओं : General Motors, Ford Motor Company and Chrysler, which have historically been referred to as the `` Big Three. ''
Chrysler however is no longer among the शीर्ष तीन ; but is number five, behind Toyota and Honda.
The मोटर car रै clearly become an integral part of American life, with vehicles outnumbering licensed drivers.
Clinical laboratory in a Hospital setting showing several स्वचालित analysers.
A medical laboratory or clinical laboratory is a laboratory where tests are done on clinical specimens in order to get सूचना परिचय the health of a patient as pertaining to the diagnosis, treatment, and prevention of disease.
In poker, players construct hands of five cards according to predetermined rules, which vary according to जिससे variant of poker is being played.
These हैंड्स हैं compared using a हाथ रैंकिंग प्रणाली कि is standard across all variants of poker, the player with the highest-ranking hand winning that particular deal in most variants of poker.
In some variants, the lowest-ranking hand can win or tie.
These hand rankings are also प्रयुक्त in कुछ other card games, and in poker dice.
The ranking of a particular हाथ is increased by सहित अनेक ताश of the same card rank, by all five cards being from the same suit, or by all five cards being of consecutive rank.
The relative ranking of the various hand categories is based on the संभाव्यता of होने randomly dealt such a hand from a well- shuffled deck.
Bruce Randall hornsby ( born November 23, 1954 ) is an American virtuoso ; a singer, pianist, synthesizer, accordion, and dulcimer player, and songwriter.
Known for the spontaneity and creativity of his live performances, Hornsby draws frequently from classical, jazz, bluegrass, folk, Motown, gospel, rock, blues, and jam band musical परंपराओं साथ उसके songwriting और the seamless improvisations contained within.
Hornsby 's रिकार्डिंग have महरूम recognised on a क्रमांक of अवसरों with industry awards, including the Best New Artist Grammy in 1987 with Bruce Hornsby and the Range, the Best Bluegrass Recording Grammy in 1990, and the Best Pop Instrumental Grammy in 1993.
Hornsby has also achieved recognition for his solo albums and performances, उसके touring बैंड ब्रूस hornsby और the noisemakers, his bluegrass project with Ricky Skaggs and his appearances as a session- and guest-musician.
He also collaborated साथ आभारी मुर्दे और थी a सदस्य of the बैंड इससे सितंबर 1990 to कूच 1992, playing at over एक सौ shows दौरान कि काल.
Sugarcane plantation in ग्रामीण Cuba
कृषि in क्यूबा रै निभाई an important part in the economy for several hundred years.
Agriculture contributes less than 10 percent to the gross domestic उत्पाद ( GDP ), but it employs roughly 20 percent of the working population.
About 30 percent of the country 's land is used for क्रॉप cultivation.
The inefficient agricultural industry in Cuba has led to the need to आयात विशाल amounts of foods.
Cuba now imports about 80 % of the food it rations to the public.
The rationing program accounts for about a तीसरा of the food energy the average Cuban consumes.
Overall, however, Cuba is निर्भर on imports for only 16 % of its food.

Mega Millions ( initially called The Big Game Mega Millions as the successor of The Big Game ) is an American multi-jurisdictional $ 1 lottery game.
The first ( The Big Game ) Mega लाखो drawing was in 2002 ( see below ).
The minimum Mega Millions advertised jackpot is $ 12,000,000, paid in 26 equal yearly installments ( unless the नकदी विकल्प is चुनी ) ; usually, the jackpot increases when there is no top-prize winner.
However, despite no जैकपॉट विजेता लिये the $ 12,000,000 December 18, 2012 drawing, the jackpot remained at $ 12,000,000 for the drawing to be held on December 21.
( See नीचे लिये सूचना on how the game 's jackpot is funded. )
Reflecting common practice among American lotteries, the jackpot is advertised as a nominal value of सालाना किश्तों.
A cash value option ( the usual choice ), when chosen by a jackpot winner ( देखिए नीचे ), pays the approximate present value of the installments.
Mega Millions currently uses a 5/56 ( white balls ) plus 1/46 ( the Mega Ball ) double मेट्रिक्स to चुनें इसके जीतना संख्याएँ.
Each खेल costs $ 1.
In 43 of the 44 Mega Millions jurisdictions ( कैलिफ़ोर्निया is the एक्सेप्शन ), वहीँ is an option, called Megaplier ( such games are $ 2 each ) where non-jackpot prizes are multiplied by 2, 3, or 4.
The Megaplier थी बना उपलब्धियाँ to सब आचमन Millions jurisdictions in January 2011 ; it began as a Texas -only option.
Mega Millions is drawn at 10:59 p.m. Eastern time Tuesdays and Fridays, including छुट्टियाँ.
Mega Millions is administered by a consortium of its 12 original lotteries and the drawings हैं आयोजित at wsb-tv in Atlanta, Georgia.
supervised by the जॉर्जिया Lottery.
The largest jackpot in Mega Millions, as well as in American lottery history, was $ 656,000,000 annuitized ( with a cash option of $ 474,000,000 ) for the March 30, 2012 drawing in जिससे वहीँ यहूद तीन jackpot-winning टिकटें ; one each in Illinois, Kansas, and Maryland.
All three tickets had महरूम claimed as of April 18, with each set of winners choosing the cash option.
is a Japanese manga series created by writer tsugumi ohba and manga artist Takeshi Obata.
The main character is लाइट yagami, a ऊँची स्कूल छात्र who discovers a supernatural notebook, the `` Death Note '', dropped on Earth by a shinigami ( a god of death ) named Ryuk.
The Death Note grants its user the ability to kill anyone whose name and face they know, by लिखने the नाम in the notebook while picturing their face.
The series centers around Light 's attempt to create and नियम a संसार `` cleansed of evil '' as `` God '' using the notebook, and the efforts of a detective known as L to stop him.
Death Note was first serialized in 108 chapters by shueisha in the Japanese manga magazine Weekly Shōnen Jump from December 2003 to May 2006.
The series was also published in tankōbon स्वरूप in जापानी starting in May 2004 and ending in October 2006 with a total of thirteen volumes.
The anime series aired in Japan इससे अक्तूबर 3, 2006, to June 26, 2007.
Composed of 37 episodes, the anime थी विकसित by Madhouse and directed by Tetsuro Araki.
A light novel based on the series, written by Nisio Isin, was released in Japan.
Additionally, विभिन्न video games have been published by Konami for Nintendo DS.
The series was adapted into live-action films released in Japan on जून 17, 2006, नवम्बर 3, 2006, and February 2, 2008.
Viz Media licensed the Death Note manga in North America and has published all the twelve volumes from the series, a 13th volume which serves as a `` reader 's मार्गदर्शिका '', as खूब as the लाइट novels.
The episodes from the anime first appeared in उत्तर अमेरिका as downloadable by IGN.
Viz later licensed the anime series और it aired on Bionix in Canada and on Cartoon Network in the United States.
The live-action films briefly निभाई in certain North American theaters since 2008.
However, none of the video games have thus far been प्रकाशित in उत्तर America or Europe.
Death Note is one of Weekly shōnen jumps best-selling manga series of all time, with sales over 26.5 million copies.
Halloween or Hallowe'en ( a contraction of `` All Hallows ' Evening `` ), also known as All hallows ' संध्या, is a वार्षिक celebration observed in a number of countries on October 31, the eve of the Western Christian feast of All Hallows ( or All Saints ) and the day initiating the triduum of Hallowmas.
According to many scholars, All hallows ' संध्या is a Christianised feast originally influenced by western European harvest festivals, and festivals of the dead with possible pagan roots, particularly the Celtic Samhain.
Other scholars maintain that it originated independently of Samhain and has solely Christian roots.
Typical festive Halloween activities include trick-or-treating ( also known as `` guising `` ), attending costume parties, carving pumpkins into jack-o'-lanterns, lighting bonfires, apple bobbing, visiting haunted attractions, playing pranks, telling scary stories, and watching हॉरर films.
New York City taxicabs during Midtown rush hour in मैनहटन
The taxicabs of नई यॉर्क नगर, साथ their distinctive yellow paint, are a widely recognized icon of the city.
Taxicabs हैं संचालित by निजी कंपनियाँ और licensed by the New York City Taxi and Limousine Commission ( TLC ).
It also oversees over 40,000 other for-hire vehicles, including `` black cars '', commuter वैन और ambulettes.
`` Medallion taxis, '' the परिचित पीला कैब, हैं the only vehicles in the city permitted to pick up passengers in response to a street hail.
schematic क्रॉस खण्ड of part of leaf, xylem shown as red circles at figure 8.
Xylem is one of the two types of हस्तांतरण ऊतक in vascular plants ( phloem is the other ).
The word xylem is derived from the Greek word ξύλον ( xylon ), meaning `` wood '' ; the best-known xylem ऊतक is लकडी, हालांकि it is मिला throughout the plant.
Its basic function is to transport water, but it भी transports some nutrients through the plant.
U.S. women suffragists demonstrating for the right to vote, February 1913.
Women 's suffrage also known as woman suffrage is the right of महिलाओं to vote and to run for office.
Limited voting rights were gained by women in Sweden, Finland and some western U.S. राज्य in the late 19th century.
International organizations were formed to coordinate efforts, especially the अंतरराष्ट्रीय परिषद of महिलाओं ( 1888 ) and the International Woman Suffrage Alliance ( 1904 ).
In 1893, New Zealand, then a self-governing British colony, granted adult women the right to vote and the self-governing अंग्रेजों उपनिवेश of South Australia did the same in 1895, but also permitted women to run for office.
Australia federated in 1901, and women acquired the right to vote and stand in federal चुनावों from 1902, though uneven restrictions on Aboriginal women voting in national elections were not completely removed until 1962.
The first European country to introduce women 's suffrage was the Grand Duchy of Finland, then part of the Russian साम्राज्य, जिससे भी उत्पादित the संसार 's पहला मादा members of parliament in the 1907 parliamentary elections.
Norway followed, granting full महिलाओं 's suffrage in 1913.
In most Western countries, women 's suffrage came after World I War I I, साथ कुछ महत्वपूर्ण लेट अनुकूलक being France in 1944 and Switzerland in 1971.
Women 's suffrage has generally been पहचाना बाद राजनैतिक campaigns to obtain it were waged.
In many countries it was granted before सार्वभौमिक suffrage.
Women 's suffrage is explicitly stated as a right अंतर्गत the सम्मेलन on the Elimination of All Forms of Discrimination Against Women, adopted by the United Nations in 1979.
