Jehovah 's Witnesses is a millenarian restorationist Christian denomination with nontrinitarian beliefs distinct from mainstream Christianity.Sources for descriptors : • Millenarian : • Restorationist : • Christian : • Denomination : The organization reports worldwide membership of over 7.78 million adherents involved in evangelism, सम्मेलन उपस्थिति of over 12 लाख, और annual Memorial attendance of over 19 million.
They are directed by the Governing Body of Jehovah 's Witnesses, a group of elders in Brooklyn, New York, that establishes all doctrines.
Jehovah 's Witnesses ' beliefs हैं आधारित on their interpretations of the Bible and they prefer to use their own translation, the New World Translation of the Holy Scriptures.
They believe that the destruction of the present world system at Armageddon is imminent, and that the establishment of God 's kingdom on earth is the only solution लिये सब problems faced by mankind.
The group emerged from the Bible Student movement —founded in the late 1870s by Charles Taze Russell with the formation of Zion 's Watch Tower Tract Society —with significant organizational and doctrinal changes under the leadership of Joseph Franklin Rutherford.
The name Jehovah 's गवाह, आधारित on यशायाह 43:10–12, थी अपनाया in 1931 to distinguish themselves from other Bible Student groups and symbolize a break with the legacy of Russell 's traditions.
Jehovah 's Witnesses are best known for their door-to-door preaching, distributing literature such as The बुर्ज और जाग !
, and refusing military service and blood transfusions.
They consider use of the name Jehovah vital for proper इबादत.
They reject Trinitarianism, inherent immortality of the soul, and hellfire, जिससे वे consider to be unscriptural doctrines.
They do not observe क्रिसमस, Easter, birthdays, or other holidays and customs they consider to have pagan origins incompatible with Christianity.
Adherents commonly refer to उनके देह of beliefs as `` the truth '' and consider themselves to be `` in the truth ''.
They consider secular society to be morally corrupt and under the influence of शैतानी, और सबसे limit their social interaction with non-Witnesses.
Congregational disciplinary actions शामिल disfellowshipping, their term for formal expulsion and shunning.
Baptized individuals who formally leave are considered disassociated और हैं भी shunned.
Disfellowshipped and disassociated individuals may eventually be reinstated if deemed repentant.
the धर्म 's स्थिति regarding ईमानदार आपत्ति to सैन्य सेवा और refusal to सलाम नेशनल ध्वज रै brought it into विरोध साथ कुछ सरकारें.
Consequently, Jehovah 's Witnesses have been persecuted और उनके activities are banned or restricted in some countries.
Persistent legal challenges by Jehovah 's Witnesses have influenced legislation related to civil अधिकारों in several countries.
Last Tango in Paris ( ) is a 1972 franco-italian रोमांटिक Drama film directed by Bernardo Bertolucci which portrays a recent American widower who begins an anonymous sexual relationship with a young, betrothed Parisian woman.
It stars Marlon ब्रैंडो, Maria Schneider, and Jean-Pierre Léaud.
the फिल्मी 's कच्चा portrayal of sexual violence and emotional turmoil led to international controversy and drew various levels of government censorship.
The MPAA gave the film an X rating upon release in the United States.
After revisions यहूद made to the MPAA ratings code, it was classified as an NC-17 in 1997.
mgm released a censored R-rated cut in 1981.
The फिल्मी has its NC-17 rating for `` some explicit sexual content. ''
Windows XP is an operating system produced by Microsoft for use on personal computers, including home and business desktops, laptops and media centers.
First released to computer manufacturers on August 24, 2001, it is the second most popular version of Windows, based on installed user base.
The name `` xp '' is short for `` eXPerience '', highlighting the enhanced user experience.
Windows XP, the successor to Windows 2000 and Windows ME, was the first consumer-oriented operating system produced by microsoft to be निर्मित on the खिड़कियाँ NT kernel.
Windows XP was released worldwide for retail बिक्री on October 25, 2001, and over 400 million copies were in use in January 2006.
it थी succeeded by Windows Vista in January 2007.
Direct OEM and retail sales of Windows XP ceased on जून 30, 2008.
Microsoft continued to sell Windows XP through their System Builders ( smaller OEMs who sell assembled computers ) program until January 31, 2009.
on अप्रैल 10, 2012, Microsoft reaffirmed that extended support for Windows XP and Office 2003 would end on April 8, 2014 and suggested that administrators begin preparing to migrate to a newer OS.
The NT -आधारd संस्करण of खिड़कियाँ, जिससे are programmed in C, C++, and assembly, are known for their improved stability and efficiency over the 9x versions of Microsoft Windows.
Windows XP presented a significantly redesigned graphical user इंटरफ़ेस, a बदलें Microsoft promoted as more user-friendly than previous versions of Windows.
In an attempt to further ameliorate the `` DLL hell `` that plagued the past versions of Windows, improved side-by-side assembly technology in Windows XP allows side-by-side installation, registration and servicing of multiple versions of globally shared software components in full isolation.
It is also the first version of Windows to use product सक्रियण to combat illegal copying.
During Windows XP 's development, the project was codenamed `` Whistler '', after Whistler, British Columbia, as many Microsoft employees skied at the Whistler-Blackcomb ski resort.
According to web analytics data उत्पन्न by जाल अनुप्रयोग, खिड़कियाँ xp थी the most widely used operating system until August 2012, when Windows 7 overtook it.
, Windows XP market share is at 38.99 %, having decreased लगभग every month since at least November 2007, the first month for which statistics are publicly available from Net Applications.
`` Por una Cabeza '' is an Argentine tango with music और गीत लिखा in 1935 by Carlos Gardel and Alfredo Le Pera respectively.
The name is a Spanish horse-racing phrase meaning `` by a head '', which refers to a घोड़ा winning a race by the length of one head.
The lyrics speak of a compulsive horse-track gambler who compares his addiction for horses with his attraction to महिलाओं.
Alfredo Le Pera was a Brazilian from São Paulo, a much Italian-influenced area in Brazil, and also the birthplace of zequinha de abreu, composer of tico-tico no fubá.
Le प्रभा और gardel died in an airplane crash in Medellín, ( Colombia ), on June 24, 1935.
Por una cabeza
The tango has since महरूम performed by numerous tango orchestras.
Tango scenes with `` Por una Cabeza '' appear in Delicatessen ( 1991 ), सैंट of a स्त्री ( 1992 ), schindler 's सूची ( 1993 ), सच्चा झूठ ( 1994 ), टाइटैनिक ( 1996 ), Bad Santa ( Uncut Version, 2003 ), All the King 's Men ( 2006 ), Planet 51 ( 2009 ), episode 37 of Nip/Tuck ( 2003–2010 ), episode 9 of South Korean drama series Sweet Spy ( 2005–08 ), the beginning and ending credits of the South Korean drama broadcast I 'm Sorry, I Love You ( 2004 ), and the episode `` Down the Rabbit Hole `` ( 2007 ).
In the movie Frida ( Salma Hayek, 2002 ), Gardel is heard singing it on a रेडियो.
It is also quoted in David Del Tredici 's `` शुभ News !
Nilda is Back '' ( from the song cycle Miz Inez Sez ).
In Scent of a Woman ( 1992 ), the tango is performed by the `` The Tango Project '', who actually appear in the dancing scene starring Al Pacino ( the recording used is available on one of their CD albums ).
John Williams arranged a संस्करण of the piece that appears on the album `` Cinema Serenade '' with the violin solo performed by Itzhak Perlman.
Perlman and Williams ( conducting ) have भी performed the piece together in live concerts.
In 2012 a dance version was released by the group `` Da Carrera '' featuring the original vocal रिकॉर्डिंग by कार्लोस Gardel.
The baroreflex or baroreceptor reflex is एक of the देह 's homeostatic mechanisms for maintaining blood pressure.
It provides a negative feedback loop in which an elevated blood pressure reflexively causes heart rate to decrease therefore causing blood pressure to घटी ; likewise, decreased blood pressure activates the baroreflex, causing heart rate to increase thus causing an increase in blood pressure.
The system relies on specialized न्यूरॉन्स, ज्ञात as baroreceptors, in the aortic arch, carotid sinuses, and elsewhere to monitor changes in blood pressure and relay them to the brainstem.
subsequent परिवर्तन in blood pressure are mediated by the autonomic nervous system.
Atrial natriuretic peptide forms a parallel negative feedback लूप in an endocrinological कंट्रास्ट to the renin-angiotensin system.
The Loma Prieta earthquake, also known as the Quake of '89 and the World Series Earthquake, was a major earthquake that struck the San Francisco Bay Area of California on अक्तूबर 17, 1989, at 5:04 pm लोकल time.
Caused by a slip along the San Andreas Fault, the भूकंप lasted 10–15 seconds and measured 6.9 on both the moment magnitude scale ( surface-wave magnitude 7.1 ) and on the open-ended Richter Scale.
The quake killed 63 people throughout उत्तरी California, injured 3,757 and left some 3,000–12,000 people homeless.
The earthquake occurred during the warm-up practice for the third game of the 1989 World Series, featuring both of the Bay Area 's प्रमुख लीग बेसबॉल टीमों, the Oakland Athletics and the San Francisco Giants.
Because of game-related sports coverage, this was the first major earthquake in the संयुक्त राज्य to have its initial jolt broadcast live on television.
Pawn in the मानक Staunton pattern
The pawn ( ♙♟ ) is the most numerous and in most circumstances the weakest piece in the game of शतरंज, historically representing infantry or, more particularly, armed peasants or pikemen.
In chess, each player begins the game with eight pawns, one on each square of the rank तत्काल in front of the other pieces.
( In algebraic notation, the white pawns start on a2, b2, c2,..., h2, while black pawns start on a7, b7, c7,..., h7. )
Individual pawns are referred to by the संचिका on which they stand.
For example, one speaks of `` White 's f-pawn '' or `` Black 's b-pawn '', or less commonly ( using descriptive notation ), `` White 's किंग 's बिशप साहूकार '' or `` Black 's queen 's knight pawn ''.
It is also common to refer to a rook pawn, meaning any pawn on the a- or h-file, a knight pawn ( on the b- or g-file ), a bishop pawn ( on the c- or f-file ), a queen pawn ( on the d-file ), a king pawn ( on the e-file ), and a central pawn ( on either the d- or e-file ).
The military forces of the world have differing approaches to the enlistment of homosexual ( gay और lesbian ) and bisexual individuals.
The armed forces of most developed countries have अभी removed policies excluding non-heterosexual individuals ( with strict policies on sexual harassment ).
Nations that permit gay people to serve openly in the सैन्य include the 4 of the 5 members of the UN Security Council ( United States, United Kingdom, France, and Russia ), the Republic of China ( Taiwan ), Australia, Israel, South Africa, Argentina, and all NATO members excluding Turkey.
Hydrogen उत्पादन is the family of industrial methods for generating hydrogen.
Currently the dominant प्रौद्योगिकी लिये सीधा production is steam reforming from hydrocarbons.
अनेक अन्य methods are known including electrolysis and thermolysis.
In 2006, the United States थी अनुमानित to have a production capacity of 11 million tonnes of hydrogen.
5 million tonnes of hydrogen were consumed on-site in oil refining, and in the production of ammonia ( Haber process ) and methanol ( reduction of carbon monoxide ).
0.4 million टन यहूद an incidental by-product of the chlor-alkali process.
हाइड्रोजन उत्पादन is an अनुमानित $ 100 अरब उद्योग.
A basis point ( often denoted as bp, colloquially referred to in the plural as `` bips '', also known as a `` बीप '' ) is a unit equal to one hundredth of a percentage point, or one part per ten thousand, 1/10000.
The same unit is also ( rarely ) called a permyriad, literally meaning 'for ( every ) myriad ( ten thousand ) ', and in that context is written with which looks like a percent sign ( % ) with two extra zeroes at the end ( like a stylized form of the four zeros in the denominator, although it originates as a natural extension of the percent ( % ) and permille ( ‰ ) signs ).
A आधार पाइंट is defined as:
1 basis point = 1 permyriad = one one-hundredth percent
1 bp = 1 = 0.01 % = 0.1‰ = 10−4 = = 0.0001
1 % = 100 bp = 100
Basis points are used as a convenient unit of मापन in contexts जहाँ प्रतिशत differences of less than 1 % are discussed.
The सबसे आम उदाहरण is ब्याज दरों, where differences in interest rates of less than 1 % per year are usually meaningful to talk about.
For example, a difference of 0.10 percentage अंक is समतुल्य to a बदलें of 10 आधार अंक ( e.g. a 4.67 % rate increases by 10 basis points to 4.77 % ).
Like percentage अंक, आधार अंक avoid the ambiguity between relative and absolute discussions about interest rates by dealing only with the absolute change in numeric value of a rate.
For example, if a report says there has महरूम a `` 1 % बढ़ाएँ '' इससे a 10 % ब्याज रेट, इस could refer to an increase either from 10 % to 10.1 % ( relative, 1 % of 10 % ), or from 10 % to 11 % ( absolute, 1 % plus 10 % ).
If, however, the report says there has been a `` 10 basis point बढ़ाएँ '' इससे a 10 % interest rate, then we know that the interest rate of 10 % has increased by 0.10 % ( the absolute change ) to a 10.1 % rate.
It is common practice in the financial industry to use basis points to denote a rate change in a financial यंत्र, or the difference ( spread ) between two interest rates, including the yields of fixed-income securities.
Since certain loans and bonds may commonly be quoted in relation to some index or underlying security, they will often be quoted as a स्प्रेड over ( or under ) the index.
For example, a loan that bears interest of 0.50 % per annum ऊपर the लंदन interbank offered Rate ( LIBOR ) is said to be 50 basis points over LIBOR, which is commonly expressed as `` L+50bps '' or simply `` L+50 ''.
The term `` आधार पाइंट '' रै इसके origins in trading the `` basis '' or the spread between two interest rates.
Since the basis is प्रायः छोटी, ये हैं कोटेड multiplied up by 10000, and hence a `` full point '' movement in the `` basis '' is a basis point.
Contrast साथ pips in FX forward markets.
The relationship between percentage changes and basis points can be summarized as follows : 1 percentage point change = 100 basis points, and 0.01 percentage points = 1 आधार पाइंट.
So, a bond whose yield increases from 5 % to 5.5 % is said to increase by 50 basis points ; or interest rates that have risen 1 percentage point are said to have increased by 100 basis points.
The अंग्रेजों royal परिवार is the group of close relatives of the monarch of the United Kingdom.
The term is also commonly लागू to the same group of people who are the relations of the monarch in her or his role as sovereign of any of the other Commonwealth realms, thus sometimes at variance with official national terms for the family.
Members of the Royal Family belong to, either by birth or marriage, the House of विंडसर, चूंकि 1917, जब जार्ज v बदला the name of the royal house from Saxe-Coburg and Gotha.
This decision was primarily taken because Britain and her Empire were at war with Germany and given the British Royal Family 's strong German ancestry ; it was felt that its public image could be improved by choosing a more अंग्रेजों हाउस नाम.
The new name chosen, Windsor, had absolutely no connection other than as the name of the castle which was and continues to be a royal निवास.
Although in the United Kingdom there is no strict legal or formal definition of who is or is not a member of the Royal Family, and different lists will include different people, those carrying the style Her or His Majesty ( HM ), or Her or His Royal Highness ( HRH ) are always considered members, which usually results in the application of the term to the monarch, the consort of the monarch, the widowed consorts of previous monarchs, the children of the monarch and previous monarchs, the male-line grandchildren of the monarch and previous monarchs, and the spouses and the widows of a monarch 's and previous monarch 's sons and male-line पोते.
On 30 November 1917, King George V issued Letters Patent defining who are members of the Royal परिवार ; the टेक्स्ट of the सूचना from the London Gazette is as follows:
In 1996, Her Majesty the महारानी परिवर्धित these Letters Patent, as was evidenced by this Notice from the London Gazette:
In 2013 Letters Patent were issued to extend a शीर्षक और a स्टाइल borne by members of the Royal Family to additional persons to be born, evidenced by this Notice from the London Gazette:
Members and relatives of the British Royal Family historically represented the monarch in various places throughout the अंग्रेजों साम्राज्य, sometimes for extended periods as viceroys, or for specific ceremonies or events.
Today, they often perform ceremonial and social duties throughout the United Kingdom and abroad on behalf of the United Kingdom.
Aside from the monarch, their only constitutional role in the affairs of government is to serve, if eligible and when appointed by letters patent, as a Counsellor of State, two or more of whom कसरत the प्राधिकार of the क्राउन ( within stipulated limits ) in the indisposal or absence from the British realm of the monarch.
In the other realms of the Commonwealth royalty do not serve as counsellors of State.
However in each such realm the monarch 's family members may act on behalf of, are funded by, and represent the sovereign of that particular state, and not the United Kingdom.
The Queen, her consort, her children and grandchildren, as well as all former sovereigns ' children and grandchildren hold places in the first भाग of the official orders of precedence in England and Wales, Scotland, and Northern Ireland.
Wives of the said enjoy their husbands ' पूर्वता, और पतियों of princesses are unofficially but habitually placed with their wives as well.
However, the Queen changed the private order of पूर्वता in the royal परिवार in पक्ष of राजकुमारियों Anne and Alexandra, who henceforth take private precedence over the Duchess of Cornwall, who is otherwise the realm 's highest ranking woman after the Queen herself.
She did not alter the सापेक्ष पूर्वता of अन्य born-princesses, such as the daughters of her younger sons.
हैती ( ; haitian Creole Ayiti ), officially the Republic of Haiti ( ; ), is a Caribbean country.
It occupies the पश्चिमी, छोटी portion of the island of Hispaniola, in the Greater Antillean archipelago, which it shares with the Dominican Republic.
Ayiti ( land of high mountains ) was the स्वदेशी Taíno or Amerindian name for the island.
The country 's highest point is pic la Selle, at.
The total area of Haiti is and its capital is port-au-prince.
Haitian Creole and French हैं the official languages.
Haiti 's regional, historical, and ethno-linguistic स्थिति is unique for several reasons.
It was the first independent nation of लैटिन अमेरिका और the caribbean, the पहला ब्लैक -led गणतंत्र in the world, and the second republic in the Americas when it gained independence in 1804 as part of a successful slave revolution lasting nearly a decade.
In 2012, Haiti announced its intention to तलाश संबद्ध membership status in the African Union.
Haiti is the most populous of the predominantly francophone स्वतंत्र nations in the Americas.
It is one of only two independent nations in the americas ( साथ साथ Canada ) to designate French as an official language ; the other French-speaking areas are all overseas départements, or collectivités, of France.
Haiti is the most populous पूरा member-state of the Caribbean Community ( CARICOM ).
It is the poorest country in the Americas as measured by the इंसान Development Index.
Political violence has occurred regularly throughout its history, leading to government instability.
Most recently, in February 2004, a coup d'état originating in the उत्तर of the देश मजबूर the इस्तीफा and exile of President Jean-Bertrand Aristide.
A provisional government took control with security provided by the United Nations Stabilization Mission in हैती ( minustah ).
Michel Martelly, the वर्तमान अध्यक्ष, was elected in the Haitian general election, 2011.
The द्वीप रै था a history of destructive earthquakes.
A 7.0 magnitude भूकंप struck हैती on 12 January 2010 and devastated Port-au-Prince.
The highest reliable मौत गिनती was estimated at 220,000.
Haitian government estimates were उच्चतर.
The Presidential palace, Parliament and अनेक अन्य महत्वपूर्ण structures were destroyed, along with countless homes and businesses, leaving hundreds of thousands of people homeless.
The country has yet to recover from the 2010 earthquake ( and subsequent incidents ) due to दोनो the गंभीरता of the damage Haiti endured in 2010, as well as a government that was ineffective well before the earthquake.
संयुक्त राज्य aid organizations have donated $ 2 billion.
Combined with अन्य अंतरराष्ट्रीय दान, these funds are intended to contribute to the rebuilding of the country.
The Bloody Beetroots is the pseudonym of Sir Bob Cornelius Rifo, the Italian electro house and dance-punk music निर्माता, DJ and photographer.
The Bloody Beetroots is well-known for the black Venom mask he wears during performances.
In fact, the only identifying public feature of Rifo is the year `` 1977 '' tattooed across his chest, which is both the साल कि the निर्माता and punk-rock was born.
`` The खूनी Beetroots DJ set '' contains Sir Bob Cornelius Rifo and Tommy Tea.
A Motorola सलाहकार alphanumeric pager used in Brazil in the 1990s, operated by Teletrim
A pager is a wireless telecommunications device that receives and displays numeric or टेक्स्ट संदेश, or receives और announces आवाज़ संदेश.
One-way pagers can only receive messages, while response pagers and two-way pagers can also acknowledge, जवाब to, और originate संदेश using an internal transmitter.
Pagers operate as part of a paging system which includes one or more fixed transmitters ( or in the मामला of जवाब pagers और two-way pagers, एक or more base stations ), as well as a number of pagers carried by mobile users.
These systems can range from a restaurant system with a single low-power transmitter, to a देशभर प्रणाली साथ thousands of high-power base stations.
One of the first practical paging services was शुभारम्भ in 1950 लिये physicians in the नई York City area.
Physicians paid US $ 12 per month for the service and carried a ( 6 oz ) पेजर कि होता प्राप्त फोन संदेश भीतर ( 25 mi ) of a single transmitter tower.
The system was manufactured by the Reevesound Company and operated by telanswerphone.
In 1960, John Francis Mitchell combined elements of Motorola 's Walkie Talkie and automobile radio technologies to create the first transistorized pager, और इससे इस पाइंट, paging प्रौद्योगिकी जारी to advance, and pager adoption continued to expand, until the early 1990s.
However, by the mid-1990s, as सेल्यूलर technologies became cheaper and more widely available, advanced services began to displace paging as a commercial product.
Today, pagers exist largely as niche products, finding preferential use in applications such as hospitals, public safety, and retail locations where their सादगी, ऊँची reliability, and low cost represent significant advantages.
Reevesville is a town in Dorchester County, South Carolina, संयुक्त राज्य.
the जनसांख्यिकी थी 196 at the 2010 जनसांख्यिकी.
As defined by the U.S. Office of Management and Budget, and used by the U.S. Census Bureau for statistical purposes only, Reevesville is included within the Charleston-North Charleston-Summerville महानगर area.
Frida Kahlo de Rivera ( born Magdalena Carmen Frieda Kahlo y Calderón ; July 6, 1907 – July 13, 1954 ) थी a मैक्सिकन चित्रकार, born in Coyoacán, who is best known for her self-portraits.
Kahlo 's जीवन began और ended in Mexico City, in her home known as the Blue House.
She gave her birth date as July 7, 1910, but her birth certificate shows जुलाई 6, 1907.
Kahlo had allegedly wanted the year of her birth to coincide with the year of the beginning of the मैक्सिकन क्रान्ति so that her life would begin with the birth of modern Mexico.
Her कार्य रै महरूम मनाये in Mexico as emblematic of national and indigenous tradition, and by feminists for its uncompromising depiction of the female experience and form.
Mexican culture and Amerindian cultural tradition are important in उसके कार्य, जिससे रै महरूम sometimes characterized as Naïve art or folk art.
Her work has also been described as `` surrealist '', and in 1938 André Breton, principal initiator of the surrealist गति, वर्णित kahlo 's आर्ट as a `` रिबन around a bomb ''.
Kahlo had a volatile marriage with the प्रसिद्ध Mexican artist Diego Rivera.
She suffered lifelong स्वास्थ्य problems.
Many of her health problems यहूद the परिणाम of a traffic accident she survived as a teenager.
recovering इससे उसके चोटों isolated her from other people and this isolation influenced her works, many of which are self-portraits of one sort or another.
Kahlo सुझाया, `` i पेंट खुद because I am so often alone and because I am the subject I know best. ''
She also stated, `` I थी born a bitch.
I was born a painter. ''

Theresienwiese on the day before Oktoberfest 2006
Oktoberfest is a 16-day festival celebrating beer held annually in Munich, Bavaria, Germany, running from late September to the first weekend in October.
It is one of the most famous कार्यक्रम in जर्मनी and is the world 's largest fair, with more than 6 million people from around the world attending the event every year.
To the locals, it is not called Oktoberfest, but `` die Wiesn '', after the colloquial name of the fairgrounds themselves.
The Oktoberfest is an important part of Bavarian culture, having महरूम आयोजित since 1810.
Other cities across the world also थाम oktoberfest जश्न, modeled after the original Munich event.
the म्यूनिख Oktoberfest originally took place during the sixteen days up to, and including, the first Sunday in October.
In 1994, the schedule was modified in response to German reunification so that if the first Sunday in October falls on the 1st or 2nd, तब the पर्व would go on until October 3 ( German Unity Day ).
Thus, the festival is now 17 days when the first Sunday is October 2 and 18 days when it is October 1.
In 2010, the festival lasted जबतक the first Monday in October, to mark the anniversary of the event.
The festival is held in an area named the theresienwiese ( फ़ील्ड, or मर्ग, of Therese ), often called Wiesn for short, located near Munich 's center.
Large quantities of Oktoberfest Beer are consumed, with almost 7 million liters served दौरान the 16 दिन festival in 2007.
Visitors may also enjoy a wide variety of traditional food such as Hendl ( chicken ), Schweinebraten ( roast pork ), Schweinshaxe ( grilled ham hock ), Steckerlfisch ( grilled fish on a stick ), Würstl ( sausages ) along with Brezeln ( Pretzel ), Knödel ( potato or bread dumplings ), Käsespätzle ( चीज नूडल्स ), reiberdatschi ( potato pancakes ), Sauerkraut or Rotkohl/Blaukraut ( red cabbage ) along with such Bavarian delicacies as Obatzda ( a spiced cheese-butter spread ) and Weisswurst ( a white sausage ).
A platter with cheese and garnishes
पहियों of Gouda
Cheese is a जेनेरिक पद लिये a विविध group of milk-based food products.
Cheese is produced in wide-ranging जायका, बनावट, and forms.
Cheese consists of प्रोटीन और fat from milk, usually the milk of cows, buffalo, goats, or sheep.
It is produced by coagulation of the मिल्क प्रोटीन casein.
Typically, the milk is acidified और जोड of the enzyme rennet causes coagulation.
The solids are separated and pressed into final form.
Some cheeses have molds on the rind or throughout.
Most cheeses melt at cooking तापमान.
Hundreds of types of cheese from विभिन्न देशों are produced.
Their styles, textures and flavors depend on the origin of the milk ( including the एनिमल 's आहार ), whether वे have महरूम pasteurized, the butterfat content, the bacteria and mold, the processing, and aging.
Herbs, spices, or wood smoke may be used as flavoring agents.
the पीला to रेड रंग of many cheeses, such as Red Leicester, is normally formed from adding annatto.
For a few cheeses, the milk is curdled by adding acids ऐसे as सिरका or lemon juice.
Most cheeses are acidified to a lesser degree by bacteria, which turn milk sugars into lactic acid, तब the जोड of rennet completes the curdling.
शाकाहारी विकल्प to rennet हैं उपलब्धियाँ ; most are produced by fermentation of the fungus Mucor miehei, but others have been extracted from various species of the Cynara thistle family.
Cheese is valued for its portability, long life, and high content of fat, protein, calcium, and phosphorus.
Cheese is more compact and has a longer shelf life than milk, although how long a cheese will keep may depend on the type of चीज ; लेबल्स on पैकेट्स of चीज प्रायः अर्जी that a cheese should be consumed within three to five days of opening.
Generally speaking, hard cheeses last longer than soft cheeses, such as Brie or बकरी 's milk cheese.
cheesemakers निकट a दुग्ध region may benefit from fresher, lower-priced milk, and lower shipping costs.
The long storage life of कुछ चीज, especially if it is encased in a protective rind, allows selling when markets are favorable.
Additional संघटक may be added to कुछ cheeses, such as black peppers, garlic, chives or cranberries.
A specialist seller of चीज is sometimes known as a cheesemonger.
To become an expert in this field, like wine or cooking, requires कुछ formal education and years of tasting and hands-on experience.
This position is typically responsible for all aspects of the cheese inventory ; selecting the cheese menu, purchasing, receiving, भंडार, and ripening.
Legal citation signals are a set of brief abbreviated phrases or words used to clarify the authority or significance of a legal citation as it relates to a proposition.
Signals help a reader quickly discern meaning or उपयोगिता of a particular सन्दर्भ जब the सन्दर्भ itself does not provide adequate information.
Most citation signals are placed in front of the citation to which वे लागू.
For example, in the paragraph When writing a legal argument, it is महत्वपूर्ण to refer to primary sources.
To assist readers in locating these स्त्रोत, it is desirable to use a standardized citation format.
See generally Harvard Law Review Association, The bluebook : a वर्दी प्रणाली of Citation ( 18th ed. 2005 ).
Note, however, that some courts may require any legal papers that are सुपुर्द to उन्हें to conform to a different citation format.
the सिग्नल is the phrase `` देखिए generally, '' जिससे indicates कि the citation `` the bluebook : a वर्दी प्रणाली of citation ( 18th ed. 2005 ) '' provides सामान्य पृष्ठभूमि सूचना on the topic.
Neil Alden Armstrong ( अगस्त 5, 1930 – August 25, 2012 ) was an American astronaut and the first person to walk on the Moon.
He was also an aerospace engineer, naval aviator, परीक्षण पायलट, and university professor.
Before becoming an astronaut, आर्मस्ट्रांग was an officer in the U.S. Navy and served in the Korean War.
After the war, he earned his bachelor 's उपाधि at purdue विश्वविद्यालयों और परोसा as a test pilot at the National Advisory Committee for Aeronautics High-Speed Flight Station, now known as the Dryden Flight Research Center, where he logged over 900 flights.
He later completed graduate studies at the विश्वविद्यालयों of Southern California.
A participant in the U.S. Air Force 's Man in Space Soonest and X-20 Dyna-Soar human spaceflight programs, आर्मस्ट्रांग joined the नासा Astronaut Corps in 1962.
He made his पहला स्पेस उड़ान, as कमांड pilot of Gemini 8, in 1966, becoming NASA 's first civilian astronaut to fly in space.
On this mission, he performed the first डॉकिंग of दो spacecraft, with pilot David Scott.
Armstrong 's second and last spaceflight was as mission commander of the अपोलो 11 moon landing, in July 1969.
On this mission, आर्मस्ट्रांग and Buzz Aldrin descended to the lunar surface and spent two and a half hours exploring, while Michael Collins remained in lunar orbit in the Command Module.
Along with Collins and Aldrin, Armstrong was awarded the Presidential Medal of Freedom by President Richard Nixon ; in 1978, President Jimmy Carter presented Armstrong the Congressional Space Medal of Honor in 1978 ; he and his former crewmates received the Congressional Gold Medal in 2009.
Armstrong died in सिनसिनाटी, Ohio, on August 25, 2012, at the age of 82, after complications from coronary artery bypass surgery.
Secretariat ( March 30, 1970 – October 4, 1989 ) was an American Thoroughbred racehorse that in 1973 became the first U.S. Triple Crown champion in 25 years.
He set race records in all three events in the Series — the Kentucky Derby ( 1:59.4 ), the Preakness Stakes ( 1:53 ), और the belmont Stakes ( 2:24 ) — records that still stand today.
He is considered to be one of the greatest thoroughbreds of all time.
In 1999, ESPN ranked सचिवालय the 35th best athlete of the 20th century, the highest ranking racehorse on the list URL_http.
He ranked second behind Man o ' War in The Blood-Horse 's List of the Top 100 U.S. Racehorses of the 20th Century.
Secretariat was sired by Bold शासक आउट of somethingroyal, by Princequillo.
He was foaled at The मर्ग in Caroline County, Virginia.
Like his famous predecessor Man o ' War, Secretariat was a large chestnut colt and was given the same उपनाम, `` Big Red. ''
Secretariat 's grandsire, Nasrullah, is also the great-great-grandsire of 1977 Triple Crown winner Seattle Slew.
Owned by Penny Chenery, he was trained by Lucien Laurin and mainly ridden by कनाडाई jockey Ron Turcotte, along with apprentice jockey Paul Feliciano ( first two races ), and veteran Eddie Maple ( last race ).
He raced in chenery 's मर्ग stable 's ब्लू और श्वेत checkered रंगों और उसके दूल्हे थी एडी स्वेद.
Secretariat stood लगभग लम्बा, और weighed, with a 75-inch girth, in his racing prime.
Madrid (, ) is the capital and largest city of स्पेन.
The population of the city is roughly 3.3 million and the entire population of the मैड्रिड महानगर क्षेत्रफल is गणना to be around 6.5 million.
It is the third-largest city in the European Union, after London and Berlin, and its metropolitan area is the third-largest in the European Union after London and Paris.
The city spans a कुल of.
The city is स्तिथ on the manzanares नदी in the centre of both the country and the Community of Madrid ( which comprises the city of Madrid, its conurbation and extended suburbs and villages ) ; this community is bordered by the autonomous communities of Castile and León and Castile-La Mancha.
As the capital city of Spain, सीट of सरकारी, और निवास of the स्पेनी monarch, Madrid is also the political, economic and cultural centre of Spain.
The current mayor is Ana Botella from the लोगों 's पार्टी ( PP ).
The Madrid urban agglomeration has the third-largest GDP in the European Union and its प्रभाव in राजनीती, शिक्षा, entertainment, पर्यावरण, मीडिया, fashion, science, culture, and the arts all contribute to its status as one of the world 's major global cities.
Due to its economic output, high standard of living, और मार्केट आकार, Madrid is considered the major financial centre of Southern Europe and the Iberian Peninsula ; it hosts the head offices of the vast majority of the major Spanish companies, such as Telefónica, Iberia or Repsol.
Madrid is the most touristic city of Spain, the fourth-most touristic of the continent, and the seventh most visited city in the world according to Forbes.
Is the 10th most livable नगर in the world according to Monocle magazine, in its 2010 index.
Madrid also ranks among the 12 greenest European cities in 2010. < ref name= '' http : //www.citymayors.com/environment/greenest-cities-europe.html '' > मैड्रिड is फिलहाल a Candidate City for the 2020 Summer Olympics.
Madrid houses the headquarters of the World Tourism Organization ( WTO ), belonging to the United राष्ट्र संगठन ( un ), the segib, the संगठन of Ibero-American States ( OEI ), and the Public Interest Oversight Board ( PIOB ).
It also hosts major international institutions regulators of Spanish : the खड़ा कमेटी of the Association of Spanish Language Academies, headquarters of the Royal Spanish Academy ( RAE ), the Cervantes Institute and the Foundation of Urgent Spanish ( Fundéu ).
Madrid organizes fairs as FITUR, ARCO, SIMO TCI and the Cibeles Madrid फ़ैशन सप्ताह.
While Madrid possesses a modern infrastructure, it has preserved the look और महसूस of अनेक of इसके ऐतिहासिक neighbourhoods and streets.
Its landmarks include the Royal Palace of Madrid ; the Teatro Real ( Royal theatre ) with its restored 1850 Opera House ; the Buen Retiro Park, founded in 1631 ; the 19th-century National Library building ( founded in 1712 ) containing some of Spain 's historical archives ; a large number of National museums, and the Golden Triangle of Art, located along the Paseo del Prado and comprising three art museums : Prado Museum, the Museo Nacional Centro de Arte Reina Sofía, a museum of modern art, and the thyssen-bornemisza Museum, which completes the shortcomings of the other two museums.
cibeles राजमहल and Fountain have become the monument symbol of the city.

The Appian Way ( Latin and Italian : Via Appia ) was one of the earliest और रणनीतिक most important Roman roads of the ancient republic.
it कनेक्ट Rome to Brindisi, Apulia, in southeast Italy.
Its importance is indicated by its common नाम, अंकित by Statius :
Appia teritur रेजिना longarum viarum
`` the Appian way is the queen of the long roads ''
The road is named after Appius Claudius Caecus, the Roman censor who began and completed the first section as a सैन्य सड़क to the दक्षिण in 312 BC during the Samnite Wars.
The Draupner wave, a single giant wave measured on New Year 's Day 1995, finally confirmed the existence of freak waves, which had previously been considered near-mythical
Rogue waves ( also known as freak waves, monster waves, killer waves, extreme waves, and असामान्य लहरें ) हैं अपेक्षाकृत large and spontaneous ocean surface waves that occur far out at sea, and are a threat even to large ships and ocean liners.
In oceanography, they are more precisely defined as waves whose height is more than twice the significant wave height ( SWH ), जिससे is itself defined as the mean of the largest third of waves in a wave record.
Therefore rogue waves are not necessarily the biggest लहरें मिला at sea ; they are, rather, surprisingly large waves for a given sea state.
Rogue waves seem not to have a single distinct cause, but occur where physical factors such as high winds and strong currents cause waves to विलय to बनाएँ a सिंगल exceptional विशाल wave.
Electress Sophia of Hanover ( 1630–1714 )
The line of succession to the British throne is the ordered sequence of all those people eligible to succeed to the सिंहासन of the United Kingdom and the other 15 Commonwealth realms.
The Act of Settlement 1701 bestowed succession on the Electress Sophia of Hanover and her descendants while excluding Roman Catholics.
The British government does not publish an official list of all those in line to succeed, but the work of genealogical authors and amateur researchers suggests कि वहीँ हैं अनेक हजार लोगों potentially in line.
At a summit in पर्थ, पश्चिमी ऑस्ट्रेलिया in 2011, the heads of government of all 16 Commonwealth realms agreed to take steps to adopt absolute primogeniture, end the exclusion of people married to Roman Catholics, and make other changes in the succession rules.
The line of succession is also used to select the Counsellors of State ( and a regent if the need arises ) under the प्रावधानों of the Regency Act 1937.
For earlier versions of the line of succession, see History of the British line of उत्तराधिकार.
Edward Montgomery Clift ( October 17, 1920july 23, 1966 ) थी an अमरीकी film and stage actor The New York Times’ obituary noted his portrayal of `` moody, sensitive young men ''.
He often played outsiders and `` victim-heroes '' ; examples include the social climber in George Stevens 's A Place in the Sun, the anguished Catholic priest in Hitchcock 's I Confess, the doomed regular soldier Robert E. Lee Prewitt in Fred Zinnemann 's From Here to Eternity, and the Jewish GI bullied by antisemites in एडवर्ड Dmytryk 's The Young Lions.
Later, after a disfiguring car crash in 1956, and alcohol and prescription drug abuse, he became erratic.
Nevertheless important roles were still his, including `` the reckless, alcoholic, mother-fixated rodeo यजमान '' in जॉन हस्टन 's the misfits, the title role in Huston 's, and the concentration camp victim in Stanley Kramer 's Judgment at Nuremberg. ''
Clift प्राप्त four Academy Award nominations during his career, three for Best Actor and one for Best Supporting Actor.
The War on Terror ( also known as the Global War on Terrorism ) is a term commonly applied to an international military campaign which started as a result of the 11 September 2001 terrorist हमले on the United States.
This resulted in an international military campaign to eliminate al-Qaeda and other militant संगठन.
the संयुक्त किंगडम and many other NATO and non-NATO nations participate in the conflict.
The phrase 'War on Terror ' was first used by US अध्यक्ष George W. Bush on 20 September 2001.
The Bush administration and the Western media have since used the term to signify a global military, political, lawful, and conceptual struggle—targeting both organizations designated as आतंकवादी and regimes accused of supporting them.
It was typically used with a particular focus on militant Islamists, al-Qaeda, और अन्य जिहादी groups.
Although the term is not officially used by the administration of US President Barack Obama ( which instead uses the term Overseas Contingency Operation ), it is still commonly used by politicians, in the media and by some aspects of government officially, ऐसे as the संयुक्त States ' Global War on Terrorism Service Medal.
German battleship schleswig-holstein, Westerplatte, September 1, 1939
Destroyer uss शॉ exploding after her forward magazine was detonated during the Attack on Pearl Harbor
The main causes of World War II were nationalistic issues, unresolved issues, and resentments resulting from World War I and the interwar काल in Europe, in addition to the effects of the Great Depression in the 1930s.
The culmination of events that led to the outbreak of war are generally understood to be the 1939 invasion of Poland by Germany and Soviet Russia and the 1937 invasion of the गणतंत्र of चीन by the साम्राज्य of Japan.
These military aggressions were the result of decisions made by the authoritarian ruling Nazi elite in Germany and by the leadership of the kwantung फौज in Japan.
World युद्ध ii प्रारंभ बाद ये आक्रामक actions were met with an official declaration of war and/or armed resistance.

The मित्सुबिशी Galant is an automobile manufactured by Mitsubishi Motors between 1969 and 2012.
The name was derived from the फ्रेंच शब्द galant, अर्थ `` chivalrous ''.
There have been nine पृथक पीढियां, and cumulative sales now exceed five million.
It began as a compact sedan, but over the कोर्स of इसके जीवन has evolved into a larger mid-size car.
Initial production थी तभी आधारित in जापानी, लकिन चूंकि 1994 the अमरीकी market has been served by vehicles assembled at the former Diamond-Star Motors ( DSM ) facility in Normal, Illinois.
Blood pressure ( BP ), sometimes referred to as arterial blood दबाव, is the दबाव exerted by circulating blood upon the walls of blood vessels, and is one of the principal vital signs.
When प्रयुक्त बगैर further specification, `` blood pressure '' usually refers to the arterial pressure of the systemic circulation.
During each heartbeat, blood pressure varies between a maximum ( systolic ) and a minimum ( diastolic ) दबाव.
The blood pressure in the circulation is प्रधानतया due to the pumping action of the heart.
Differences in mean blood pressure are responsible for blood flow from one location to another in the परिसंचरण.
The rate of mean blood flow depends on the resistance to flow प्रस्तुत by the blood vessels.
Mean blood pressure decreases as the circulating blood moves away from the heart through arteries and capillaries due to viscous losses of energy.
औसत रक्त दबाव बूंदें over the whole circulation, although most of the fall occurs along the small arteries and arterioles.
Gravity affects blood pressure via hydrostatic forces ( e.g., during standing ) and valves in veins, breathing, and pumping from संकुचन of skeletal मांसपेशियां also influence blood pressure in veins.
Blood pressure without further specification usually refers to the systemic arterial pressure measured at a व्यक्ति 's अपर भुजा और is a माप of the दबाव in the brachial artery, the major artery in the upper arm.
A person’s blood pressure is usually expressed in terms of the systolic pressure over diastolic दबाव and is measured in millimetres of mercury ( mmHg ), for example 120/80.
A veto – Latin for `` I forbid '' – is the power ( used by an officer of the state, for example ) to unilaterally stop an आधिकारिक कार्रवाई, विशेषकर the enactment of legislation.
A veto can be absolute, as लिये उदाहरण in the संयुक्त राष्ट्र सुरक्षा परिषद, whose permanent members ( China, France, Russia, United Kingdom, United States of America ) can block any resolution.
Or it can be limited, as in the legislative process of the United States, जहाँ a two-thirds vote in both the House and Senate may override a Presidential veto of legislation.
A वीटो तभी gives power to stop changes, not to adopt them ( except for the rare `` amendatory veto '' ).
Thus a वीटो allows its holder to protect the status quo.
The अवधारणा of a veto body originated with the Roman consuls and tribunes.
Either of the two consuls holding office in a given year could block a सैन्य or सिविल निर्णय by the other ; any tribune had the power to unilaterally block legislation passed by the Roman Senate.
Sulfur डाइऑक्साइड ( also sulphur dioxide ) is the chemical compound with the formula.
It is a toxic gas with a pungent, irritating smell, that is released by ज्वालामुखी और in विभिन्न industrial processes.
Since coal और पेट्रोलियम often contain sulfur compounds, their combustion generates sulfur dioxide unless the sulfur compounds are removed before burning the fuel.
Further oxidation of SO2, usually in the उपस्थिति of a catalyst such as NO2, forms H2SO4, and thus acid rain.
Sulfur dioxide emissions are also a precursor to particulates in the माहौल.
Both of these impacts are cause for चिंता over the environmental impact of these fuels.
Myasthenia gravis ( from Greek μύς `` मांसपेशी '', `` कमज़ोरी '', और `` serious '' ; abbreviated MG ) is an autoimmune neuromuscular disease leading to fluctuating muscle weakness and fatigability.
It is an autoimmune disorder, in which weakness is caused by circulating antibodies that ब्लाक acetylcholine receptors at the postsynaptic neuromuscular जंक्शन, inhibiting the excitatory effects of the neurotransmitter acetylcholine on nicotinic receptors throughout neuromuscular junctions.
Myasthenia is treated medically साथ acetylcholinesterase inhibitors or immunosuppressants, and, in selected cases, thymectomy.
The disease incidence is 3–30 cases per लाख प्रति साल और rising as a result of increased awareness.
MG must be distinguished from congenital myasthenic syndromes that can present similar symptoms but offer no response to immunosuppressive उपचार.
परावर्तक मुड़ nematic liquid crystal display.
Polarizing filter film with a लंबवत axis to polarize light as it enters.
Glass substrate with ito electrodes.
The shapes of these electrodes will determine the shapes that will appear when the LCD is turned ON.
लंबवत ridges etched on the surface are smooth.
Twisted nematic द्रव क्रिस्टल.
Glass substrate with common electrode film ( ito ) with horizontal ridges to line up with the horizontal filter.
Polarizing filter film साथ a horizontal axis to block/pass light.
Reflective surface to send light back to viewer.
( In a backlit LCD, this परत is replaced with a light source. )
A liquid-crystal display ( LCD ) is a flat panel display, electronic visual display, or video display कि uses the light modulating properties of liquid crystals.
Liquid crystals do not emit लाइट directly.
LCDs are available to display arbitrary images ( as in a general-purpose computer display ) or fixed images which can be प्रदर्शित or छुपा, ऐसे as preset words, digits, and 7-segment displays as in a digital clock.
They use the same basic technology, except that arbitrary images are made up of a विशाल क्रमांक of small pixels, while other displays have larger elements.
LCDs are used in a wide range of applications including computer monitors, televisions, instrument panels, वायुयान कॉकपिट प्रदर्शक, and signage.
They are common in consumer devices such as video players, gaming devices, clocks, watches, calculators, and telephones, and have replaced कैथोड रे ट्यूब ( CRT ) displays in most applications.
They are उपलब्धियाँ in a wider दायरा of screen sizes than CRT and plasma displays, and since they do not use phosphors, they do not suffer image burn-in.
lcds हैं, however, susceptible to image persistence.
The LCD screen is more energy efficient and can be disposed of अधिक सकुशल than a CRT.
Its low electrical शक्ति खपत enables it to be used in battery -powered electronic equipment.
It is an electronically modulated optical device made up of any number of segments filled with द्रव crystals और arrayed in front of a light source ( backlight ) or reflector to produce images in color or monochrome.
द्रव crystals were first discovered in 1888.
By 2008, worldwide sales of televisions with LCD screens exceeded annual sales of CRT units ; the CRT became obsolete for most purposes.
The Borgata Hotel Casino and Spa is a luxury hotel, casino, and spa in Atlantic नगर, नई जर्सी, United States.
It is owned by Marina District Development, a joint venture between boyd गेमिंग और a divesture trust established by MGM Resorts International.
The $ 1.1 billion casino hotel features 2,002 rooms and is the largest होटल in नई Jersey.
The Borgata खोली in जुलाई 2003 as a लास Vegas-style megaresort and is the top-grossing casino in Atlantic City.
a बोतल of ऊँची potency B-complex vitamin supplement pills.
A vitamin ( or ) is an organic compound required by an organism as a vital nutrient in सीमित amounts.
An organic chemical compound ( or related set of compounds ) is called a vitamin when it can not be synthesized in sufficient quantities by an organism, and must be obtained from the diet.
Thus, the term is conditional both on the circumstances and on the particular सजीव.
For example, ascorbic acid ( vitamin C ) is a vitamin for humans, but not लिये सबसे अन्य पशु, और biotin and vitamin D are required in the human diet only in certain circumstances.
By convention, the term vitamin includes neither अन्य अनिवार्य nutrients, ऐसे as dietary खनिज, अनिवार्य वसीय acids, or अनिवार्य अमीनो acids ( जिससे हैं needed in larger amounts than विटामिन ) nor the विशाल क्रमांक of अन्य nutrients कि प्रचार स्वास्थ्य लकिन हैं वरना जरूरी कम प्रायः.
Thirteen vitamins हैं universally recognized at present.
Vitamins are classified by their biological and chemical कार्यकलाप, नहीं their structure.
Thus, each `` vitamin '' refers to a number of vitamer compounds that all show the biological activity associated with a particular vitamin.
Such a set of chemicals is grouped under an alphabetized vitamin `` जेनेरिक वर्णनकर्ता '' शीर्षक, such as `` vitamin A ``, which includes the compounds retinal, retinol, and four known carotenoids.
Vitamers by definition are convertible to the active form of the vitamin in the body, and are sometimes inter-convertible to one another, as well.
Vitamins have विविध biochemical functions.
Some have hormone-like functions as regulators of mineral metabolism ( such as vitamin D ), or regulators of cell and tissue growth and differentiation ( such as some forms of vitamin A ).
अन्य फलन as antioxidants ( e.g., vitamin E and sometimes vitamin C ).
the largest क्रमांक of विटामिन ( ऐसे as b जटिल विटामिन ) function as precursors for enzyme cofactors, that help enzymes in their work as catalysts in metabolism.
In this role, vitamins may be tightly bound to enzymes as part of prosthetic groups : For example, biotin is part of enzymes involved in making fatty acids.
विटामिन may भी be कम tightly बंधी to enzyme catalysts as coenzymes, detachable molecules that function to carry chemical groups or electrons between molecules.
For उदाहरण, फोलिक एसिड may carry मिथाइल, formyl, और methylene समूह in the कोशिका.
Although these roles in assisting enzyme-substrate reactions are vitamins ' best-known function, the other vitamin functions are equally important.
Until the mid-1930s, when the first commercial yeast-extract vitamin B complex and semi-synthetic vitamin C supplement tablets were sold, vitamins were obtained solely through food intake, और परिवर्तन in आहार ( जिससे, लिये उदाहरण, could occur दौरान a particular growing season ) usually greatly altered the types and amounts of vitamins ingested.
However, vitamins have been produced as commodity chemicals and made widely available as inexpensive semisynthetic and synthetic-source multivitamin dietary और खाना supplements and additives, since the middle of the 20th century.
World Muslim जनसांख्यिकी by percentage ( Pew Research Center, 2009 )
संसार Muslim population in millions
Islam is the world 's second largest religion after Christianity.
According to a 2010 study, Islam has 1.62 billion adherents, making up over 23 % of the world population.
Islam is the predominant religion in the Middle East, in Sahel, in the Horn of Africa and northern Africa, and in some parts of Asia.
Large communities of Muslims हैं भी मिला in China, the Balkans, and Russia.
Other parts of the world host large Muslim immigrant communities ; in Western Europe, for instance, Islam is the दूसरी largest religion after Christianity, where it represents 6 % of the total population.
according to the Pew Research Center in 2010 there were 49 Muslim-majority countries.
around 62 % of the world 's Muslims live in South and Southeast Asia, with over 1 billion adherents.
The largest Muslim country is Indonesia, home to 12.7 % of the world 's Muslims, followed by Pakistan ( 11.0 % ), India ( 10.9 % ), and Bangladesh ( 9.2 % ).
About 20 % of मुसलमान live in Arab countries.
In the Middle East, the non-Arab countries of Turkey and Iran are the largest Muslim-majority countries ; in Africa, मिश्र and Nigeria have the most populous Muslim communities.
A study conducted by the Pew Research Center in 2010 and released January 2011 found that there are 1.62 billion मुसलमान around the संसार.
The study found more Muslims in the United Kingdom than in लेबनान और अधिक in चीन than in Syria.
Rhode द्वीप ( or ), officially the State of Rhode Island and Providence Plantations, is a state in the New England region of the United States.
Rhode Island is the smallest in क्षेत्रफल, the आठवीं least populous, but the second most densely populated of the 50 US states behind New Jersey.
Rhode Island is bordered by कनेक्टिकट to the वेस्ट and Massachusetts to the north and east, and it shares a water boundary with New York 's Long Island to the southwest.
Rhode Island was the first of the 13 original colonies to declare independence from British rule, declaring itself independent on May 4, 1776, two महीने पहले any other colony.
The State was also the last of the thirteen original colonies to ratify the United States Constitution.
Rhode Island 's official nickname is `` The Ocean State '', a reference to the State 's geography, since Rhode Island has several large bays and inlets that राशि to परिचय 14 % of इसके कुल क्षेत्रफल.
Its land area is, but its total area is significantly larger.
Dubai ( ; ', ) is a city in the United Arab Emirates, स्तिथ within the emirate of the same name.
The emirate of Dubai is located on the southeast coast of the पारसी गल्फ on the arabian प्रायद्वीप और is one of the seven emirates that make up the country.
It has the largest population in the UAE ( 2,106,177 ) and the second-largest जमीन territory by area ( 4,114 km2 ) after Abu Dhabi.
Dubai and Abu Dhabi, the national capital, are the only two emirates to have veto power over नाजुक matters of national importance in the country 's legislature.
The city of Dubai is located on the emirate 's उत्तरी तटरेखा और heads up the dubai-sharjah-ajman metropolitan area.
Dubai is nowadays often misperceived as a country or city-state and, in some मामले, the UAE as a whole has been described as 'Dubai '.
The earliest mention of Dubai is in 1095 AD, and the earliest recorded settlement in the region dates from 1799.
The Sheikhdom of Dubai was formally established in 1833 by Sheikh Maktoum bin Butti Al-Maktoum when he persuaded around 800 members of his tribe of the Bani Yas, living in what was then the Second Saudi State and now part of Saudi Arabia, to follow him to the Dubai Creek by the Abu Falasa clan of the Bani Yas.
It remained under the tribe 's control when the United Kingdom assumed protection of the Sheikhdom in 1892 and joined the nascent United Arab Emirates upon independence in 1971 as the country 's second emirate.
Its strategic geographic location made the कस्बा an महत्वपूर्ण व्यापार हब and by the beginning of the 20th century, Dubai was already an important regional port.
Today, Dubai has emerged as a cosmopolitan metropolis that has grown steadily to become a global city and a business and cultural hub of the Middle East and the Persian Gulf region.
Although Dubai 's economy थी historically built on the oil industry, the emirate 's Western-style model of business drives its economy with the main revenues now coming from tourism, real estate, and financial services.
Dubai has recently attracted world ध्यान through many innovative large construction projects and sports events.
The city has become symbolic for its skyscrapers and high-rise buildings, such as the world 's tallest Burj Khalifa, in addition to ambitious development projects including man-made islands, hotels, and some of the largest shopping malls in the region and the world.
This increased attention has also highlighted labor and human rights मुद्दे concerning the city 's largely South Asian paid workforce.
Dubai 's property market experienced a major deterioration in 2008–2009 as a परिणाम of the worldwide economic downturn following the financial crisis of 2007-2008.
However, दुबई रै बना a steady and gradual recovery with help coming from neighboring emirates.
The handful of new projects that are in the pipeline have been able to help Dubai real एस्टेट मेक a comeback.
As of 2012, Dubai is the 22nd most expensive city in the world, and the most expensive city in the Middle East, surpassing Israel 's Tel Aviv ( 31st ).
Dubai has also been rated as one of the best places to live in the Middle East, including by US American global consulting firm मर्सर जो रेटेड the नगर as the बेहतरीन प्लेस to live in the Middle East in 2011.

Surface of the Atlantic समंदर बैठक the Earth 's planetary boundary layer and troposphere.
लहरें on an ocean coast.
This animation uses Earth science data from a variety of sensors on NASA Earth observing satellites to माप शारीरिक oceanography parameters such as ocean currents, ocean winds, sea surface height and sea surface temperature.
An ocean ( ; the World Ocean of classical प्राचीनता ) is a body of saline water that composes a large part of a planet 's hydrosphere.
In the context of Earth, it refers to one or all of the major divisions of the planet 's World Ocean – they are, in descending order of area, the Pacific, Atlantic, Indian, Southern ( Antarctic ), और आर्कटिक महासागर.
The word `` sea `` is often used interchangeably with `` ocean '', but strictly speaking a sea is a body of saline water ( possibly a division of the World Ocean ) partly or fully enclosed by जमीन.
Earth is the only planet known to have an ocean ( or any large amounts of open liquid water ).
Approximately 72 % of the planet 's surface ( ~3.6x108 km2 ) is covered by saline water that is customarily divided into several प्रिंसिपल महासागर और छोटी समंदर, साथ the ocean covering approximately 71 % of the Earth 's surface.
In terms of the जलमंडल of the Earth, the ocean contains 97 % of the Earth 's water.
Oceanographers have stated कि आउट of 97 %, only 5 % of the ocean as a whole on Earth has been explored.
Because it is the principal component of Earth 's hydrosphere, the world ocean is integral to all known life, forms part of the carbon cycle, and influences climate and weather पैटर्न.
The total volume is approximately 1.3 billion cubic kilometres ( 310 लाख cu mi ) with an average depth of.
It is the habitat of 230,000 known species, although much of the ocean 's depths remain unexplored and it is estimated that over two million marine species exist.
The origin of Earth 's oceans is still unknown, but oceans are believed to have formed in the Hadean period and may have been the impetus for the emergence of life.
Extraterrestrial oceans may be composed of a चौड़ी range of elements and compounds.
The only confirmed large stable bodies of extraterrestrial surface liquids are the lakes of Titan, although there is evidence for the अस्तित्व of महासागर elsewhere in the Solar System.
Early in their geologic histories, मंगल और शुक्र are theorized to have had large water oceans.
The Mars ocean hypothesis suggests that nearly a third of the सतह of मंगल थी एकबार covered by जल, हालांकि the water on Mars is no longer oceanic, and a runaway greenhouse effect may have boiled away the global ocean of Venus.
Compounds such as लवण और अमोनिया dissolved in water lower its freezing point, so that water might exist in large quantities in extraterrestrial environments as brine or convecting ice.
Unconfirmed oceans are speculated beneath the surface of many dwarf planets and natural satellites ; notably, the ocean of Europa is believed to have over twice the water volume of Earth.
The Solar System 's gas giant planets are also believed to possess liquid atmospheric layers of yet to be confirmed रचनाएं.
महासागर may भी मौजूद on exoplanets and exomoons, including surface oceans of liquid water within a circumstellar habitable zone.
Ocean planets are a hypothetical type of planet with a सतह completely covered with liquid.
Elvis आरोन प्रेस्ली ( जनवरी 8, 1935 – August 16, 1977 ) was an American singer and actor.
A cultural icon, he is commonly ज्ञात by the single name Elvis.
One of the most popular musicians of the 20th century, he is often referred to as the `` किंग of चट्टान and Roll '' or `` the King ''.
Born in Tupelo, Mississippi, Presley moved to मेम्फिस, टेनेसी, साथ his family at the age of 13.
He began his career there in 1954, working with Sun Records owner Sam Phillips, who wanted to bring the sound of African-American music to a wider दर्शक.
accompanied by guitarist स्कॉटी मूर and bassist Bill Black, Presley was the most important popularizer of rockabilly, an uptempo, backbeat -driven fusion of country and rhythm and blues.
RCA Victor acquired his contract in a deal arranged by Colonel Tom Parker, who went on to मैनेज the सिंगर लिये over two decades.
Presley 's first RCA single, `` heartbreak होटल ``, released in January 1956, was a number-one hit.
He became the leading figure of the newly popular sound of rock and roll with a श्रेणी of संजाल टेलीविज़न दिखावे and chart-topping records.
His energized interpretations of songs, अनेक इससे african-american sources, and his uninhibited performance style made him enormously popular—and controversial.
In November 1956, he made his film debut in प्रेम Me Tender.
Drafted into military सेवा in 1958, Presley relaunched his recording career two years later with some of his most commercially successful work.
He staged few concerts however, and guided by Parker, proceeded to devote much of the 1960s to making Hollywood movies and साउंडट्रैक एल्बम, सबसे of उन्हें critically derided.
In 1968, after seven years away from the stage, he returned to live performance in a celebrated comeback television special that led to an extended Las Vegas कॉन्सर्ट रेसिडेंसी और a स्ट्रिंग of profitable tours.
In 1973 Presley staged the first concert broadcast globally via satellite, Aloha from Hawaii.
Prescription drug abuse severely deteriorated his health, and he died एकाएक in 1977 at the age of 42.
Presley is regarded as one of the most important figures of 20th-century popular culture.
He had a versatile voice and unusually wide success encompassing many genres, including देश, पॉप ballads, gospel, and blues.
He is the best-selling solo artist in the इतिहास of popular music.
Nominated for 14 competitive Grammys, he won three, and received the ग्रैमी आजीवन उपलब्धि Award at age 36.
He has been inducted into multiple music halls of fame.
a कांच of root beer with foam
Root beer is a carbonated, sweetened beverage, originally made using the root of a sassafras plant ( or the bark of a sassafras पेड़ ) as the प्राथमिक flavor.
Root beer, popularized in North America, comes in दो फ़ॉर्म : alcoholic और soft drink.
The historical root beer was analogous to small beer in that the process provided a पेय साथ a बहुत कम दारू content.
Although roots are used as the source of many soft drinks throughout the world, प्रायः अलग names are used.
Fluorescent minerals emit visible लाइट जब उजागर to ultraviolet light
Fluorescence is the emission of light by a substance that has absorbed light or अन्य इलेक्ट्रोमैग्नेटिक विकिरण.
It is a form of संदीप्ति.
In most cases, the emitted light has a longer wavelength, and therefore lower energy, than the absorbed radiation.
However, when the absorbed electromagnetic radiation is intense, it is possible for one electron to absorb two photons ; this two-photon absorption can lead to emission of विकिरण having a shorter wavelength than the अवशोषित radiation.
The emitted radiation may also be of the same wavelength as the absorbed विकिरण, termed `` अनुनाद प्रतिदीप्ति ''.
The most striking उदाहरण of fluorescence occur when the absorbed radiation is in the ultraviolet region of the spectrum, and thus invisible to the human eye, and the emitted light is in the visible region.
Fluorescence has many practical applications, including mineralogy, gemology, chemical sensors ( fluorescence spectroscopy ), fluorescent labelling, dyes, biological detectors, and, most commonly, fluorescent lamps.
Informal logic, intuitively, refers to the principles of logic और लॉजिकल विचार बाहर of a औपचारिक setting.
However, perhaps क्युकी of the अनौपचारिक in the title, the precise definition of informal logic is a matter of some dispute.
Ralph H. Johnson and J. एंथोनी ब्लेयर define अनौपचारिक लॉजिक as `` a शाखा of logic whose task is to develop non-formal standards, criteria, procedures for the analysis, interpretation, evaluation, criticism and construction of argumentation. ''
This definition reflects what had been implicit in their practice and what others यहूद doing in their informal logic texts.
अनौपचारिक लॉजिक is संबद्ध साथ ( अनौपचारिक ) fallacies, critical thinking, the Thinking Skills Movement and the interdisciplinary inquiry known as argumentation theory.
Frans H. van Eemeren writes that the label `` informal logic '' covers a `` collection of normative approaches to the study of reasoning in ordinary language that remain closer to the practice of argumentation than formal logic. ''
USA annual real GDP 1910–60, with the years of the Great Depression ( 1929–1939 ) highlighted.
बेरोजगारी रेट in the us 1910–1960, with the years of the Great Depression ( 1929–1939 ) highlighted.
The Great Depression began in August of 1929, when the United States economy first went into an economic recession.
Although the country spent two months with declining GDP, it was not until the वॉल गली क्रैश of अक्तूबर, 1929 that the effects of a declining economy were felt, and a major worldwide economic downturn ensued.
The market crash marked the beginning of a decade of high unemployment, poverty, low profits, deflation, plunging farm incomes, and lost opportunities for आर्थिक growth and personal advancement.
Although its causes are still uncertain and controversial, the net effect was a sudden and general loss of विश्वास in the economic future.
The usual explanations include numerous factors, especially high consumer debt, ill-regulated markets that permitted overoptimistic loans by banks and investors, and the lack of high-growth new industries, all interacting to create a downward आर्थिक सर्पिल of reduced spending, falling confidence, and lowered production.
Industries that suffered the most included construction, agriculture as dust-bowl conditions persisted in the agricultural heartland, शिपिंग, खनन, और लॉगिंग as खूब as टिकाऊ goods जैसे ऑटोमोबाइल और उपकरण कि could be postponed.
The economy reached bottom in the winter of 1932–33 ; then came four years of very rapid growth until 1937, जब the मंदी of 1937 brought back 1934 levels of unemployment.
The Depression caused major राजनैतिक परिवर्तन in America.
Three years into the depression, Herbert Hoover lost the 1932 presidential election to Franklin Delano Roosevelt in a sweeping landslide.
Roosevelt 's economic recovery plan, the New Deal, instituted unprecedented कार्यक्रम लिये राहत, रिकवरी and reform, and brought about a major realignment of American politics.
The अवसाद भी resulted in an increase of emigration of people to other countries for the first time in American history.
For example, some immigrants went back to their native countries, and some native US citizens went to Canada, ऑस्ट्रेलिया, और दक्षिण Africa.
It also resulted in the द्रव्यमान माइग्रेशन of लोगों from badly hit areas in the Great Plains and the South to places such as California and the North, respectively ( see Okies and the Great Migration of African Americans ).
Racial तनाव भी increased during this time.
By the 1940s immigration had returned back to normal, और करणों declined.
A well-known example of an emigrant was Frank McCourt, who went to आयरलैंड, as recounted in his book Angela 's Ashes.
The memory of the Depression also shaped modern theories of economics and resulted in many changes in how the government dealt with economic downturns, such as the use of stimulus packages, Keynesian economics, and Social Security.
It also shaped modern American literature, resulting in famous novels such as John Steinbeck 's `` The Grapes of Wrath `` और `` of चूहे और मेन ``.
The ग्रेट अवसाद of the 1930s started with the stock market crash of October 1929.
Turkey ( ), officially the गणतंत्र of Turkey, is a transcontinental country, located mostly on Anatolia in Western Asia and on East Thrace in Southeastern Europe.
Turkey is bordered by eight countries : Bulgaria to the northwest ; यूनानियों to the वेस्ट ; जॉर्जिया to the northeast ; Armenia, Iran and the Azerbaijani exclave of Nakhchivan to the east ; and Iraq and Syria to the southeast.
The Mediterranean Sea is to the south ; the ईजियन समुद्र is to the वेस्ट ; and the Black Sea is to the north.
The Sea of Marmara, the Bosphorus and the Dardanelles ( which together form the Turkish Straits ) demarcate the boundary between thrace और Anatolia ; they also separate Europe and Asia.
Turkey 's location at the crossroads of Europe and Asia makes it a country of significant geostrategic महत्व.
The country 's official language is Turkish, a Turkic language, जिससे is बोला by लगभग 85 % of the population as mother tongue.
The most numerous जातीय समूह is the turks, who constitute between 70 % and 75 % of the population according to The World Factbook.
Kurds are the largest ethnic minority and, according to the same source, number around 18 % of the जनसांख्यिकी जबकि अन्य जातीय minorities are estimated to be at 7–12 %.
The विशाल majority of the population is Muslim.
The area now called Turkey has been inhabited since the Paleolithic, including various Ancient Anatolian civilizations and Thracian peoples.
After Alexander the Great 's conquest, the area was Hellenized, which continued with the Roman नियम और the परिवर्तन into the बीज़ान्टिन Empire.
The Seljuk Turks began migrating into the area in the 11th century, starting the process of Turkification, which was greatly accelerated by the Seljuk विजय over the byzantines at the बैटल of manzikert in 1071.
The Seljuk Sultanate of Rûm ruled Anatolia until the Mongol invasion in 1243, upon जिससे it disintegrated into several small Turkish beyliks.
Starting from the late 13th century, the Ottoman beylik united Anatolia and created an empire encompassing much of Southeastern Europe, Western Asia and North Africa.
After the Ottoman Empire collapsed following its defeat in संसार युद्ध i, भाग of it यहूद occupied by the victorious Allies.
A cadre of young military officers, led by Mustafa Kemal Atatürk and his colleagues, organized a successful resistance to the Allies ; in 1923 they स्थापित the आधुनिक Republic of Turkey, with Atatürk as its first president.
Turkey is a democratic, धर्मनिरपेक्ष, एकात्मक, constitutional republic with a diverse cultural heritage.
Turkey has become increasingly integrated with the West through membership in organisations such as the Council of Europe, NATO, OECD, OSCE and the G-20 major economies.
Turkey began full membership negotiations with the European Union in 2005, having been an associate member of the European Economic Community since 1963 and having joined the EU Customs Union in 1995.
Turkey has also fostered close cultural, political and economic relations with the Middle East, Caucasus, the Turkic states of Central एशिया और the अफ़्रीकी देशों through सदस्यता in संगठनों ऐसे as the turkic Council, Joint Administration of Turkic Arts and Culture, Organisation of Islamic Cooperation and the Economic Cooperation Organisation.
Turkey 's growing अर्थव्यवस्था और राजनयिक initiatives have led to its recognition as a regional power.
Turkey is the world 's 17th largest economy by nominal GDP and the 16th largest by purchasing power parity.
Caryn Elaine Johnson, best known as Whoopi Goldberg (, ( born November 13, 1955 ) is an American comedienne, अभिनेत्री, singer-songwriter, राजनैतिक activist, author and talk show host.
Goldberg made her film debut in The रंग जामुनी ( 1985 ), playing Celie, a mistreated black woman in the Deep South.
She received a nomination लिये the अकादमी पुरस्कार लिये Best Actress and won her first Golden Globe Award for her role in the film.
In 1990, वो निभाई oda mae Brown, a wacky psychic helping a slain man ( Patrick Swayze ) save his lover ( Demi Moore ) in the blockbuster Ghost.
This performance won her a second Golden Globe and an Academy Award for Best Supporting Actress ; this made Goldberg only the second black woman in the history of the Academy Awards to win an acting Oscar—the first being Hattie McDaniel who won for गए With the Wind in 1939.
Notable later films include Sister Act and Sister Act 2, The Player, Made in America, How Stella Got Her Groove Back, Girl, Interrupted and Rat Race.
She is also acclaimed for her roles as the bartender Guinan in Star Trek : The Next Generation, as Terry Doolittle in Jumpin ' Jack Flash, and as Carmen Tibideaux in Glee, as well as the voice of Shenzi the hyena in The Lion King.
Goldberg has been nominated for 13 Emmy Awards for उसके कार्य in टेलीविज़न.
She was co-producer of the popular खेल दिखाएँ हॉलीवुड Squares from 1998 to 2004.
वो रै महरूम the मॉडरेटर of the दिन बात दिखाएँ the दृश्य चूंकि 2007.
Goldberg has a Grammy, दो दिन Emmys, two Golden Globes, a Tony ( for production, not acting ), and an Oscar.
In addition, गोल्डबर्ग रै a अंग्रेजों Academy Film Award, four People 's Choice Awards, and has been honored with a star on the Hollywood Walk of Fame.
She is one of the few मनोरंजनकर्ता जो have won an Emmy, Grammy, Oscar, and Tony Award.
Augusta is a संचित नगर in the u.S. राज्य of जॉर्जिया, स्तिथ at the fall line of the Savannah River, at the head of its navigable portion.
as of the 2010 census, the Augusta– Richmond County population was 195,844 not counting the unconsolidated cities of Hephzibah and Blythe.
Augusta is the principal नगर of the Augusta – Richmond County Metropolitan Statistical Area, which as of 2010 had an estimated population of 556,877, making it both the second-largest city and the second-largest metro area in the state after Atlanta.
It is the 116th-largest city in the United States.
Internationally, Augusta is best known for hosting The Masters Tournament in गोल्फ़ प्रत्येक spring.
A CD-ROM ( ) is a pre-pressed compact disc which contains data.
The name is an acronym which stands for `` Compact Disc Read-only memory ``.
Computers can पढ़ा CD-ROMs, but can not write on them.
CD-ROMs are popularly used to distribute computer software, including video games and multimedia applications, हालांकि कोई data can be stored ( up to the capacity limit of a disc ).
Some CDs, called enhanced CDs, hold both computer data and audio with the latter capable of being played on a CD player, while data ( such as तन्त्र or डिजिटल वीडियो ) is तभी usable on a computer ( such as ISO 9660 format PC CD-ROMs ).
The Yellow Book is the technical standard that defines the स्वरूप of CD-ROMs.
One of a set of color-bound books that contain the technical specifications for all CD formats, the Yellow Book, created by Sony and Philips, was the first extension of Compact Disc Digital Audio.
It adapted the format to थाम any form of data.
The Chicago Blackhawks ( spelled as Black Hawks before 1986, and known colloquially as the Hawks ) हैं a पेशेवर ice hockey team based in Chicago, Illinois.
They are members of the Central Division of the Western Conference of the National Hockey League ( NHL ).
They have won four Stanley Cup championships since their founding in 1926, most recently in 2009–10.
The Blackhawks are one of the Original Six NHL teams, along with the Detroit Red Wings, मॉन्ट्रियल canadiens, Toronto Maple Leafs, Boston Bruins and New York Rangers.
Since the Blackhawks have played their home games at the United Center बाद having खर्च 65 years playing at Chicago Stadium.
