The violet color is often associated with penance और detachment.
Similar Christian penitential practice is seen in अन्य कैथोलिक देशों, sometimes associated with mortification of the flesh.
Granada, निकारागुआ.
Lent ( Latin : Quadragesima ) is a solemn observance in the liturgical year of many Christian denominations, lasting for a period of approximately six weeks leading up to Easter Sunday.
In the general Latin-rite and most Western denominations Lent is taken to run from Ash Wednesday to Maundy Thursday ( Holy Thursday ) morning or to Easter Eve.
In the Catholic Church, Lent lasts until Holy Thursday, जबकि अन्य denominations run until Easter Eve.
The traditional purpose of Lent is the preparation of the आस्तिक through prayer, penance, repentance, almsgiving, and self-denial.
Its institutional purpose is heightened in the annual commemoration of Holy Week, marking the death, burial and resurrection of Jesus, which recalls the events of the Bible when Jesus is crucified on Good Friday, which then culminates in the जश्न on ईस्टर Sunday of the Resurrection of Jesus Christ.
During Lent, many of the faithful commit to उपवास or giving up निश्चित types of luxuries as a form of penitence.
The Stations of the Cross, a devotional commemoration of मसीह 's carrying the Cross and of his execution, are often observed.
Many Roman Catholic and some Protestant चर्च हटाएँ पुष्प इससे उनके altars, जबकि crucifixes, religious statues, and other elaborate religious symbols are often veiled in violet fabrics in solemn observance of the event.
In certain pious Catholic countries, some adherents चिह्नित the ऋतु साथ the traditional abstention from the consumption of meat.
In some countries, grand religious processions and cultural customs are observed, and the faithful attempt to विज़िट सात चर्च दौरान Holy Week in honor of Jesus Christ heading to Mount Calvary.
Lent is traditionally described as स्थायी लिये चालीस दिनों, in commemoration of the forty days which, according to the Gospels of Matthew, Mark and Luke, Jesus spent fasting in the desert before the beginning of his public ministry, where he endured temptation by the Devil.
However, different Christian denominations calculate the चालीस दिनों of Lent differently.
In most Western traditions the Sundays are नहीं गिने as भाग of lent ; thus the period from Ash Wednesday until Easter consists of 40 days when the Sundays are excluded.
However in the Roman Catholic Church Lent is now taken to end on Holy Thursday rather than Easter Eve, and hence lasts 38 दिनों excluding Sundays, or 44 days in total.
This event, साथ with its pious customs are observed by Catholics, Lutherans, Methodists, Presbyterians, and Anglicans.
स्थान of Chernobyl nuclear power plant
The abandoned city of Pripyat साथ chernobyl संयंत्र in the distance
Abandoned housing blocks in Pripyat
The Chernobyl disaster (, Chornobylska Katastrofa – Chornobyl Catastrophe ) was a catastrophic nuclear accident that occurred on 26 April 1986 at the chernobyl नाभिकीय शक्ति संयंत्र in युक्त ( तब officially the Ukrainian SSR ), which was under the direct jurisdiction of the central authorities of the Soviet Union.
An explosion and fire released विशाल quantities of radioactive particles into the atmosphere, which spread over much of the western USSR and Europe.
The Chernobyl disaster is widely considered to have been the worst nuclear power plant accident in history, and is one of only two classified as a level 7 event on the International Nuclear इवेंट स्केल ( the अन्य होने the फुकुशिमा daiichi नाभिकीय विपत्ति in 2011 ).
The battle to contain the contamination and avert a greater catastrophe ultimately involved over 500,000 workers and cost an estimated 18 billion rubles.
The official Soviet casualty count of 31 deaths has been disputed, and long-term effects such as cancers and deformities are still being accounted for.
In grammar, a subject complement is a predicative expression that follows a linking verb ( copula ) and that complements ( completes ) the subject of the sentence by either ( 1 ) renaming it or ( 2 ) describing it.
In the former case, a renaming noun phrase ऐसे as a noun or pronoun is called a predicative nominal.
An adjective following the copula and describing the विषय is called a predicative adjective.
In either case the predicative पूरक in प्रभाव mirrors the subject.
Subject complements are used साथ a small class of verbs called linking verbs or copula, of which be is the most common.
Since copula are stative क्रियाएँ, विषय complements हैं नहीं affected by any action of the verb.
Subject complements हैं typically not clause arguments, nor are they clause adjuncts.
throughout the fifty-five year history of the Grammy Awards, many significant records have been set.
इस पेज तभी शामिल the competitive awards won by various artists.
This does not include the various special awards that are presented by the National Academy of Recording Arts and Sciences such as आजीवन उपलब्धि पुरस्कार, Trustees Awards, Technical Awards or Legend Awards.
The page however does include other non-performance related Grammys ( known as the Craft & Production फ़ील्ड ) कि may have been presented to the artist ( s ).
Marshall Bruce Mathers III ( born October 17, 1972 ), better known by his stage name Eminem ( stylized as EMINƎM ) and by his alter ego Slim Shady, is an American rapper, रिकार्ड निर्माता, songwriter and actor.
Eminem, along with his solo career, is a member of his group D12, and also one half of the hip hop duo Bad Meets Evil, with Royce da 5'9 ''.
Eminem is one of the best-selling artists in the world and is the best-selling कलाकार of the 2000s.
He has been listed and ranked as one of the greatest artists of all time by many magazines, including Rolling Stone magazine which ranked him 82nd on its list of The 100 Greatest Artists of All Time.
The same पत्रिका घोषित him The King of Hip Hop.
Including उसके कार्य साथ d12 और Bad Meets Evil, Eminem has achieved ten number-one albums on the Billboard 200.
He has sold more than 100 million रिकॉर्ड विश्वव्यापी, सहित 42 million tracks and 49.1 million albums in the United States.
As an underground rapper Eminem released his debut सोलो एल्बम, अनन्त in 1996.
The album was a नाजुक और commercial failure.
He gained mainstream popularity in 1999 after the release of उसके major-label debut album The Slim Shady LP.
the lp भी अर्जित Eminem his first Grammy Award for Best Rap Album.
His next दो रिकॉर्ड The Marshall Mathers LP, and The Eminem Show, also won Best Rap Album Grammy Awards, making Eminem the first artist to win Best Rap Album for three consecutive LPs.
इस was followed by another studio release in 2004 titled Encore.
Eminem then went on अंतराल after touring in 2005.
He released his first album in five years titled Relapse, on May 15, 2009.
In 2010, Eminem released his seventh studio album Recovery.
Recovery was an international success and was named the best selling album of 2010 विश्वव्यापी, joining the Eminem Show, which was the best seller of 2002.
Eminem won Grammy Awards for both Relapse and Recovery, giving him a total of 13 Grammys in his career.
Eminem has opened अन्य ventures, including his own record label Shady Records with his manager Paul Rosenberg.
He also has his own radio channel, Shade 45 on sirius xm Radio.
Eminem began an acting career in 2002, when he starred in the hip hop drama film 8 Mile.
He won the अकादमी पुरस्कार लिये बेहतरीन असली सोंग, बनने the पहला रैप कलाकार कभी to जीत the पुरस्कार.
He has also made cameo appearances in The Wash ( 2001 ), Funny People ( 2009 ) and the television series Entourage.
The acre is a ईकाई of क्षेत्रफल used in the imperial and U.S. customary systems.
An acre is about 40 % of a hectare – slightly smaller than an अमरीकी football field.
The acre is no longer commonly used, although a few notable exceptions include the United States, Australia, Burma and the United Kingdom ( as of 2010, the acre is no longer officially used in the United Kingdom, though is still used in real estate descriptions ).
It is still used, to some extent, in कनाडा.
The international प्रतीक of the एकड़ is ac, and is defined as 1/640 of a square mile.
The most commonly used acre today is the अंतरराष्ट्रीय एकड़.
In the संयुक्त राज्य both the international acre and the slightly different US survey acre are in use.
The most common use of the acre is to माप tracts of land.
One international acre is defined as 4046.8564224 वर्गाकार metres.
During the Middle Ages, an acre थी the राशि of जमीन that could be plowed in one day with a yoke of oxen.
Antoine Lavoisier 's discovery of the Law of Conservation of Mass led to many new findings in the 19th century.
Joseph Proust 's law of definite proportions और जॉन डाल्टन 's परमाणु theory branched from the discoveries of Antoine Lavoisier.
Lavoisier 's quantitative experiments revealed that combustion involved oxygen rather than what was previously thought to be phlogiston.
The law of conservation of mass, or principle of mass conservation, states that for any system closed to all transfers of matter and energy ( both of which have mass ), the mass of the system must remain constant over time, as system mass can not change quantity if it is not added or removed.
Hence, the quantity of mass is `` conserved '' over समय.
The law implies that mass can neither be created nor destroyed, although it may be rearranged in space, or the entities associated with it may be changed in form, as for example when light or physical work is transformed into particles that contribute the same mass to the system as the light or work had contributed.
The law implies ( requires ) that during any chemical reaction, nuclear reaction, or radioactive decay in an isolated system, the mass of the reactants or starting material must equal the mass of the products.
The concept of mass conservation is widely used in many fields such as chemistry, mechanics, and fluid dynamics.
Historically, mass conservation was discovered in chemical reactions by Antoine Lavoisier in the late 18th century, and was of crucial importance in the progress from alchemy to the modern natural science of chemistry.
The closely related concept of matter conservation was found to hold good in chemistry to such high सन्निकटन that it failed only for the high energies treated by the later refinements of relativity theory, but otherwise remains useful and sufficiently accurate for most chemical calculations, even in modern practice.
In special relativity, needed for accuracy when large energy transfers between systems is involved, the अंतर between thermodynamically closed and isolated systems becomes important, since conservation of mass is strictly and perfectly upheld only for so-called isolated systems, i.e. those completely isolated from all exchanges with the environment.
In this circumstance, the mass-energy equivalence theorem states that mass conservation is समतुल्य to total energy conservation, which is the first law of thermodynamics.
By contrast, for a thermodynamically closed system ( i.e., one which is closed to exchanges of matter, but open to exchanges of non-material उर्जा, ऐसे as ऊष्मा और कार्य, साथ the परिवेश ) mass is ( usually ) only approximately conserved.
The input or आउटपुट of non-material उर्जा जरूर बदलें the द्रव्यमान of the system in relativity theory, although the change is usually small, since relatively large amounts of such energy ( by comparison with ordinary experience ) carry only a small amount of mass ( again by ordinary standards of measurement ).
In special relativity, mass is not converted to energy, since energy in all of its forms always retains its equivalent amount of mass throughout कोई परिवर्तन or translocation into, or out of, a system.
However, certain types of matter ( a different concept ) may be converted to energy, so long as the mass of the system is unchanged in the process.
However, if ऐसे उर्जा is removed from systems, they must lose the mass that is associated with it.
In general relativity, mass ( and energy ) conservation in expanding volumes of space is a complex concept, subject to different परिभाषाएं, और neither द्रव्यमान nor energy is as strictly and simply conserved as is the case in special relativity and in Minkowski space.
For a चर्चा, see mass in general relativity.
A pig is any of the animals in the genus सस, भीतर the suidae family of even-toed ungulates.
Pigs include the domestic pig, its ancestor the wild boar, and several other wild relatives.
Young and small सूअर are known as piglets.
सूअर हैं omnivores and are highly social and intelligent animals.
8-inch, -inch, and -inch floppy disks
8-inch, -inch ( full height ), and -inch drives
A 3.5-inch diskette 's `` floppy '' magnetic material, removed from its housing
A floppy disk, or diskette, is a disk storage medium composed of a disk of thin and flexible magnetic storage मीडियम, sealed in a आयताकार प्लास्टिक carrier lined with fabric that removes dust particles.
वे हैं पढ़ा and written by a floppy disk drive ( FDD ).
Floppy disks, initially as media and later in and 3.5-inch ( 90 mm ) आकार, were a ubiquitous form of data storage and exchange from the mid-1970s well into the first decade of the 21st century.
By 2010, computer motherboards were rarely manufactured with floppy drive support ; `` floppies could be used as an external USB drive, but ``, 8 ``, and non-standard drives could only be handled by old equipment.
While floppy disk drives still have कुछ सीमित उपयोग, विशेषकर with legacy industrial computer equipment, they have been superseded by data storage methods with much greater capacity, such as USB flash drives, portable external hard disk drives, optical discs, memory cards, and computer networks.
An एनिमेटेड आरेख of a cutter
In baseball, a cutter, or cut fastball, is a type of fastball which breaks slightly toward the पिचर 's दस्ताने पक्ष as it reaches home plate.
This pitch is कही between a slider and a fastball, as it is usually thrown faster than a slider but with more motion than a typical fastball.
Some pitchers use a कटर as a way to prevent hitters from expecting their regular fastballs.
A common technique used to throw a cutter is to use a four-seam fastball पकड़ with the baseball set slightly off center in the hand.
When a batter is able to hit a cutter pitch, it often results in soft contact and an easy out, due to the pitch 's गति keeping the ball away from the bat 's sweet spot.
The cutter is typically 2–5 mph slower than a pitcher 's four-seam fastball.
In 2010, the औसत पिच classified as a cutter by PITCHf/x thrown by a right-handed pitcher was 88.6 mph ; the average four-seamer was 92.1 mph.
`` What It Takes '' is a power ballad by American hard rock band Aerosmith.
It was written by Steven Tyler, Joe Perry, and डेसमंड Child.
It was released in 1990 as the third single from Aerosmith 's critically and commercially successful 1989 album Pump.
In the video The Making of Pump, A & R man जॉन kalodner वर्णित the song as `` a masterpiece ''.
During live performances, Tyler sings the पहला श्लोक a cappella and belts out one of his signature screams right before the chorus.
The एल्बम संस्करण of the song is followed by an untitled hidden track.
Head of Odysseus from a Greek 2nd century BC marble group representing Odysseus blinding Polyphemus, found at the villa of tiberius at sperlonga
विवरण of an ancient Roman mosaic of Ulysses in Tunisia
Odysseus ( or ; यूनानी :, ), भी known by the Roman name Ulysses ( ; ), was a legendary Greek king of Ithaca and a hero of Homer 's epic poem the Odyssey.
Odysseus also plays a key role in Homer 's Iliad and अन्य works in that same Epic Cycle.
Husband of Penelope, father of Telemachus, and son of Laërtes ( or Sisyphus ) and Anticlea, Odysseus is renowned for his brilliance, guile, and versatility ( polytropos ), and is hence known by the epithet Odysseus the Cunning ( mētis, or `` cunning intelligence `` ).
He is most famous for the ten eventful years he took to वापसी घर बाद the decade-long Trojan War and his famous Trojan Horse ploy to capture the city of Troy.
Erie is a Statutory Town in Boulder and Weld counties in the U.S. राज्य of कोलोराडो.
The population according to the 2010 census is 18,135 and was recorded as 6,291 at the 2000 census.
The Town of Erie is located just west of I-25 for easy access to I-70, Denver International Airport and कोलोराडो 's संपूर्ण सामने Range.
Erie 's Planning Area spans 48 square miles, extending from the north side of State Highway 52 south to State Highway 7, and between US 287 on the west and Interstate 25 to the east.
Erie is लगभग 35 मिनट्स इससे डेनवर International Airport, 25 minutes to Denver and 20 minutes from Boulder.
The Board of Trustees serves as the legislative and governing देह of the कस्बा of erie and is responsible for establishing Town policies and goals.
The Board has the authority to adopt laws, ordinances and resolutions as needed to conduct the business of the कस्बा, और by अध्यादेश may डालें into contracts or intergovernmental agreements to furnish, receive services or to provide for cooperative service delivery.
Appointed by and serving at the pleasure of the Board of Trustees, the Town Administrator is the chief operating and administrative officer of the Town and is responsible for providing professional नेतृत्व in the प्रशासन और निष्पादन of policies and objectives formulated by the Board.
The mission of the Erie Police Department is to communicate and work with the community to maintain a safe environment, prevent crime और enforce the law, while protecting the rights of all.
Erie Municipal विमानक्षेत्र ( eik ) is स्वामित्व and operated by the Town of Erie and is strategically located in the Denver-Boulder metropolitan area on Colorado Highway 7, a little over three miles west of Interstate 25.
The main runway is concrete paved and 4,700 फीट long.
The is a home video game console produced by सोनी कंप्यूटर Entertainment.
it is the successor to the प्लेस्टेशन 2, as भाग of the प्लेस्टेशन श्रेणी.
The PlayStation 3 competes with Microsoft 's Xbox 360 and निन्टेंडो 's वी as भाग of the seventh generation of video game consoles.
it थी पहला released on नवम्बर 11, 2006, in Japan, with international markets following shortly thereafter.
The console was first officially घोषित at E3 2005.
originally नियत लिये a वसन्त 2006 release date, it was delayed several times until finally hitting stores at the end of the year.
It was the first and currently only console to उपयोग blu-ray Disc as its primary storage medium.
Major features of the console include its unified online gaming service, the PlayStation Network, and its connectivity with the PlayStation Portable and PlayStation Vita, In September 2009 the updated प्लेस्टेशन 3 पतला, थी released.
This Slim is lighter and thinner than the original version, although it lacks PlayStation 2 पीछे संगतता ( removed on बाद original models ), but notably featured a re-designed logo and marketing design.
As of November 4, 2012, 70 million प्लेस्टेशन 3s have been sold worldwide.

Salvador Domingo Felipe Jacinto Dalí i Domènech, 1st Marqués de Dalí de Pubol ( May 11, 1904January 23, 1989 ), known as Salvador Dalí ( ), was a prominent Spanish surrealist painter born in Figueres, Spain.
dalí थी a skilled draftsman, best known for the striking and bizarre images in his surrealist work.
His painterly skills are often attributed to the influence of Renaissance masters.
His best-known work, the Persistence of Memory, was completed in 1931.
Dalí 's expansive artistic repertoire included film, sculpture, and photography, in collaboration with a range of artists in a variety of media.
Dalí attributed his `` love of everything that is gilded and excessive, my जुनून लिये लक्ज़री और my प्रेम of oriental clothes '' to a self-styled `` Arab lineage '', claiming that his ancestors were descended from the Moors.
Dalí was highly imaginative, and also enjoyed indulging in unusual and grandiose behavior.
His eccentric manner and attention-grabbing पब्लिक क्रियाएँ sometimes खींचा अधिक ध्यान than his artwork, to the dismay of those who held his work in high esteem, and to the irritation of his critics.

The humanities are academic disciplines that study human culture, using methods that are primarily analytical, critical, or speculative, and having a significant historical element, as distinguished from the mainly empirical approaches of the natural sciences.
The humanities include ancient and modern languages, literature, philosophy, religion, and visual and performing कला ऐसे as music and theatre.
The मानवता कि are also regarded as social sciences include history, anthropology, area studies, communication studies, cultural studies, law, economics and linguistics.
Scholars working in the humanities are sometimes वर्णित as `` humanists ''.
However, that term also describes the philosophical position of humanism, which some `` antihumanist `` scholars in the humanities reject.
Some द्वितीयक स्कूलों offer humanities classes, usually consisting of English literature, global studies, and art.
Human disciplines like history, cultural anthropology and psychoanalysis पढ़ाई विषय matters to which the experimental method does not apply, and they have access instead to the comparative method and comparative research.
The 2005 Blue Room क्रिसमस Tree
The White House Christmas Tree, also known as the Blue Room Christmas Tree, is the official अंदर क्रिसमस पेड़ at the residence of the President of the United States, the White House.
The first indoor Christmas tree was installed in the White House sometime in the 19th century ( there are varying claims as to the exact year ) and since 1961 the पेड़ रै था a प्रसंग मोटिफ at the discretion of the First Lady of the United States.
The President of the United States of America ( POTUS ) is the head of state and head of government of the संयुक्त States.
The president leads the executive branch of the federal सरकारी और is the commander-in-chief of the United States Armed Forces.
Article II of the U.S. Constitution vests the executive power of the United राज्य in the अध्यक्ष and charges him with the execution of federal law, alongside the responsibility of appointing federal executive, diplomatic, regulatory, and judicial officers, and concluding treaties with foreign powers, with the advice and consent of the Senate.
The president is further empowered to grant federal pardons and reprieves, and to convene and adjourn either or both houses of Congress under असाधारण हालातों.
Since the founding of the United States, the power of the president and the federal government have grown substantially and each modern president, despite possessing no formal legislative powers beyond signing or vetoing congressionally passed बिल्स, is largely जिम्मेदार लिये dictating the legislative agenda of his party and the foreign and domestic policy of the United States.
the अध्यक्ष is अक्सर वर्णित as the most powerful person in the world.
The president is indirectly elected by the people through the Electoral College to a four-year term, and is one of only two nationally elected federal officers, the other being the Vice President of the संयुक्त राज्य.
The Twenty-second Amendment, अपनाया in 1951, prohibits anyone from ever being elected to the presidency for a third full term.
It also prohibits a person from being elected to the presidency more than once if that person previously had served as president, or acting president, for more than two years of another person 's term as president.
In all, 43 individuals have परोसा 55 four-year terms.
On January 20, 2009, बराक ओबामा became the 44th and current president.
On November 6, 2012, he was re-elected और is scheduled to serve until January 20, 2017.
Senses are physiological capacities of जीवों that provide data for perception.
The senses and their operation, वर्गीकरण, और सिद्धान्त are overlapping topics studied by a variety of fields, most notably neuroscience, cognitive psychology ( or cognitive science ), and philosophy of perception.
The nervous system has a विशिष्ट संवेदी प्रणाली or अंग, dedicated to each sense.
Humans have a multitude of होश.
Sight ( ophthalmoception ), hearing ( audioception ), taste ( gustaoception ), smell ( olfacoception or olfacception ), and touch ( tactioception ) are the five traditionally recognized.
While the ability to detect other stimuli beyond those governed by the traditional senses exists, including temperature ( thermoception ), kinesthetic sense ( proprioception ), pain ( nociception ), balance ( equilibrioception ), acceleration ( kinesthesioception ), and various internal stimuli ( e.g. the different chemoreceptors लिये detecting नमक और कार्बन डाइऑक्साइड एकाग्रता in the रक्त ), तभी a छोटी क्रमांक of these can safely be classified as separate senses in and of themselves.
What constitutes a sense is a matter of some debate, leading to difficulties in defining what exactly a sense is.
Animals also have receptors to sense the world around them, with degrees of capability varying greatly between species.
Humans have a comparatively weak sense of smell, जबकि कुछ पशु may lack one or more of the traditional five senses.
Some animals may also intake और interpret संवेदी stimuli in very different ways.
Some species of animals are able to sense the world in a way that humans can not, साथ कुछ प्रजाति समर्थ to भाव विद्युत and magnetic fields, and detect water pressure and currents.
Spiders ( order araneae ) हैं air-breathing arthropods that have eight legs and chelicerae with fangs that inject venom.
They are the largest order of arachnids and रैंक सातवाँ in कुल प्रजाति diversity among all other groups of organisms.
Spiders are found worldwide on every continent except for Antarctica, and have become स्थापित in nearly every habitat with the exception of air and sea colonization.
As of 2008, at least 43,678 spider प्रजाति, और 109 परिवारों have been recorded by taxonomists ; however, there has been confusion within the scientific community as to how all these families should be classified, as evidenced by the over 20 different classifications that have been proposed since 1900.
Anatomically, spiders differ from other arthropods in that the usual body segments are fused into two tagmata, the cephalothorax and abdomen, और joined by a छोटी, बेलनाकार pedicel.
नापसंद कीट, spiders do not have antennae.
In all except the सबसे आदिम group, the Mesothelae, spiders have the most centralized nervous systems of all arthropods, as all their ganglia are fused into one mass in the cephalothorax.
Unlike most arthropods, मकड़ियों have no extensor muscles in their limbs and instead extend them by hydraulic pressure.
Their abdomens bear appendages that have महरूम modified into spinnerets that extrude silk from up to six types of silk glands within their abdomen.
Spider webs vary widely in size, shape and the amount of sticky लड़ी प्रयुक्त.
It now appears that the spiral orb web may be one of the earliest forms, and spiders that produce tangled cobwebs हैं more abundant and diverse than orb-web spiders.
Spider-like arachnids with silk-producing spigots appeared in the Devonian period about, but these animals apparently lacked spinnerets.
True मकड़ियों have महरूम मिला in Carboniferous rocks from, and are very similar to the most primitive surviving order, the Mesothelae.
The main groups of modern spiders, mygalomorphae और araneomorphae, first appeared in the Triassic period, before.
A herbivorous species, bagheera kiplingi, थी वर्णित in 2008, लकिन सब अन्य ज्ञात प्रजाति are predators, mostly preying on insects and on other spiders, although a few large species also take birds and lizards.
Spiders use a wide range of strategies to capture prey : trapping it in स्टिकी webs, lassoing it with sticky bolas, mimicking the prey to avoid detection, or running it down.
Most detect prey mainly by sensing vibrations, but the active hunters have अधि दृष्टि, and hunters of the genus Portia show signs of intelligence in their choice of tactics and ability to develop new ones.
मकड़ियों ' गुस्ताखी हैं too सीमित to लो solids, और वे liquidize उनके खाना by बाढ़ it साथ digestive एंजाइमों और पीस it साथ the bases of उनके pedipalps, as वे do नहीं have सच्चा जबड़े.
Male spiders identify themselves by a variety of complex courtship rituals to avoid being eaten by the महिलाओं.
males of सबसे प्रजाति जीवित a few matings, limited mainly by their short life spans.
Females weave silk egg-cases, each of which may contain hundreds of eggs.
Females of many species care for their young, for example by carrying them around or by sharing food with them.
A minority of species are social, building communal webs that may house anywhere इससे a few to 50,000 individuals.
Social behavior सीमाएँ इससे precarious toleration, as in the widow spiders, to co-operative hunting and food-sharing.
Although most spiders live for at most two years, tarantulas and other mygalomorph मकड़ियों can सजीव up to 25 सालो in captivity.
While the venom of a few species is dangerous to humans, वैज्ञानिकों are now researching the use of spider venom in medicine and as non-polluting pesticides.
Spider silk provides a combination of lightness, शक्ति और लोच that is superior to that of synthetic materials, and spider silk genes have been inserted into mammals and plants to see if these can be used as silk factories.
As a result of उनके चौड़ी दायरा of behaviors, spiders have become common symbols in art and mythology symbolizing various combinations of patience, cruelty and creative powers.
Grey 's Anatomy is an American television medical drama that premiered on the American Broadcasting Company ( एबीसी ), as a mid-season बदलना on March 27, 2005.
The series has aired nine seasons, and focuses on the fictional जीवनदान of surgical interns and residents as they gradually evolve into seasoned doctors, while trying to maintain personal lives.
The show 's premise originated with Shonda Rhimes, who serves as an executive producer, along with Betsy Beers, Mark गॉर्डन, क्रिस्टा vernoff, रोब मकई, चिह्नित Wilding, and Allan Heinberg.
The series was created to be racially diverse, utilizing a color-blind ढलाई technique.
It is primarily filmed in Los एंजिल्स, California.
The series ' protagonist is Dr. Meredith Grey ( एलेन pompeo ), who originally is accepted into the residency program at the fictional Seattle Grace Hospital.
Meredith is assigned to work under Dr. Miranda Bailey ( Chandra Wilson ), along with Dr. Cristina Yang ( Sandra oh ), dr. जार्ज o'malley ( T. R. नाईट ), dr. Izzie Stevens ( Katherine Heigl ), and Dr. Alex Karev ( Justin Chambers ).
Following O'Malley 's death and Stevens ' departure, the hospital 's विलय साथ रहमत वेस्ट brings in dr. जैक्सन Avery ( Jesse Williams ) and Dr. April Kepner ( Sarah Drew ), in the sixth season.
The surgical wing is primarily supervised by Dr. Richard Webber ( James Pickens, Jr. ), who is eventually replaced by Dr. Derek Shepherd ( Patrick Dempsey ), and later Dr. Owen Hunt ( Kevin McKidd ).
Dr. Preston Burke ( Isaiah Washington ) departs at the conclusion of the third season, and is replaced by dr. एरिका hahn ( ब्रुक स्मिथ ), जो पत्ते the दिखाएँ during the fifth season, and later Dr. Teddy Altman ( Kim Raver ), who departs at the end of the eighth season.
Introduced in the second season is Dr. Addison Montgomery ( Kate Walsh ), who leaves the show at the end of the third season, in order to launch her own spin-off medical drama निजी अभ्यास.
Dr. Callie Torres ( Sara Ramirez ) and Dr. Mark Sloan ( Eric Dane ) also डालें the दिखाएँ in the दूसरी ऋतु, while the latter dies in the premiere of the ninth season.
Meredith 's half-sister, Dr. Lexie Grey ( Chyler Leigh ), appears इससे season three and dies at the end of season eight.
Dr. Arizona Robbins ( Jessica Capshaw ) is given series regular status at the beginning of the sixth season.
Grey 's Anatomy is the highest-rated नाटक in the key 18–49 demographic.
Previously among the overall top-ten rated shows in the United States, Grey 's Anatomy has been खूब प्राप्त by critics.
Considered an प्रभाव on संस्कृति, the श्रेणी has received numerous awards, and has also been included in various critics ' top ten lists.
The show has produced several specials, as खूब as distributed all seasons to DVD, and released a collection of merchandise.
In 2012, Grey 's Anatomy was named the fifth-highest revenue earning show, in terms of advertising per half-hour.
On May 11, 2012, the श्रेणी थी नवीनीकृत for a ninth season, which premiered on September 27, 2012.
schizophrenia ( or ) is a दिमागी विकार characterized by a breakdown of thought processes and by a deficit of typical emotional responses.
Common symptoms include auditory hallucinations, paranoid or bizarre delusions, or disorganized speech and thinking, और it is accompanied by significant social or occupational dysfunction.
The onset of symptoms typically occurs in young adulthood, साथ a वैश्विक आजीवन prevalence of about 0.3–0.7 %.
Diagnosis is based on observed बर्ताव और the patient 's reported experiences.
Genetics, early environment, neurobiology, and psychological और सोशल प्रक्रियाओं appear to be important contributory factors ; some recreational and prescription drugs appear to cause or worsen symptoms.
Current research is focused on the role of neurobiology, although no single isolated organic कारण has been found.
The many possible combinations of लक्षण have triggered बहस about whether the diagnosis represents a single disorder or a number of discrete syndromes.
Despite the etymology of the term from the Greek roots skhizein ( σχίζειν, `` to split '' ) and phrēn, phren- ( φρήν, φρεν- ; `` mind '' ), schizophrenia does not imply a `` split व्यक्तित्व '', or `` अनेक व्यक्तित्व विकार '' ( जिससे is ज्ञात these days as dissociative identity disorder ) —a condition with which it is often confused in public perception.
बल्कि, the पद अर्थात् a `` splitting of mental functions '', because of the symptomatic presentation of the illness.
the mainstay of treatment is antipsychotic medication, which primarily suppresses dopamine ( and sometimes serotonin ) receptor activity.
Psychotherapy and vocational and social पुनर्वास हैं also important in treatment.
In more गंभीर cases—where there is risk to self and others— involuntary hospitalization may be necessary, although hospital stays are now shorter and less frequent than they once were.
The disorder is thought mainly to affect cognition, लकिन it भी प्रायः contributes to chronic problems with behavior and emotion.
People with schizophrenia हैं संभावित to have additional ( comorbid ) conditions, including major depression and anxiety disorders ; the lifetime occurrence of substance use disorder is almost 50 %.
Social problems, such as long-term बेरोजगारी, poverty, and homelessness are common.
The average life expectancy of people with the disorder is 12 to 15 years less than those without, the result of increased physical health समस्याएं और a उच्चतर आत्महत्या रेट ( परिचय 5 % ).
Paul Leslie snider ( अप्रैल 15, 1951–august 14, 1980 ) was the estranged husband and manager of Playboy model Dorothy Stratten, whom he murdered before killing himself the same day.
The Epic of Gilgamesh, an epic poem इससे मेसोपोटामिया, is amongst the earliest surviving works of literature.
The literary history of Gilgamesh begins with five independent Sumerian poems about 'Bilgamesh ' ( Sumerian for Gilgamesh ), किंग of Uruk.
Four of ये यहूद प्रयुक्त as सोर्स material for a combined epic in Akkadian.
This first combined epic, known as the `` Old Babylonian '' version, dates to the 18th century BC and is titled after its incipit, shūtur एली sharrī ( `` Surpassing All Other Kings '' ).
Only a few fragments of it have survived.
The later `` Standard Babylonian '' version dates from the 13th to the 10th सदियां bc और bears the incipit Sha naqba īmuru ( `` He who Saw the Deep '' ).
Fragments of approximately two thirds of this longer, twelve-tablet संस्करण have been recovered.
Some of the best copies were discovered in the library ruins of the 7th-century bc assyrian king Ashurbanipal.
The story centers on a friendship between Gilgamesh and Enkidu.
Enkidu is a wild man created by the देवताओं as gilgamesh 's equal to distract him from oppressing the people of Uruk.
Together, they journey to the देवदार Mountain to defeat Humbaba, its monstrous guardian.
Later they kill the Bull of Heaven, which the देवी इश्तार sends to punish Gilgamesh for spurning her advances.
As a punishment for these actions, the gods वाक्य enkidu to death.
The second half of the एपिक focuses on gilgamesh 's distress at Enkidu 's death, and his quest for immortality.
In order to learn the secret of eternal life, Gilgamesh undertakes a long और perilous journey.
He learns that `` The life that you are seeking you होगा never find.
जब the देवताओं निर्मित man वे allotted to him death, but life they retained in their own keeping. ''
This quote was originally attributed to Siduri in the Old Babylonian version of the epic, and then attributed to the immortal flood hero Utnapishtim in the Akkadian version of the epic.
Nevertheless, Gilgamesh 's fame lived on after his death, because of his ग्रेट भवन प्रोजेक्ट, और उसके account of what Utnapishtim told him happened during the flood.
The story has been translated into many different languages, and Gilgamesh रै चूंकि become adapted in works of popular fiction.
A eukaryote ( or ) is an organism whose cells contain complex structures enclosed within membranes.
Eukaryotes may more formally be referred to as the टैक्सोन eukarya or Eukaryota.
The defining membrane-bound ढांचा कि सेट eukaryotic कोशिकाएं apart from prokaryotic cells is the nucleus, or nuclear envelope, within which the genetic material is carried.
The उपस्थिति of a केंद्रक देता eukaryotes their name, which comes from the Greek ( eu, `` good '' ) and ( karyon, `` nut '' or `` kernel '' ).
Most eukaryotic cells also contain other membrane-bound organelles such as mitochondria, chloroplasts and the Golgi apparatus.
सब विशाल जटिल organisms are eukaryotes, including animals, plants and fungi.
The group also includes अनेक एककोशिकीय organisms.
Cell division in eukaryotes is different from that in जीवों बगैर a केंद्रक ( Prokaryote ).
It involves separating the duplicated chromosomes, through आंदोलनों निर्देशित by microtubules.
There are two types of प्रभाग processes.
In mitosis, one cell divides to produce two genetically एकसमान कोशिकाएं.
In meiosis, which is required in sexual reproduction, one diploid cell ( having two instances of each chromosome, one from each जनक ) undergoes recombination of each pair of parental chromosomes, and then two stages of cell division, resulting in four haploid cells ( gametes ).
Each gamete has just one complement of chromosomes, each a unique mix of the सम्बन्धित जोड़ी of parental गुणसूत्रों.
Eukaryota appears to be monophyletic, and so makes up एक of the तीन domains of life.
The two other domains, Bacteria and आर्किया, हैं prokaryotes and have none of the above features.
Eukaryotes represent a tiny minority of all living things ; even in a human body there are 10 times more microbes than human cells.
However, due to उनके much larger आकार उनके collective worldwide biomass is estimated at about equal to that of prokaryotes.
They are considered to have first विकसित approximately 1.6–2.1 billion years ago.
The use of Internet services or software with Internet access to defraud victims or to वरना लो advantage of them, for example by stealing personal information, which can even lead to identity theft.
A very common form of Internet fraud is the वितरण of दुष्ट security software.
Internet services can be used to present fraudulent solicitations to prospective victims, to conduct fraudulent transactions, or to transmit the proceeds of fraud to वित्तीय संस्थानों or to अन्य कनेक्ट साथ the scheme.
अंतरजाल धोखाधड़ी can occur in गपशप rooms, email, message boards, or on websites.
The International Security Assistance Force ( ISAF ) is a NATO -led security mission in Afghanistan that was established by the United Nations Security Council in दिसम्बर 2001 by रेज़ोल्यूशन 1386, as envisaged by the बॉन अनुबंध.
Its main purpose is to train the Afghan National Security Forces ( ANSF ) and assist Afghanistan in rebuilding key government institutions लकिन is भी सगाई in the 2001-present war with insurgent groups.
ISAF was initially charged with securing Kabul and surrounding क्षेत्रों इससे the तालिबान, al Qaeda and factional warlords, so as to allow for the establishment of the Afghan Transitional Administration headed by Hamid Karzai.
In अक्तूबर 2003, the un सुरक्षा परिषद प्राधिकृत the विस्तार of the isaf मिशन throughout अफगानिस्तान, और isaf subsequently विस्तारित the मिशन in चार प्रमुख चरण over the पूरे of the देश.
From 2006 to 2011, ISAF had been involved in increasingly more intensive combat operations in southern and eastern Afghanistan.
Troop contributors include from the United States, United Kingdom, NATO member राज्य और a क्रमांक of अन्य countries.
The intensity of the combat faced by contributing nations varies greatly, with the United States, United Kingdom, and Canada sustaining the majority of हताहत in intensive कॉम्बैट operations, with other contributors sustaining significantly less.
As of early 2010, there were at least 700 सैन्य bases inside Afghanistan but more were expected to be built in the coming years.
About 400 of these were used by American‐led NATO forces and 300 by ANSF.
Cocaine ( benzoylmethylecgonine ) ( INN ) is a crystalline tropane alkaloid that is obtained from the leaves of the coca plant.
The name comes from `` coca '' and the alkaloid suffix -ine, forming cocaine.
It is a उत्तेजक, an appetite suppressant, and a topical anesthetic.
Biologically, cocaine acts as a serotonin–norepinephrine–dopamine reuptake inhibitor, also known as a triple reuptake inhibitor ( TRI ).
It is addictive because of इसके effect on the mesolimbic reward pathway.
Unlike most molecules, cocaine has pockets with both high hydrophilic और lipophilic efficiency, violating the rule of hydrophilic-lipophilic balance.
This causes it to क्रॉस the blood–brain barrier far better than other psychoactive chemicals and may even induce blood-brain barrier breakdown.
It is illegal to possess, produce, or distribute cocaine for non-medicinal and non-government-sanctioned उद्देश्य in लगभग प्रत्येक country.
Whole beef tri-tip rump, roasted medium rare
The tri-tip is a cut of beef from the bottom sirloin primal cut.
It is a small triangular muscle, usually 1.5 to 2.5 पाउंड. ( 675 to 1,150g ) per side of beef.
The scientific name of this muscle is tensor fasciae latae, inserted in the fascia lata, the connective tissue covering the quadriceps femoris, also called quadriceps extensor, a group of four मांसपेशियां जिससे in turn insert in the patella, or knee cap of the animal.
Willmar is a city in, and the county seat of, Kandiyohi काउंटी, मिनेसोटा, संयुक्त States.
The population थी 19,610 at the 2010 census.
Willmar has been assigned ZIP code 56201 by the United States Postal सेवा.
U.S. Routes 12 and 71 and Minnesota State Highways 23 and 40 are four of the main routes in the city.
The Speaker of the United States House of Representatives ( or स्पीकर of the हाउस ) is the presiding officer of the chamber.
The office was established in 1789 by Article I, Section 2 of the United States Constitution, which states in part, `` The House of Representatives shall chuse their Speaker... ''
The current Speaker is John Boehner, a Republican who represents Ohio 's 8th congressional district.
The Constitution does not require that the Speaker be a Member of Congress, but no non-member has ever been निर्वाचित to the दफ्तर.
The Speaker is second in the United States presidential line of succession, after the Vice President and ahead of the अध्यक्ष प्रो tempore of the u.S. सीनेट.
Unlike some वेस्टमिंस्टर प्रणाली parliaments, in जिससे the दफ्तर of स्पीकर is considered non-partisan, in the United States the Speaker of the House is a leadership position and the office-holder actively works to set the majority party 's legislative agenda.
The Speaker usually does not personally preside over debates, instead delegating the duty to members of the House from the majority party.
Aside from duties relating to heading the House and the majority political party, the Speaker also performs administrative and procedural कृत्यों, and represents his or her Congressional district.
A सायकिल फ़्रेम is the प्रमुख component of a bicycle, on to which wheels and other components are fitted.
The modern and most common frame design for an upright bicycle is based on the safety bicycle, and consists of two triangles, a main त्रिभुज और a युग्म पश्च triangle.
This is known as the diamond फ़्रेम.
Frames are required to be strong, stiff and light, which they do by combining अलग सामग्री और आकार.
`` Simple gravity pendulum '' model assumes no friction or air resistance.
An exemplar animation of a लोलक प्रर्दशित the गति and acceleration vectors
A pendulum is a weight निलंबित from a so that it can swing freely.
When a pendulum is displaced sideways from its resting equilibrium स्थिति, it is विषय to a restoring force due to gravity that will accelerate it back toward the equilibrium position.
When released, the restoring force combined with the pendulum 's mass causes it to oscillate about the equilibrium position, swinging back and forth.
The time for one complete cycle, a left swing and a सही झूले, is called the period.
A pendulum swings साथ a specific period which depends ( mainly ) on its length.
From its discovery around 1602 by Galileo Galilei the regular motion of pendulums was used for timekeeping, and was the world 's most सटीक timekeeping प्रौद्योगिकी जबतक the 1930s.
Pendulums are used to regulate pendulum clocks, and are used in scientific instruments such as accelerometers और seismometers.
Historically they were used as gravimeters to measure the acceleration of gravity in geophysical surveys, and even as a standard of length.
The word 'pendulum ' is new Latin, from the Latin pendulus, अर्थ 'hanging '.
The simple gravity pendulum is an idealized गणितीय model of a pendulum.
This is a वज़न ( or bob ) on the end of a massless cord suspended from a, without friction.
When given an initial push, it होगा swing back and forth at a constant amplitude.
Real pendulums are subject to friction and air drag, so the आयाम of their swings declines.
The First Battle of Bull Run, also known as First Manassas ( the name used by Confederate forces ), was fought on July 21, 1861, in Prince William County, Virginia, near the city of Manassas.
It was the first major जमीन बैटल of the American Civil War.
Just months after the प्रारंभ of the युद्ध at फोर्ट sumter, the Northern public clamored for a march against the Confederate capital of Richmond, Virginia, which they expected to bring an early end to the rebellion.
Yielding to political pressure, Brig. Gen. Irvin McDowell led his unseasoned Union Army across Bull Run against the equally inexperienced Confederate Army of Brig. Gen. P. G. T. beauregard camped near Manassas Junction.
McDowell 's ambitious plan for a surprise flank attack on the Confederate left was poorly चलाया by उसके officers and men ; nevertheless, the Confederates, who had been planning to attack the Union left flank, found themselves at an initial disadvantage.
Confederate reinforcements under Brig. Gen. Joseph E. Johnston arrived from the Shenandoah Valley by railroad and the कोर्स of the बैटल जल्दी changed.
A brigade of Virginians under a relatively unknown colonel from the Virginia Military Institute, Thomas J. Jackson, stood their ground and Jackson received his famous nickname, `` Stonewall Jackson ''.
The Confederates then launched a strong counterattack, और as the संघ सैनिकों began withdrawing under fire, many panicked and it turned into a rout as McDowell 's men frantically ran without order in the direction of Washington, D.C.
Both armies were sobered by the fierce fighting and many casualties, and realized the war was going to be much longer and bloodier than either था anticipated.

मौसम is the state of the atmosphere, to the degree that it is hot or cold, wet or dry, calm or stormy, clear or cloudy.
Most weather phenomena occur in the troposphere, just below the stratosphere.
Weather generally refers to day-to-day temperature और वर्षण कार्यकलाप, whereas जलवायु is the term for the average atmospheric conditions over longer periods of time.
When used without qualification, `` weather '' is understood to be the weather of Earth.
Weather is driven by air pressure ( temperature and नमी ) मतभेद between one place and another.
These pressure and temperature differences can occur due to the sun angle at any particular spot, which varies by latitude from the tropics.
The strong temperature कंट्रास्ट between polar and tropical air gives rise to the jet stream.
Weather प्रणालियों in the mid-latitudes, such as extratropical cyclones, are caused by instabilities of the jet stream flow.
Because the Earth 's axis is tilted relative to its orbital plane, sunlight is incident at different angles at अलग times of the year.
On Earth 's surface, temperatures usually range ±40 °C ( −40 °F to 100 °F ) annually.
Over thousands of years, changes in Earth 's कक्षा affect the amount and distribution of solar energy received by the Earth and influence long-term climate and global climate change.
Surface temperature differences in turn कारण दबाव मतभेद.
Higher altitudes are cooler than lower altitudes due to differences in compressional heating.
Weather forecasting is the application of science and technology to predict the state of the atmosphere for a भविष्य समय और a दिए स्थान.
The atmosphere is a chaotic system, so small changes to one part of the system can grow to have large प्रभाव on the system as a whole.
Human attempts to control the weather have occurred throughout human history, and there is evidence कि इंसान कार्यकलाप ऐसे as agriculture and industry has inadvertently modified weather patterns.
अध्ययन कैसा the मौसम works on other planets has been helpful in understanding how weather works on Earth.
A famous landmark in the Solar System, Jupiter 's Great Red Spot, is an anticyclonic storm known to have existed लिये at तनिक 300 years.
However, weather is not limited to ग्रहीय लाशें.
A star 's corona is constantly being lost to space, creating what is essentially a very thin atmosphere throughout the Solar System.
The movement of mass ejected from the Sun is known as the सौर हवा.
Katy Perry is an American singer-songwriter from Santa बारबरा, कैलिफ़ोर्निया.
She signed साथ Capitol Records.
Perry has released three studio albums, including her debut Christian effort Katy Hudson, One of the Boys, और teenage सपना.
Perry 's mainstream career थी kicked off with the massive chart success of her debut single `` I Kissed a Girl ``.
During her career, Perry has been nominated for numerous major म्यूज़िक awards, primarily for Teenage Dream and One of the Boys.
The following is a list of sovereign states and territories where English is an official भाषा or भाषा of government.
In 2012, there were 88 states in total ( 60 sovereign states and 28 non-sovereign states ).
In many countries English is the dominant language, but does not have official status.
In Australia, English is spoken by the vast majority of the population and is the only language used in government institutions, but Australia does not have an official language.
The case is the same in the United Kingdom and the संयुक्त राज्य, हालांकि अनेक राज्य and regions within the U.S. do have English as an official language.
English is the dominant language of New Zealand and an आधिकारिक भाषा of कनाडा ( along with French ), India ( along with Hindi and several other languages ), Ireland ( along with Irish ), and the Philippines ( along with Tagalog ).
English is the sole official language of the राष्ट्रमंडल of Nations and the Commonwealth Games.
English is one of the आधिकारिक भाषाएं of the United Nations, the European Union and the International Olympic Committee.
Many of these countries are current or former colonies or dependencies of the United Kingdom ( see also British Empire ), or of the United States, itself a former colony of the UK.
Notable exceptions include Rwanda, which was a पूर्व belgian colony and Eritrea, which was an Italian colony where the British Empire spanned its control only in World War II and shortly after ( 1941-1952 ).
India 's भाषाई picture is complex.
According to the Constitution of India, `` Hindi in the Devanagari script '' is the official language of the union ; and English the 'subsidiary official language ' ; however, English is mandated for the authoritative texts of all federal laws and Supreme Court निर्णय और ( साथ साथ हिंदी ) is एक of the दो भाषाएं of the भारतीय पार्लियामेंट.
English is used almost exclusively for higher education, कारोबार और विज्ञान.
Courses in majority of the schools are taught exclusively in अंग्रेज़ी.
English is extensively प्रयुक्त लिये administrative purposes in India.
India is the second-largest English-speaking country in the world by क्रमांक of अध्यक्षों, after the United States.
As such, many consider English to be the de facto official language of India.
See आधिकारिक languages of India.
The linguistic makeup of Pakistan is similarly complex.
While the national language is Urdu, English is an official language and used in business, government and law.
English is a compulsory भाषा in स्कूलों.
All school courses are सिखाया in अंग्रेज़ी.
Pakistan is the 9th largest English-speaking country in the world by जनसांख्यिकी.
Southern Cone (, ) is a geographic region composed of the southernmost areas of दक्षिण अमेरिका, दक्षिण of the Tropic of Capricorn.
Although geographically this includes Southern and part of southeast ( São Paulo ) of Brazil, in terms of political geography the Southern cone has traditionally comprised Argentina, Chile, Paraguay, and Uruguay.
In the narrowest sense, it only covers Argentina, Chile and Uruguay, bounded on the north by the states of Brazil, Paraguay, Bolivia and Peru, on the west by the Pacific Ocean, and south to the junction between the प्रशांत और अटलांटिक महासागर, जिससे it is the closest continental area of Antarctica ( 1000 km ).
High life expectancy, the highest Human Development Index of Latin America, high Standard of living, significant participation in the global markets and the emerging economy of its members make the दक्षिणी कोन the सबसे prosperous macro-region in दक्षिण America.
For multi-event athletic प्रतियोगिताओं see Track and Field Competitions, section `` Meetings ''.
Meetings are sometimes आयोजित around सम्मेलन tables.
In a meeting, two or more people आइये साथ to discuss one or more topics, often in a formal setting.
An official game in baseball, also sometimes called a regulation खेल, is a खेल कि रै progressed beyond the point at which it can be considered complete if necessary.
This is approximately the halfway पाइंट of the game.
In the case of inclement weather, any game which has reached this point may be stopped and shortened as needed, with the result being फाइनल, और सब रिकॉर्ड and statistics counted.
A game which has not reached this point before being stopped is either considered a suspended game ( to be continued at a later date from the point of stoppage ), or is simply canceled and replayed from the start.
( This depends on the rules of each व्यक्तिगत लीग. )
In either case, no statistics are counted जबतक the game becomes official.
चूंकि सबसे पेशेवर baseball games are nine innings long, the fifth inning is used as the threshold for an official game.
If the visiting team is leading, or the खेल is tied, the end of the fifth inning marks this point.
If the home team ( which bats last ) is already ahead in the score, and theoretically would not need इसके हाफ of the पांचवां inning, then 41⁄2 innings ( i.e., the middle of the fifth ) is considered an official game.
The game is also considered आधिकारिक if the घर टोली scores to take the lead in the bottom of the fifth inning, since the game would end immediately if the same thing happened in the ninth.
In nearly सब मामले, the `` आधिकारिक खेल '' status is used to determine whether a rain check will be honored for fans holding tickets.
If a game is started but does not reach the point of becoming official, fans are entitled to a new ticket for the make-up game or ( in most cases ) any अन्य उपलब्धियाँ खेल of उनके choice.
If a खेल is halted after it becomes official, the game is simply shortened and no rain check is given.
The `` आधिकारिक खेल '' statistic प्राप्त कुछ ध्यान during the 1995 season, when Cal Ripken, Jr. was approaching the record for consecutive games played, previously held by Lou Gehrig.
Large numbers were hung on the side of the B & O Warehouse at Oriole Park at camden गज to दिखाएँ the क्रमांक of games in Ripken 's streak.
Each day, a new number was unfurled during the fifth inning after each game had become official ( since the statistic would not have counted if the game had been stopped before that point ).
A similar practice has been used to count down toward the demolition of several stadiums ( including Veterans Stadium in Philadelphia in 2003, Busch Memorial Stadium in St. Louis in 2005, and the original Yankee Stadium and Shea Stadium in New York City in 2008 ) ; as each game became official, the team होता unveil a नई ( निम्नतर ) क्रमांक प्रर्दशित the क्रमांक of games left to be played in the stadium.
A telephone number or phone number is a sequence of digits used to call from one telephone line to another in a पब्लिक switched telephone network.
When telephone numbers were invented, वे यहूद छोटी — as few as one, two or three digits — and were given orally to a switchboard operator.
As phone systems have grown and interconnected to encompass the world, telephone numbers have become longer.
In addition to telephones, वे अभी अभिगम other devices, such as computers and fax machines.
The number contains the information necessary to identify uniquely the intended endpoint for the telephone call.
Each such endpoint जरूर have a unique number within the public switched telephone network.
Most countries use fixed length numbers ( for normal lines at least ) and therefore the number of endpoints determines the necessary लंबाई of the टेलीफोन number.
It is also possible for each subscriber to have a set of shorter numbers for the endpoints सबसे प्रायः used.
These `` shorthand '' or `` speed calling '' numbers are automatically translated to unique telephone संख्याएँ पहले the कॉल can be connected.
Some special services have their own short numbers ( e.g., 1-1-9, 9-1-1, 0-0-0, 9-9-9, 1-1-1, and 1-1-2 being the Emergency Services numbers for China, Japan, South Korea, Taiwan and Sri Lanka ; Canada and the United States ; Australia ; the United Kingdom, Ireland, South Africa, Poland, Saudi Arabia, the United Arab Emirates, Morocco, Macao, Bahrain, Qatar, Bangladesh, Botswana, Ghana, Kenya, Hong Kong, Malaysia, Mauritius, Singapore, Zimbabwe, Trinidad, Tobago ; New जीलैंड ; कुवैत और the यूरोपीय संघ, क्रमशः. )
Many systems also allow calls within a local area to be made without डायलिंग the लोकल क्षेत्रफल code.
For example, a phone number in North America will start with तीन numbers ( such as 661 ), which is the area code, followed by seven digits split into sections of three and four ( such as 550-1212 ), which is the local number.
Some क्षेत्रों अभी have अनिवार्य ten-digit dialing in place, even for local calls.
Most telephone networks today ( exceptions being private intercom and secure phone networks ) are interconnected in the international telephone network, where the format of telephone numbers is standardized by ITU-T in the अनुशंसा E.164.
This specifies that the entire number चाहिए be 15 अंक or shorter, and begin with a country prefix.
For most countries, this is followed by an area code or city code and the subscriber number, which might consist of the code for a particular telephone exchange.
ITU-T recommendation E.123 describes how to represent an अंतरराष्ट्रीय टेलीफोन number in writing or print, starting with a plus sign ( `` + '' ) and the country code.
When calling an अंतरराष्ट्रीय क्रमांक इससे a फिक्स्ड लकीर फोन, the + जरूर be replaced with the international call prefix chosen by the country the call is being made from.
Some मोबाईल फोन allow the + to be entered directly.
The format and allocation of local phone numbers are controlled by प्रत्येक स्वदेश 's संबंधित सरकारी, either directly or by sponsored organizations ( such as NANPA overseen by NeuStar Inc. ).
Before a telephone call is कनेक्ट, the टेलीफोन number must be dialed by the calling party or Caller.
The called party might have equipment that presents caller ID before the कॉल is answered.
A collection agency is a business that pursues payments of debts owed by individuals or businesses.
Most collection एजेंसियों operate as एजेंटों of creditors and collect debts for a fee or percentage of the total amount owed.
There are अनेक types of collection agencies.
First-party agencies are oftentimes subsidiaries of the असली company the debt is owed to.
third-party एजेंसियों हैं पृथक कंपनियाँ contracted by a company to collect debts on their behalf for a fee.
Debt buyers purchase the debt at a percentage of its value, then attempt to collect it.
Each country has its own rules and regulations regarding उन्हें.

Cannabis, also known as marijuana ( from the Mexican स्पेनी marihuana ), और by other names, is a preparation of the Cannabis plant intended for use as a psychoactive drug and as medicine.
Pharmacologically, the principal psychoactive constituent of cannabis is tetrahydrocannabinol ( THC ) ; it is one of 483 known compounds in the plant, including at least 84 other cannabinoids, such as cannabidiol ( CBD ), cannabinol ( CBN ), tetrahydrocannabivarin ( THCV ).
and cannabigerol ( CBG ).
This is a list of American football quarterbacks who have started for the Washington Redskins, as well as its predecessors the Boston Braves ( 1932 ) and Boston Redskins ( 1933 – 1936 ), in the नेशनल फ़ुटबॉल League ( NFL ).
The Washington Redskins franchise was originally संस्थापित in बोस्टन, Massachusetts as the Boston Braves, named after the local baseball franchise.
The name was बदला the following year to the Redskins.
In 1937, the मताधिकार moved to Washington, D.C.

1st Special Forces Operational Detachment-Delta ( 1st SFOD-D ), popularly known as Delta Force, is one of the United States ' four secretive tier-one counter-terrorism and खास Mission Units.
It was formerly listed as the Combat Applications Group by the Department of Defense but has since महरूम officially re-designated the Army Compartmented Elements ( ACE ).
While 1st SFOD-D is administratively समर्थित by USASOC, it falls under the operational control of the Joint Special Operations Command.
Delta Force and its Navy counterpart, the Naval Special Warfare Development Group, are the United States military 's प्राथमिक counter-terrorism units.
Delta Force 's primary tasks are counter-terrorism, direct action, and national intervention operations, although it is an extremely versatile group capable of conducting many types of covert missions, including, but not limited to, hostage rescues and raids.
The Central Intelligence Agency 's highly secretive खास क्रियाएँ Division ( SAD ) and more specifically its elite Special Operations Group ( SOG ) often works with – and recruits – operators from Delta Force.
Alpha decay is one example type of radioactive decay, in which an atomic nucleus emits an alpha particle, and thereby transforms ( or 'decays ' ) into an atom with a mass number 4 कम और परमाणु क्रमांक 2 less.
Many other types of decays are संभावित.
Radioactive decay, also known as nuclear decay or radioactivity, is the process by which a nucleus of an अस्थिर अणु loses उर्जा by emitting particles of ionizing radiation.
A material that spontaneously emits this kind of radiation — which includes the emission of energetic alpha particles, beta particles, और गामा किरणें — is माना radioactive.
There are many different types of radioactive क्षय ( see table below ).
A decay, or loss of energy, results when an atom with one type of nucleus, called the parent radionuclide, transforms to an atom with a nucleus in a different राज्य, or to a अलग केंद्रक containing different numbers of protons and neutrons.
Either of these products is named the बेटी nuclide.
In some decays the parent and daughter are different chemical elements, and thus the decay process results in nuclear transmutation ( सृष्टि of an अणु of a new element ).
The first decay प्रक्रियाओं to be खोजा यहूद alpha decay, beta decay, and gamma decay.
Alpha decay occurs when the nucleus ejects an अल्फा particle ( helium nucleus ).
This is the most common process of emitting nucleons, but in rarer types of decays, nuclei can eject protons, or specific nuclei of other elements ( in the प्रक्रम पुकारा cluster decay ).
Beta decay occurs when the nucleus emits an इलेक्ट्रॉन or positron and a type of neutrino, in a process that changes a proton to a neutron or the other way around.
The nucleus may capture an orbiting electron, converting a प्रोटॉन into a neutron ( electron capture ).
All of these प्रक्रियाओं result in nuclear transmutation.
By contrast, there exist radioactive decay processes that do not परिणाम in transmutation.
The energy of an excited nucleus may be emitted as a गामा रे in गामा क्षय, or प्रयुक्त to eject an orbital electron by interaction with the excited nucleus in a process called internal conversion.
Radioisotopes occasionally emit neutrons, and इस परिणाम in a change in an element from one isotope to another.
One type of radioactive decay results in products which are not defined, but appear in a range of `` pieces '' of the original nucleus.
This decay is पुकारा spontaneous fission.
This decay happens जब a विशाल अस्थिर nucleus spontaneously splits into two ( and occasionally three ) smaller daughter nuclei, and usually emits gamma rays, neutrons, or other particles as a consequence.
Radioactive decay is a stochastic ( i.e., random ) process at the level of single atoms, in that, according to quantum theory, it is impossible to predict when a particular atom will decay.
However, the chance that a given atom will decay is निरंतर over time.
For a large number of atoms, the decay rate for the collection is computable from the measured decay constants of the nuclides ( or equivalently from the half-lifes ).
Waxing is a form of semi-permanent hair हटाना जिससे removes the hair from the root.
New hair will not grow back in the previously waxed area for two to आठ सप्ताह, हालांकि कुछ लोगों will start to see regrowth in only a week.
Almost any area of the body can be waxed, including eyebrows, face, bikini area, legs, arms, वापस, उदर and feet.
There are many types of waxing suitable for removing unwanted hair.
स्ट्रिप वैक्सिंग is संपन्नता by spreading a wax thinly over the skin.
A cloth or paper strip is then pressed on the शीर्ष और ripped बंद the direction of hair growth.
इस removes the wax along with the hair.
Strip wax can also be made at home using lemon juice, water, sugar and honey.
Hot waxing utilizes Hot wax ( as opposed to स्ट्रिप wax ).
In this case, the मोम is लागू somewhat thickly and with no cloth or paper strips.
The wax then hardens when it cools, thus allowing the easy removal by a चिकित्सक बगैर the सहायता of cloths.
This waxing method is very फायदेमंद to people who have sensitive skin.
Wall painting ( 1st century AD ) from pompeii depicting a multigenerational banquet
Ancient Roman culture existed throughout the लगभग 1200-year इतिहास of the सभ्यता of Ancient Rome.
The term refers to the culture of the Roman Republic, later the Roman Empire, which, at its शिखर, covered an क्षेत्रफल इससे lowland स्कॉटलैंड और मोरक्को to the Euphrates.
Life in ancient Rome revolved around the city of Rome, its famed seven hills, and its monumental structures such as the Flavian Amphitheatre ( now called the Colosseum ), the Forum of Trajan, and the Pantheon.
The city also had अनेक थिएटर, gymnasiums, and many taverns, baths, and brothels.
Throughout the territory under ancient Rome 's control, residential architecture ranged from very modest houses to country villas, and in the capital city of Rome, वहीँ were imperial residences on the elegant Palatine Hill, from which the word palace is derived.
The vast majority of the जनसांख्यिकी जिया in the नगर center, packed into insulae ( apartment blocks ).
The city of Rome was the largest megalopolis of that time, with a population that may well have exceeded एक लाख लोगों, साथ a ऊँची समाप्त अनुमान of 3.6 लाख and a low end estimate of 450,000.
Historical estimates indicate that around 30 percent of the population under the city 's jurisdiction lived in innumerable urban centers, with population of at least 10,000 and several military settlements, a very high rate of urbanization by pre-industrial standards.
The most urbanized part of the साम्राज्य was Italy, which had an estimated rate of urbanization of 32 %, the same rate of urbanization of England in 1800.
Most Roman towns and cities had a forum, temples and the same type of इमारतें, on a smaller scale, as found in Rome.
The large urban population required an endless supply of food which was a complex logistical task, including acquiring, transporting, storing और वितरण of food for Rome and other urban centers.
Italian farms supplied vegetables and fruits, but fish और मांस यहूद luxuries.
Aqueducts were built to bring water to urban centers और वाइन और आयल यहूद imported from Hispania, Gaul and Africa.
There was a very large amount of commerce between the provinces of the Roman Empire, since its transportation प्रौद्योगिकी थी बहुत कुशल.
The average costs of transport and the प्रौद्योगिकी यहूद comparable with 18th-century Europe.
The later city of Rome did not fill the स्पेस भीतर इसके प्राचीन Aurelian walls until after 1870.
Eighty प्रतिशत of the जनसांख्यिकी अंतर्गत the क्षेत्राधिकार of ancient Rome lived in the countryside in settlements with less than 10 thousand inhabitants.
Landlords generally resided in cities and their estates were left in the care of farm managers.
The plight of rural slaves थी generally बदतर than their counterparts working in urban aristocratic households.
To stimulate a higher labor productivity most landlords freed a large number of स्लेव and many received wages.
Some records indicate that `` as many as 42 people lived in एक छोटी फार्म हट in Egypt, while six families owned a single olive tree. ''.
Such a rural environment continued to induce migration of population to urban centers until the early 2nd century, when the urban जनसांख्यिकी रोका growing and started to decline.
Starting in the middle of the 2nd century BC, private Greek culture was increasingly in ascendancy, in spite of tirades against the `` softening '' effects of Hellenized culture इससे the conservative moralists.
By the time of Augustus, cultured Greek household slaves taught the रोमन यंग ( sometimes भी the लड़कियों ) ; chefs, decorators, secretaries, doctors, and hairdressers—all came from the Greek East.
Greek sculptures adorned Hellenistic लैंडस्केप बागवानी on the palatine or in the villas, or were imitated in Roman sculpture yards by Greek slaves.
The Roman cuisine preserved in the cookery books ascribed to apicius is essentially Greek.
Roman writers disdained Latin for a संस्कारी यूनानी स्टाइल.
Only in law and governance was the Italic nature of रोम 's accretive संस्कृति supreme.
Against this human background, both the urban and rural setting, one of इतिहास 's सबसे influential civilizations took shape, leaving behind a cultural legacy that survives in part today.
James Joseph `` डफी '' Waldorf, Jr. ( born August 20, 1962 ) is an American professional golfer.
