A political campaign is an organized effort which seeks to influence the decision making process within a specific group.
In democracies, political campaigns often refer to चुनावी अभियान, wherein representatives are chosen or referendums are decided.
In modern politics, the सबसे ऊँची profile political campaigns are focused on candidates for head of state or head of government, often a President or Prime Minister.
Elizabeth Cady Stanton and her daughter, Harriot
Elizabeth Cady Stanton ( November 12, 1815 – अक्तूबर 26, 1902 ) was an American social activist, abolitionist, and leading figure of the early women 's rights movement.
Her Declaration of Sentiments, presented at the first women 's rights convention held in 1848 in Seneca Falls, New York, is often credited with initiating the पहला व्यवस्थित women 's rights and women 's suffrage movements in the United States.
Before Stanton narrowed her political focus almost exclusively to women 's rights, she was an active abolitionist together with her husband, Henry Brewster Stanton and cousin, Gerrit Smith.
नापसंद अनेक of those involved in the women 's rights movement, Stanton addressed various issues pertaining to women beyond voting rights.
Her concerns included women 's parental and custody rights, प्रॉपर्टी अधिकारों, employment and income rights, divorce, the economic health of the family, and birth control.
वो थी भी an outspoken supporter of the 19th-century temperance movement.
After the American Civil War, Stanton 's commitment to female suffrage caused a schism in the women 's rights movement when she, together with Susan B. Anthony, declined to support passage of the fourteenth और पंद्रहवीं amendments to the United States Constitution.
वो opposed giving added legal protection and voting rights to African American men while women, black and white, were denied those same rights.
Her position on this issue, together with her thoughts on organized Christianity and women 's issues beyond voting rights, led to the formation of two separate women 's rights संगठन कि यहूद आखिरकार rejoined, साथ stanton as अध्यक्ष of the संयुक्त संगठन, लगभग twenty years after her break from the original women 's suffrage movement.
Stanton died in 1902 having authored both The Woman 's Bible and her आत्मकथा, साथ साथ अनेक आलेख और pamphlets concerning female suffrage and women 's rights.
My Fair Lady is a musical based upon George Bernard Shaw 's pygmalion and with book and lyrics by Alan Jay Lerner and music by Frederick Loewe.
The story concerns Eliza Doolittle, a काकनी पुष्प लड़की जो takes वाक lessons इससे प्राध्यापक Henry Higgins, a phoneticist, so that she may pass as a well-born lady.
The musical 's 1956 Broadway production was a hit, setting what was then the record for the longest run of कोई प्रमुख musical थिएटर उत्पादन in history.
It was followed by a hit लंदन production, a popular film version, and numerous revivals.
It has been पुकारा `` the perfect musical ''.
Deregulation is the act or process of removing or reducing state regulations.
It is therefore opposite of regulation, which refers to the process of the government regulating निश्चित activities.

the संजाल 's फ्लैगशिप station is WBZ-FM /98.5- Boston, Massachusetts.

bob Beers provides color commentary.

For the poem by Sara teasdale, देखिए There Will Come Soft Rains.
`` There Will Come Soft Rains '' is a short story by science fiction author Ray Bradbury which was first published in the May 6, 1950 issue of Collier 's.
Later that same year the स्टोरी थी शामिल in Bradbury 's The Martian Chronicles ( 1950 ).
With over 1.2 billion people, Han Chinese is the largest जातीय समूह in the संसार.
Pashtun people of the Pashtunistan region, which sits in an area between south of the Hindu Kush in Afghanistan और the सिंधु नदी in पाकिस्तानी.
वे number around 50 million.
The Korowai people of Papua गिने बस around 3,000 people, and were uncontacted until the 1970s.
Ethnicity or ethnic group is a socially defined category आधारित on आम संस्कृति or nationality.
नस्ल can, लकिन करता नहीं have to, शामिल आम ancestry, रूप, भोजन, ड्रेसिंग स्टाइल, विरासत, इतिहास, भाषा or dialect, धर्म, प्रतीकों, परंपराओं, or अन्य सांस्कृतिक फ़ैक्टर.
Ethnic identity is constantly reinforced through common characteristics which set the समूह apart from other groups.
The 19.9 MW Gemasolar solar plant in Spain features 15 hours of storage and can supply power 24 घंटों a day.
Solar energy, radiant light and heat from the sun, has been harnessed by humans since ancient times using a range of ever-evolving technologies.
Solar energy technologies include solar heating, solar photovoltaics, solar thermal electricity, solar architecture and artificial photosynthesis, which can make considerable contributions to solving some of the सबसे तात्कालिक उर्जा समस्याएं the world now faces.
Solar technologies are broadly characterized as either passive solar or active solar depending on the रास्ता वे कैप्चर, convert and distribute solar energy.
Active solar techniques शामिल the use of photovoltaic panels and solar thermal collectors to harness the energy.
Passive solar techniques शामिल orienting a भवन to the सूर्य, selecting materials with favorable thermal mass or light dispersing properties, and designing spaces that naturally circulate air.
In 2011, the International Energy Agency said that `` the विकास of सस्ती, inexhaustible और साफ सौर energy technologies will have huge longer-term benefits.
It will increase countries’ energy security through reliance on an indigenous, inexhaustible and mostly import-independent resource, enhance sustainability, reduce pollution, lower the costs of mitigating climate change, and keep fossil fuel prices lower than otherwise.
These advantages हैं global.
Hence the additional costs of the incentives for early deployment should be considered learning investments ; वे जरूर be बुद्धिमानी spent and need to be widely shared ''.
The classical Latin alphabet or Roman alphabet evolved from a western variety of the Greek alphabet called the Cumaean alphabet, which was अपनाया और परिवर्धित by the etruscans who ruled early Rome.
The Etruscan alphabet was in turn adopted and further modified by the ancient Romans to लिखें the Latin language.
During the Middle Ages, the Latin alphabet was adapted to Romance languages, direct descendants of लैटिन, as well as to Celtic, Germanic, Baltic, and some Slavic languages.
With the age of colonialism and Christian evangelism, the Latin script was spread overseas, and applied to indigenous American, ऑस्ट्रेलियाई, ऑस्ट्रोनीशियाई, austroasiatic, and African languages.
More recently, linguists have also tended to prefer the Latin script or the अंतरराष्ट्रीय ध्वन्यात्मक वर्णमाला ( itself largely based on Latin script ) when transcribing or creating written standards for non-European languages, such as the African reference alphabet.
The term Latin alphabet may refer to either the alphabet used to write Latin ( as described in this article ), or other alphabets based on the Latin script, which is the basic set of letters common to the विभिन्न alphabets descended from the classical Latin one, such as the English alphabet.
These Latin-derived alphabets may discard letters, like the Rotokas alphabet, or add new अक्षर, जैसे the डैनिश और नॉर्वेजियाई alphabet.
Letter shapes have changed over the centuries, सहित the सृष्टि for Medieval Latin of lower case forms which did not exist in the Classical period.
The assassination of United States President Abraham Lincoln took place on Good Friday, April 14, 1865, as the अमरीकी सिविल युद्ध was drawing to a close.
The assassination occurred five days after the commander of the Confederate Army of उत्तरी वर्जिनिया, सामान्य रॉबर्ट E. Lee, surrendered to Lieutenant General Ulysses S. Grant and the Union Army of the Potomac.
Lincoln was the first American president to be assassinated, though an unsuccessful attempt had been made on एंड्रयू जैक्सन 30 सालो पहले in 1835.
The assassination was नियोजित and carried out by the well-known stage actor John Wilkes Booth, as part of a larger conspiracy in a bid to revive the Confederate cause.
Booth 's co-conspirators were Lewis Powell and David Herold, who were assigned to kill Secretary of State William H. Seward, and George atzerodt जो थी to मार वाइस अध्यक्ष Andrew Johnson.
By simultaneously eliminating the top तीन लोगों in the प्रशासन, Booth and his co-conspirators hoped to sever the continuity of the United States government.
Lincoln was shot while watching the play Our American Cousin with his wife Mary Todd Lincoln at Ford 's Theatre in Washington, D.C. on the night of अप्रैल 14, 1865.
He died early the next morning.
The rest of the conspirators ' plot failed ; Powell only managed to wound seward, जबकि Atzerodt, Johnson 's would-be assassin, lost his nerve and fled Washington.

Video game accessory, a piece of hardware used in conjunction with a video game console लिये playing वीडियो खेल
Club level seating is a special section of seating in modern sports stadiums.
The Club Level is usually located towards the middle of the stage of seating भाग, ऊपर the lower deck but below the upper deck.
They are प्रायः right next to the Luxury Boxes, either right above, right below, or sandwiched between two levels of Luxury Boxes.
Club Level seating is considered as higher class than sitting anywhere else in the arena, but lower class compared to the Luxury Boxes.
Unlike the Luxury Boxes, most club स्तर do नहीं wrap entirely around the arena.
Some club levels stop at a certain point, giving way to an expansion of the मेज़ानाइन, while others give way to lower class Luxury Boxes ( such as `` Party Suites '' ).
A notable एक्सेप्शन to this is Emirates Stadium in London, which has a complete tier of club seating.
Club स्तर allow fans multiple levels of entertainment.
Club Level seating is open to the elements, as opposed to the entirely enclosed luxury boxes, which gives अधिक of an बाहरी छाप at roofless and open-roof stadiums and arenas.
क्लबों स्तर seating is normally bought on a contract basis to allow for maximum profit on the part of the stadium.
The Club Level provides fans with special access to an indoor part of the arena exclusive to प्रशंसक with special tickets.
These areas are air conditioned and allow access to special restaurants, merchandise स्टैंड, और लाउंज क्षेत्रों of the stadium that are not otherwise available.
Concession स्टैंड और विक्रेता on the Club Level also often offer different menus than in other stands to give more of a special feel to the Club.
These areas are बंद बंद to the बाकी of the stadium, and they usually can only be accessed through the exclusive, private club entrances.
Sophia Loren ( ; born Sofia Villani Scicolone ; 20 September 1934 ) is an इतालवी actress.
Loren is widely recognized as Italy 's सबसे प्रसिद्ध and honored actress.
She was the first actress of the talkie era to जीत an अकादमी पुरस्कार लिये a non-english-speaking performance, for her portrayal of Cesira in Vittorio De Sica 's Two Women.
Her other awards include a Grammy Award, five खास सुनहरी ग्लोब्स, a BAFTA Award and a Laurel Award.
In 1995 she received the Cecil B. DeMille Award for lifetime achievements, एक of अनेक ऐसे पुरस्कार.
Her films include : Houseboat ( 1958 ), El Cid ( 1961 ), Yesterday, Today and Tomorrow ( 1963 ), Marriage Italian-Style ( 1964 ), और A Special Day ( 1977 ).
In later सालो वो रै appeared in American blockbusters such as Grumpier Old Men ( 1995 ), and Nine ( 2009 ).
In 1994 she starred in Robert Altman 's prêt-à-porter, जिससे अर्जित her a Golden Globe nomination the same year.
She has also achieved critical and commercial success in tv फिल्मों such as Courage ( 1986 ).
Deaths for self-inflicted injuries per 100,000 निवासियों in 2004.
Incidence of suicide is underreported due to both religious and social pressures, और संभवतः completely unreported in some areas.
Nevertheless, from reported cases, certain रुझान हैं apparent.
Since the data is skewed, comparing suicide rates between nations is statistically unsound.
The trends themselves are not the cause, लकिन may be indicative of a root cause.

Hospital Emergency Codes are used in hospitals worldwide to alert staff to various emergencies.
The use of codes is intended to convey essential information quickly and with minimal misunderstanding to staff, while preventing stress and panic among visitors to the hospital.
These codes may be posted on placards throughout the hospital, or printed on employee identification badges for ready reference.
Back of a hospital id बैज showing disaster codes.
Hospital emergency codes may denote अलग events at different hospitals, including nearby ones.
Because many physicians work at more than one facility, this may lead to confusion in emergencies, so वर्दी प्रणालियों have been proposed.
The route of the Eifel aqueduct, साथ इसके औसत slope.
The Eifel Aqueduct was एक of the longest aqueducts of the Roman Empire.
The aqueduct, constructed in AD 80, carried water some इससे the hilly Eifel region of what is now Germany to the ancient city of Colonia Claudia Ara Agrippinensium ( present-day Cologne ).
If the auxiliary spurs to additional springs are included, the length was.
The construction was almost entirely below ground, and the flow of the जल थी उत्पादित entirely by gravity.
A few bridges, including one up to in length, were needed to pass over valleys.
Unlike some of the other famous Roman aqueducts, the Eifel aqueduct was specifically designed to minimize the above-ground portion to protect it from damage and freezing.
In chemistry, a disulfide bond ( Br.E. disulphide bond ) is a covalent bond, usually derived by the coupling of two thiol groups.
The linkage is also called an SS-bond or disulfide bridge.
The overall कनेक्टिविटी is therefore R-S-S-R.
The शब्दावली is widely used in biochemistry.
In formal terms, the कनेक्शन is a persulfide, in analogy to its congener, peroxide ( R-O-O-R ), but this terminology is obscure and is no longer used ( except in reference to R-S-S-H or H-S-S-H compounds ).
Formal depiction of disulfide bond formation as an oxidation.

Religion in the United Kingdom and in the countries कि preceded it, has been dominated, for over 1,400 years, by various forms of Christianity.
According to some surveys, a majority of नागरिकों स्टिल पहचानो with Christianity, although regular church attendance has fallen dramatically since the middle of the 20th century, and immigration and demographic change have contributed to the growth of other faiths.
Religious affiliations of UK citizens are recorded by नियमित सर्वेक्षण, the चार प्रमुख ones being the UK Census, the Labour Force Survey, the British Social Attitudes survey and the European Social Survey.
According to the 2001 UK census, Christianity is the major religion, followed by islam, हिंदुत्व, Sikhism, Judaism and Buddhism in terms of number of adherents.
This, and the relatively large number of individuals with nominal or no religious affiliations has led commentators to variously describe the संयुक्त किंगडम as a multi-faith, secularised, or post-Christian society.
The United Kingdom was formed by the union of previously independent countries from 1707, and consequently most of the largest religious groups do not have UK-wide organisational structures.
While some groups have separate structures लिये the व्यक्तिगत देशों of the United Kingdom, others may have a single structure covering England and Wales or Great Britain.
Similarly, due to the relatively recent creation of उत्तरी आयरलैंड in 1921, most major religious groups in Northern Ireland are organised on an all-Ireland basis.
The 1967 Newark riots were a major civil disturbance that occurred in the city of Newark, नई जर्सी between July 12 and July 17, 1967.
The six days of rioting, लूटने, और destruction left 26 dead and hundreds injured.
In United States college athletics, redshirt is a विलंब or बर्खास्तगी of an athlete 's participation in order to lengthen his or her period of eligibility.
Typically, a student 's athletic eligibility in a given खेल is चार सीज़न, a क्रमांक निकला इससे the चार years of academic classes that are normally required to obtain a bachelor 's degree at an American college or university.
However, a छात्र खिलाड़ी may be offered the अवसर to redshirt for up to two years, which allows the athlete to spread those four years of eligibility over five, or sometimes six years.
In a redshirt year, a student athlete may attend classes at the college or university, practice with an एथलेटिक टोली, और पोशाक लिये खेल but he or she may not compete during the game.
Using this यांत्रिकी, a छात्र खिलाड़ी रै up to five academic years to use the four years of eligibility, thus becoming a fifth-year senior.
The term is used as a verb, noun, and क्रियाशील.
For example, a कोच may चुनें to redshirt a player who is then referred to as a redshirt freshman or simply a redshirt.
The opposite of this is a `` true freshman. ''
World War I ( WWI ) was a global war केंद्रित in यूरोपीय कि began on 28 July 1914 and lasted until 11 November 1918.
It was predominantly called the World War or the ग्रेट युद्ध इससे इसके occurrence जबतक the start of World War II in 1939, and the First World War or World War I thereafter.
It involved all the world 's great powers, which were assembled in two opposing alliances : the Allies ( based on the Triple Entente of the United Kingdom, France and Russia ) and the Central Powers ( originally the Triple Alliance of Germany, Austria-Hungary and Italy ; but, as Austria–Hungary had taken the offensive against the agreement, Italy did not enter into the war ).
These alliances were both reorganised and expanded as more nations entered the war : Italy, Japan and the United States joined the allies, और the Ottoman Empire and Bulgaria the Central Powers.
Ultimately, more than 70 million military personnel, सहित 60 लाख Europeans, were mobilised in one of the largest wars in history.
More than 9 million combatants यहूद killed, largely because of technological advancements that led to enormous increases in the lethality of weapons without corresponding improvements in protection or mobility.
It was the fifth- deadliest conflict in world history, subsequently paving the way for various political changes, such as revolutions in many of the nations involved.
One of the long-term causes of the war was the resurgence of imperialism in the विदेशी नीतियों of the great powers of Europe.
More immediately, the assassination of Archduke Franz Ferdinand of Austria, the heir to the throne of Austria-Hungary, on 28 June 1914 by यूगोस्लाव राष्ट्रवादी gavrilo Princip in Sarajevo triggered a diplomatic crisis when Austria-Hungary subsequently delivered an ultimatum to the Kingdom of Serbia.
Several alliances formed over the previous दशकों यहूद invoked.
Within weeks, the major powers were at war and, via their colonies, the विरोध जल्द स्प्रेड around the world.
On 28 July, the austro-hungarians fired the first shots of the war as preparation for the invasion of Serbia.
While the Russians mobilised, the Germans invaded neutral Belgium and Luxembourg on the way to France, providing a casus belli लिये ब्रिटेन 's घोषणा of युद्ध against Germany.
After the German march on Paris was brought to a halt—the so-called Miracle of the Marne —the Western Front settled into a स्थिर बैटल of attrition with a trench line that changed little until 1917.
On the Eastern Front, the Russian army was successful against the Austro-Hungarians, but was stopped in इसके आक्रमण of East Prussia by the Germans.
In नवम्बर the Ottoman Empire joined the war, opening up fronts in the Caucasus, Mesopotamia and the Sinai.
Italy and Bulgaria went to युद्ध in 1915 and Romania in 1916.
In Russia, the tsar 's government collapsed in March 1917 and a subsequent revolution in November brought the russians to शर्तें साथ the Central Powers.
After a 1918 German offensive along the western front, the Allies drove back the Germans in a series of successful offensives and American forces began entering the trenches.
Germany, which had its own trouble with revolutionaries, सहमत to an armistice on 11 November 1918.
The war ended in victory for the Allies.
Events on the home fronts were as tumultuous as on the battle fronts, as the participants tried to mobilize their manpower और आर्थिक संसाधन to लड़ो a कुल war.
By the end of the war, four major imperial powers—the German, Russian, austro-hungarian and Ottoman empires—ceased to exist.
The successor states of the former two lost a ग्रेट राशि of territory, while the latter two were dismantled entirely.
The map of central यूरोपीय was redrawn into several smaller states.
The League of Nations was formed in the आशा of preventing another such conflict.
The European nationalism spawned by the war and the breakup of empires, the repercussions of Germany 's defeat and problems with the Treaty of Versailles are agreed to be कारकों contributing to World War II.
Map of countries that declared themselves to be socialist states under the Marxist–Leninist or माओवादी परिभाषा - कि is to say, `` Communist states '' - between 1979 and 1983.
This period marked the greatest territorial extent of Communist राज्य.
A communist state is a state where the means of उत्पादन हैं collectively owned by the society.
It has a form of government characterized by single-party नियम or dominant-party नियम of a कम्युनिस्ट party ( referred as Dictatorship of the Proletariat by its proponents ) and a professed allegiance to a Leninist or Marxist–Leninist ideology as the guiding principle of the state.
Technically, `` communist state '' is a contradictio in terminis as a communist society as defined by both Marxists and anarcho-communists is in principle stateless.
From इस परिप्रेक्ष्य, the term Marxist-Leninist state is more appropriate.
Historically, a `` communist state '' referred to a system where public ownership of all or most means of उत्पादन by the कम्युनिस्ट पार्टी -run राज्य is deemed necessary to further the interests of the working class ; today, a communist state can also, for instance, refer to contemporary China and Vietnam, where a Communist Party-run state exists alongside a mixed economy.
According to Marxist–Leninists, the state is a tool in the hands of the ruling class, which in a socialist समाज is the working क्लास, so a समाजवादी state is, according to Leninists, a state of the working class.
In practice, communist states do नहीं दरअसल refer to themselves as such.
They do this not to disguise the fact that the ruling party is communist, but rather because वे do not consider themselves to be a communist society at present.
Instead, they constitutionally पहचानो themselves as socialist states or workers ' states.
The primary goal of these states, which also explains their official name, is to guide their respective countries in the प्रक्रम of भवन समाजवादी, ultimately leading to communism.
Communist states may have several legal political parties, but the communist party is usually granted a special or dominant role in government, often by statute or अंतर्गत the संविधान.
Consequently, the institutions of the राज्य और of the communist party become intimately entwined, such as in the development of parallel institutions.
In the 20th century, most कम्युनिस्ट राज्य adopted planned economies.
However, there were exceptions : The Soviet Union during the 1920s and late 1980s and Yugoslavia after World War II allowed limited markets and a degree of worker self-management, while चीन, Vietnam and Laos introduced far-reaching market reforms after the 1980s.
In the 21st century, China और वियतनाम have allowed a mixed economy to develop.
The fundamental concepts of communist राज्य प्रायः diverge from the original socio-economic ideologies from which they develop.
As a result, many adherents of ये विचारधाराओं प्रायः oppose the राजनैतिक प्रणालियों commonly associated with these states.
For example, dissenting communists such as trotskyists यहूद प्रायः opposed to the कम्युनिस्ट राज्य of the 20th सदी, claiming either that they had nothing to do with `` real '' communism or that the ideology of such states had reached a point of irrevocable corruption.
Michael Fred Phelps II ( born June 30, 1985 ) is a retired American swimmer and the most decorated Olympian of सब समय, साथ a कुल of 22 medals.
Phelps भी holds the all-time रिकॉर्ड लिये ओलम्पिक gold medals ( 18, double the second highest record holders ), Olympic gold medals in individual events ( 11 ), and Olympic medals in individual events for a male ( 13 ).
In winning eight gold medals at the 2008 Beijing Games, Phelps took the record लिये the सबसे first-place finishes at any single Olympic Games.
पाँच of those victories were in individual events, tying the single Games record.
In the 2012 Summer ओलंपिक in लंदन, फेल्प्स won four golds and two silver medals, making him the most successful athlete of the Games for the third Olympics in a row.
Phelps is the long course world recordholder in the 100-meter butterfly, 200-meter butterfly and 400-meter individual medley as well as the former long course world recordholder in the 200-meter freestyle and 200-meter individual medley.
He has won a total of 71 medals in major international long-course competition, 57 gold, 11 silver, and three कांस्य spanning the ओलंपिक, the World, and the Pan Pacific Championships.
Phelps 's international titles and record-breaking performances have earned him the World Swimmer of the Year Award seven times and अमरीकी तैराक of the साल पुरस्कार नौ times as well as the FINA Swimmer of the Year Award in 2012.
His unprecedented Olympic कामयाबी in 2008 अर्जित Phelps Sports Illustrated magazine 's Sportsman of the Year award.
After the 2008 Summer Olympics, Phelps started the Michael Phelps Foundation, which focuses on growing the खेल of तैराकी और promoting healthier lifestyles.
He expects to do further work with his foundation after the 2012 Olympics, which he has said will be his last.
Lenovo Group Limited ( ) is a Chinese multinational computer hardware and electronics company with its headquarters in बीजिंग, China and Morrisville, North Carolina and its registered office in Hong Kong, China.
Its उत्पाद शामिल निजी कंप्यूटर, टैब्लेट कंप्यूटर, मोबाईल फोन, workstations, सर्वर, इलेक्ट्रॉनिक भंडार डिवाइस, it प्रबन्धन तन्त्र और smart टेलीविज़न.
Lenovo is the world 's second-largest PC vendor by 2012 unit sales.
it बाज़ार the थिंकपैड लकीर of कोपी computers and the ThinkCentre line of desktops.
Lenovo has operations in more than 60 countries and sells इसके उत्पाद in around 160 countries.
Lenovo was संस्थापित in बीजिंग in 1984 and incorporated in Hong Kong in 1988 under its previous name, Legend.
Lenovo is सूचीबद्ध on the Hong Kong Stock Exchange and is a constituent of the Hang Seng China-Affiliated Corporations Index.
Slug is a common name for an apparently shell-less स्थलीय gastropod mollusk.
The word `` slug '' is also often used as part of the common name of any gastropod mollusc that has no shell, has a very reduced shell, or रै तभी a छोटी आतंरिक शेल.
( This is in contrast to the common name `` घोंघा ``, जिससे is लागू to gastropods कि have a coiled shell that is large enough that the soft parts of the animal can retract fully into it. )
Slugs exist on land and in the sea, and there is even one genus of freshwater slugs, Acochlidium.
the unadorned शब्द `` स्लग '' is however लागू primarily to जमीन slugs, whereas slugs इससे the समुद्र or इससे freshwater हैं प्रायः referred to as `` समुद्र slugs `` और `` freshwater slugs ''.
Land gastropods with a shell that is not quite vestigial, लकिन is too छोटी to retract into ( like many in the family Urocyclidae ), are known as semislugs.
The various taxonomic परिवारों of slugs रूप part of several quite different evolutionary lineages which also include snails.
Thus, लिये उदाहरण, the various families of land slugs are not very closely related to one another, despite a superficial similarity in the overall body form.
The shell-less condition has arisen अनेक टाइम्स independently दौरान the विकासवादी past, and thus the category `` slug '' is emphatically a polyphyletic one.
Slugs, like all other gastropods, undergo torsion ( a 180° टेढ़ी of the internal organs ) during development.
Internally, स्लग anatomy clearly shows the effects of this rotation, but externally the bodies of land slugs appear to be more or less symmetrical, except for the positioning of the pneumostome, which is on one side of the animal, normally the right hand side.
The soft, slimy bodies of slugs are prone to desiccation, so land-living slugs are confined to moist environments और जरूर रिट्रीट to नम छुपाना places when the weather is dry.
the subsequent सूचना in this article applies to land slugs.

Napoleon Bonaparte (, ; 15 August 1769 – 5 May 1821 ) was a French military and political नेता जो रोज़ to prominence during the latter stages of the French Revolution and its associated wars in Europe.
As Napoleon I, he was Emperor of the फ्रेंच इससे 1804 to 1815.
His legal reform, the Napoleonic Code, has been a प्रमुख influence on अनेक सिविल विधि jurisdictions worldwide, but he is best remembered for his role in the wars led against France by a series of coalitions, the so-called Napoleonic Wars.
He established hegemony over most of continental Europe and sought to spread the ideals of the French Revolution, while consolidating an इम्पीरियल साम्राज्य जिससे लौटी पहलुओं of the deposed Ancien Régime.
Due to his success in these wars, often against numerically superior enemies, he is generally regarded as one of the greatest सैन्य कमांडरों of सब समय, और उसके अभियान are studied at military academies worldwide.
Napoleon was born at Ajaccio in corsica in a परिवार of noble Italian ancestry which had settled Corsica in the 16th century.
He trained as an artillery officer in मेनलैंड फ़्रांस.
He rose to prominence under the फ्रेंच पहला गणतंत्र और led successful campaigns against the First and Second Coalitions arrayed against France.
He led a successful invasion of the इतालवी peninsula.
In 1799, he staged a coup d'état and installed himself as First Consul ; five years later the French Senate proclaimed him emperor, following a plebiscite in his favour.
In the first decade of the 19th century, the फ्रेंच साम्राज्य under Napoleon engaged in a series of conflicts—the Napoleonic Wars —that involved every major European power.
After a streak of victories, France secured a dominant position in continental Europe, and Napoleon maintained the French sphere of influence through the formation of extensive alliances and the appointment of friends and family members to rule other European countries as French client states.
The Peninsular War and 1812 फ्रेंच invasion of Russia marked turning points in Napoleon 's fortunes.
His Grande Armée was badly damaged in the अभियान और never fully recovered.
In 1813, the Sixth Coalition defeated his forces at Leipzig ; the following year the Coalition invaded फ़्रांस, मजबूर नेपोलियन to abdicate और exiled him to the island of Elba.
Less than a year later, he escaped Elba and returned to power, but was defeated at the Battle of वाटरलू in June 1815.
Napoleon spent the last six सालो of his life in confinement by the British on the island of Saint Helena.
An autopsy concluded he died of stomach cancer, but there has been some debate about the cause of his मौत, as कुछ विद्वानों have speculated that he was a victim of arsenic poisoning.
This is a chronological listing of the संयुक्त States Senators from Pennsylvania.
United States Senators are popularly elected, for a six-year पद, शुरूआत January 3.
चुनावों are held the first Tuesday after November 1.
Before 1914, they were chosen by the Pennsylvania General Assembly, and पहले 1935, their terms began March 4.
The South Africa national rugby union team ( known as the Springboks ) represents South Africa in rugby union.
They compete in the annual Rugby Championship, along with southern-hemisphere counterparts Argentina, Australia and नई जीलैंड.
They have won this championship on three occasions in sixteen years.
They are currently ranked second in the संसार by the अंतरराष्ट्रीय रग्बी Board, and were named 2008 World Team of the Year at the Laureus World Sports Awards.
Although South Africa was instrumental in the creation of the Rugby World Cup competition, the Springboks did not compete in the first two World Cups in 1987 and 1991 because of anti-apartheid sporting boycotts of South Africa.
the टोली बना इसके संसार कप डेब्यू in 1995, जब the newly लोकतांत्रिक दक्षिण अफ़्रीकी hosted the टूर्नामेंट.
The Springboks then defeated the All Blacks 15–12 in the final, which is now remembered as एक of the greatest moments in South Africa 's sporting history, and a watershed moment in the post-Apartheid nation-building process.
South Africa regained उनके शीर्षक as champions 12 years later, when they defeated England 15–6 in the 2007 final.
As a result of the 2007 World Cup tournament the Springboks were promoted to first place in the IRB संसार rankings, a स्थिति they held until July the following year when New Zealand regained the top spot.
The Springboks play in green and gold jerseys, and their emblems हैं the springbok और the Protea.
The side has been playing अंतरराष्ट्रीय रग्बी चूंकि 1891, जब a British Isles side toured the nation, playing South Africa in their first Test on 30 July.
South Africa was coached by जेक श्वेत, जो led the Boks to the 2007 World Cup title, announcing his resignation effectively from the end of 2007.
His replacement 's ( पीटर de villiers ) अनुबंध समाप्त in 2011, following a 11–9 defeat to Australia in the Rugby World Cup quarter-final, who then stated he would not be signing a new deal.
The previous captain was John Smit, who before he रिटायर्ड in 2011 निभाई hooker for most of his career, although he has also been a prop, mainly in 2008 and 2009.
Due to Smit being unavailable लिये the नवम्बर 2010 Tests after surgery, lock Victor Matfield took Smit 's place as captain for that tour.
The current captain is जां de Villiers.
The Battle of Gettysburg (, with an sound ), was fought July 1–3, 1863, in and around the town of Gettysburg, Pennsylvania.
It was the battle with the largest number of casualties in the अमरीकी सिविल युद्ध और is प्रायः वर्णित as the war 's turning point.
Union Maj. Gen. George Gordon Meade 's Army of the Potomac defeated attacks by Confederate Gen. Robert E. ली 's Army of Northern Virginia, ending Lee 's invasion of the North.
After his success at Chancellorsville in Virginia in May 1863, Lee led his army through the Shenandoah Valley to begin his दूसरी आक्रमण of the North—the Gettysburg Campaign.
With his army in high spirits, Lee intended to shift the focus of the summer campaign from war-ravaged northern Virginia and hoped to influence Northern politicians to give up their prosecution of the war by penetrating as far as Harrisburg, Pennsylvania, or even Philadelphia.
Prodded by President Abraham Lincoln, Maj. Gen. Joseph Hooker moved his army in pursuit, but was relieved just three days before the battle and replaced by Meade.
Elements of the two armies initially collided at Gettysburg on July 1, 1863, as Lee urgently concentrated his forces there, his objective being to engage the Union army and destroy it.
Low ridges to the northwest of town were defended initially by a Union cavalry division under ब्रिगेडियर. Gen. John Buford, and soon reinforced with two corps of Union infantry.
However, two large Confederate corps assaulted them इससे the उत्तरपश्चिम और उत्तर, collapsing the hastily developed Union lines, sending the defenders retreating through the streets of town to the hills just to the south.
On the second दिन of बैटल, most of both armies had assembled.
The Union line was laid आउट in a रक्षात्मक formation resembling a fishhook.
In the late afternoon of July 2, Lee launched a heavy assault on the Union left flank, and fierce fighting raged at Little Round Top, the Wheatfield, Devil 's Den, and the Peach Orchard.
On the संघ सही, demonstrations escalated into full-scale assaults on Culp 's Hill and Cemetery Hill.
All across the battlefield, despite significant losses, the Union defenders held their lines.
On the third दिन of बैटल, जुलाई 3, लड़ resumed on culp 's हिल, and cavalry battles raged to the east and south, but the main event was a dramatic infantry assault by 12,500 Confederates against the center of the Union line on Cemetery Ridge, known as Pickett 's Charge.
The charge was repulsed by Union rifle and artillery fire, at ग्रेट नुकसान to the confederate army.
Lee led his army on a torturous retreat back to Virginia.
Between 46,000 and 51,000 soldiers from both armies यहूद हताहत in the three-day battle.
That November, अध्यक्ष lincoln प्रयुक्त the समर्पण ceremony for the Gettysburg National Cemetery to honor the fallen Union soldiers and redefine the purpose of the war in his historic Gettysburg Address.
An academic discipline, or field of study, is a शाखा of ज्ञान that is taught and researched at the college or university level.
Disciplines are defined ( in part ), and recognized by the academic जर्नल्स in जिससे शोध is published, and the learned societies and academic departments or faculties to which their practitioners belong.
however, वहीँ exists no formal criteria for when educational programs and scholarly journals form an academic discipline.
A huge difference exists between, on the one hand, well established disciplines that exist in almost all universities all over the world, have a long history, and have a खूब स्थापित नियत of जर्नल्स and conferences, and, on the other hand, suggestions for new fields supported only by few universities and publications.
Fields of study usually have several sub-disciplines or branches, and the distinguishing लाइनों between ये हैं प्रायः दोनो मनमानी and ambiguous.
PHP is a server-side एनक्रिप्शन language designed for web development but also used as a general-purpose programming language.
PHP is now installed on more than 244 million websites and 2.1 million web servers.
Originally created by Rasmus Lerdorf in 1995, the reference क्रियान्वयन of पीएचपी is अभी उत्पादित by the पीएचपी Group.
While PHP originally stood for Personal Home Page, it now stands for PHP : Hypertext Preprocessor, a recursive acronym.
PHP code is interpreted by a web server with a PHP processor मोड्यूल जिससे generates the resulting वेब पेज : PHP commands can be embedded directly into an HTML source document rather than calling an external file to process data.
It रै भी विकसित to शामिल a command-line interface capability and can be used in standalone graphical applications.
PHP is free software released under the PHP License, जिससे is असंगत साथ the ग्नू सामान्य Public License ( GPL ) due to restrictions on the usage of the term PHP.
PHP can be deployed on most web servers and also as a standalone shell on almost every ऑपरेटिंग प्रणाली and platform, free of charge.
John Fitzgerald `` Jack '' Kennedy ( May 29, 1917 – November 22, 1963 ), often referred to by his initials JFK, was the 35th President of the United States, सेवारत इससे 1961 until his death in 1963.
बाद सैन्य सेवा as कमांडर of the Motor Torpedo Boats PT-109 and PT-59 during World War II in the South Pacific, Kennedy represented Massachusetts ' 11th congressional district in the U.S. House of Representatives from 1947 to 1953 as a Democrat.
Thereafter, he served in the U.S. Senate from 1953 until 1960.
Kennedy defeated Vice अध्यक्ष और Republican candidate Richard Nixon in the 1960 U.S. presidential election.
At 43 years of age, he is the youngest to have been elected to the दफ्तर, the second-youngest President ( after Theodore Roosevelt ), and the first person born in the 20th century to serve as president.
A Catholic, Kennedy is the only non- Protestant president, and is the तभी president to have won a Pulitzer Prize.
Events during his presidency included the Bay of Pigs Invasion, the Cuban Missile Crisis, the building of the बर्लिन वॉल, the स्पेस Race, the African-American Civil Rights Movement, and early stages of the Vietnam War.
Therein, Kennedy increased the number of military advisers, खास आपरेशन forces, and helicopters in an effort to curb the spread of communism in South East Asia.
The Kennedy administration adopted the नीति of the रणनीतिक Hamlet Program which was implemented by the South Vietnamese government.
It involved certain forced relocation, village internment, and segregation of rural South Vietnamese from the उत्तरी और दक्षिणी कम्युनिस्ट insurgents.
Kennedy was assassinated on November 22, 1963 in Dallas, Texas.
Lee घनघोर ओसवाल्ड थी चार्ज with the crime, but he was shot and killed by Jack Ruby two days later, before a trial could take place.
The FBI and the Warren Commission officially concluded that Oswald was the lone assassin.
However, the United States House चुनें कमेटी on assassinations ( HSCA ) concluded that those investigations were flawed and that Kennedy was probably assassinated as the result of a conspiracy.
However, ABC News in their investigation, The Kennedy Assassination : Beyond Conspiracy, confirmed the findings of the Warren Commission ; having concluded Oswald acted alone.
Kennedy 's controversial विभाग of रक्षा tfx सेनानी bomber program led to a Congressional investigation that lasted from 1963 to 1970.
Since the 1960s सूचना concerning कैनेडी 's निजी life has come to light.
Details of Kennedy 's health समस्याएं in जिससे he struggled have become better known, especially since the 1990s.
Although initially kept secret from the general पब्लिक, रिपोर्ट्स of Kennedy 's philandering have garnered much press.
Kennedy ranks highly in public opinion ratings of u.S. राष्ट्रपतियों.
`` Stand by Me '' is a song originally performed by बेन E. किंग और लिखा by King, Jerry Leiber, and Mike Stoller, inspired by the spiritual `` Lord Stand by Me, '' plus two lines rooted in Psalms 46:2–3.
There have been over 400 recorded versions of the सोंग.
A political cartoon from an 1894 Puck magazine by illustrator S.D. Ehrhart, shows a farm woman labeled `` Democratic Party '' sheltering from a बवंडर of राजनैतिक बदलें.
A metaphor is a figure of speech that describes a subject by asserting that it is, on some पाइंट of तुलना, the वही as another otherwise unrelated object.
Metaphor is a type of analogy and is closely सम्बन्धित to other rhetorical figures of speech that achieve their effects via association, comparison or resemblance including allegory, hyperbole, and simile.
In simpler terms, a metaphor compares दो वस्तुएँ or things without using the words `` like '' or `` as ''.
One of the सबसे prominent examples of a metaphor in English literature is the All the world 's a stage monologue from As You Like It :
All the संसार 's a stage,
And all the men and women merely खिलाड़ी ;
They have उनके exits और उनके entrances ; — William Shakespeare, As You Like It, 2/7
This quote is a metaphor because the संसार is नहीं वस्तुतः a स्टेज.
By figuratively asserting that the world is a stage, Shakespeare uses the points of comparison between the world and a stage to convey an समझना परिचय the mechanics of the world and the lives of the people within it.

Printmaking is the process of बनाना artworks by printing, normally on paper.
Printmaking सामान्यतः कवर तभी the process of creating prints with an element of originality, rather than just being a photographic reproduction of a painting.
Except in the case of monotyping, the process is सक्षम of producing multiples of the same piece, which is called a print.
Each print produced is not माना a `` copy '' but rather is considered an `` original ''.
This is because typically each print varies to an extent due to variables intrinsic to the printmaking process, and also because the imagery of a print is typically not simply a reproduction of another work but rather is often a unique image designed from the start to be expressed in a particular printmaking technique.
A छपाई may be known as an impression.
Printmaking ( अन्य than monotyping ) is not chosen only for its ability to produce multiple impressions, but rather for the unique qualities that each of the printmaking processes lends itself to.
Prints are created by transferring ink from a matrix or through a prepared screen to a sheet of paper or other सामग्री.
Common types of matrices include : metal plates, usually copper or zinc, or polymer plates for engraving or etching ; stone, aluminum, or polymer for lithography ; ब्लॉक of लकडी लिये woodcuts and wood engravings ; and linoleum for linocuts.
screens बना of silk or synthetic fabrics are used for the screenprinting process.
Other types of matrix substrates and सम्बन्धित प्रक्रियाओं are discussed below.
Multiple impressions मुद्रित from the same matrix form an edition.
Since the late 19th century, artists have generally signed individual impressions इससे an संस्करण और often number the impressions to form a limited edition.
Prints may also be printed in book form, such as illustrated books or artist 's books.
Il Divo is an English multinational operatic pop गायन group created by music manager, executive, and reality TV star Simon Cowell.
Formed in the United Kingdom, they are also signed to Cowell 's record label, syco म्यूज़िक.
Il Divo is a group of four male singers : French pop singer Sébastien izambard, स्पेनी baritone Carlos Marín, American tenor David Miller, and Swiss tenor Urs Bühler.
To date, they have sold more than 26 million एल्बम विश्वव्यापी.
Su-15, one of the principal Soviet एयर रक्षा interceptors in the 1970s and 1980s
An interceptor aircraft ( or simply interceptor ) is a type of सेनानी aircraft designed specifically to prevent missions of enemy aircraft, particularly bombers and reconnaissance aircraft, and destroy them, relying usually on great speed and powerful armament.
Being used since the First World War, after the late 1960s, interceptors became less important due to shifting from bombers to intercontinental ballistic missiles ( ICBMs ) for nuclear warfare.
A Vietnamese American ( ) is an American of Vietnamese descent.
They make up about half of all overseas Vietnamese ( Người Việt Hải Ngoại ) and are the fourth-largest एशियाई अमरीकी समूह.
Mass Vietnamese आव्रजन to the संयुक्त States started after 1975, after the end of the Vietnam War.
Early immigrants were refugee boat लोगों fleeing persecution or poverty.
मजबूर to भागो इससे उनके मातृभूमि और प्रायः thrust into poor urban neighborhoods, these newcomers have nevertheless managed to establish strong communities in a short amount of time.
More than साठ प्रतिशत of Vietnamese Americans reside in the states of California, Texas, Washington, Florida, and Virginia.
Front page of the U.S. Armed Forces newspaper, सितारों और Stripes, 2 May 1945
Adolf Hitler वचनबद्ध आत्महत्या by gunshot on 30 April 1945 in his Führerbunker in Berlin.
His wife Eva ( née Braun ) committed suicide with him by ingesting cyanide.
कि दोपहर, in accordance साथ हिटलर 's prior निर्देश, उनके remains यहूद carried up the सीढ़ियाँ through the बंकर 's आपात निकास, doused in पेट्रोल और नियत alight in the reich chancellery गार्डन बाहर the बंकर.
The Soviet archives record that their burnt remains were recovered and interred in successive स्थितियाँ until 1970 when they were again exhumed, cremated and the ashes scattered.
Accounts differ as to the cause of death ; one that he died by poison only and another that he died by a self-inflicted gunshot, while biting down on a cyanide capsule.
Contemporary historians have rejected these accounts as being either Soviet propaganda or an attempted compromise in order to reconcile the different conclusions.
One eye-witness recorded that the body showed signs of having been shot through the mouth, but this has been proven unlikely.
There is also controversy regarding the authenticity of skull and jaw fragments जिससे were recovered.
In 2009, DNA tests were performed on a skull Soviet officials had long believed to be हिटलर 's.
The tests revealed that the skull was actually that of a स्त्री कम than 40 years old.
स्थान of Missouri
The alcohol laws of Missouri are among the least restrictive and most lax and permissive in the United States.
Missouri is known throughout the Midwest for its largely laissez-faire approach to alcohol regulation, in sharp contrast to the very सख्त दारू कानून of some of its neighbors, like Kansas and Oklahoma.
Necrotizing fasciitis ( or ) or NF, commonly known as flesh-eating बीमारी or flesh-eating जीवाणु सिंड्रोम, is a rare infection of the deeper layers of skin and subcutaneous tissues, easily spreading across the fascial plane within the subcutaneous tissue.
Necrotizing fasciitis is quickly progressing, having greater risk of developing in the immunocompromised due to conditions like diabetes, cancer, etc.
It is a कठोर बीमारी of sudden onset and is usually treated immediately with high doses of intravenous antibiotics.
Type I describes a polymicrobial संक्रमण, whereas प्रकार ii describes a monomicrobial infection.
Many types of bacteria can cause necrotizing fasciitis ( e.g., Group A streptococcus ( Streptococcus pyogenes ), Staphylococcus aureus, Clostridium perfringens, Bacteroides fragilis, aeromonas hydrophila ).
Such infections are अधिक संभावित to occur in people with compromised immune systems.
Historically, समूह a streptococcus made up most cases of Type II infections.
However, since as early as 2001, another serious form of monomicrobial necrotizing fasciitis has been observed with increasing frequency, caused by methicillin-resistant Staphylococcus aureus ( MRSA ).
Some published case reports have implied a possible link between use of non-steroidal anti-inflammatory दवाएँ और nf, though the evidence of the link was said to be weak because of a small number of case patients and it was unclear whether the drugs just masked the symptoms of a secondary infection or were a cause per se.
World War II ( WWII or WW2 ), भी known as the Second World War, was a global war that lasted from 1939 to 1945.
It involved the vast majority of the world 's nations —including all of the great powers —eventually forming two opposing military alliances : the Allies and the Axis.
It was the सबसे फैली युद्ध in history, with more than 100 million people serving in military units from over 30 different countries.
In a state of `` total war ``, the major participants placed their entire economic, industrial, and scientific capabilities at the service of the war effort, erasing the distinction between civilian और सैन्य संसाधन.
Marked by mass deaths of civilians, including the holocaust और the तभी उपयोग of नाभिकीय weapons in warfare, it resulted in 50 million to over 75 million fatalities.
These deaths make World War II by दूर the deadliest conflict in human history.
The Empire of Japan aimed to dominate ईस्ट एशिया और थी already at युद्ध साथ the गणतंत्र of चीन in 1937, but the world war is generally said to have begun on 1 September 1939 with the invasion of Poland by Germany and subsequent declarations of war on Germany by France and Britain.
From late 1939 to early 1941, in a series of campaigns and treaties, Germany formed the Axis alliance with Italy, conquering or subduing much of continental Europe.
Following the Molotov–Ribbentrop Pact, Germany and the Soviet Union partitioned and annexed territories between themselves of their European neighbours, including Poland.
The संयुक्त किंगडम और the अन्य सदस्यों of the British Commonwealth were the only major Allied forces continuing the fight against the Axis, with battles taking place in North Africa as well as the long-running Battle of the Atlantic.
In June 1941, the European Axis launched an invasion of the Soviet Union, giving a start to the largest land थिएटर of युद्ध in इतिहास, जिससे tied bas the major part of the Axis ' military forces for the rest of the war.
In December 1941, Japan joined the Axis, attacked the United States and European territories in the Pacific Ocean, and quickly conquered much of the पश्चिमी Pacific.
The अक्ष अग्रिम थी रोका in 1942, after Japan lost a series of naval battles and European Axis troops were defeated in North Africa and, decisively, at Stalingrad.
In 1943, with a series of German defeats in Eastern Europe, the Allied invasion of Italy, and American victories in the प्रशांत, the Axis lost the initiative and undertook strategic retreat on all fronts.
In 1944, the Western Allies invaded France, while the Soviet Union regained all of its territorial losses and invaded Germany and its allies.
During 1944 and 1945 the United राज्य पराजित the Japanese Navy and captured key Western Pacific islands.
The war in Europe ended with the capture of Berlin by Soviet and Polish troops and the subsequent German unconditional surrender on 8 May 1945.
Following the Potsdam Declaration by the Allies on 26 July 1945, the United States dropped atomic बम on the जापानी शहरों of हिरोशिमा on 6 August, and Nagasaki on 9 August.
With an आक्रमण of the जापानी द्वीपसमूह imminent, and the Soviet Union having declared war on Japan by invading Manchuria, Japan surrendered on 15 August 1945, ending the war in Asia and cementing the total victory of the Allies over the Axis.
World War II altered the political alignment and सोशल ढांचा of the world.
The United Nations ( UN ) was established to foster international cooperation and prevent future विरोध.
The great powers that were the victors of the war—the United States, the सोवियत संघ, चीन, the संयुक्त Kingdom, and France—became the permanent members of the United Nations Security Council.
the सोवियत संघ और the संयुक्त राज्य उभरा as प्रतिद्वंद्वी superpowers, सेटिंग the स्टेज लिये the ठंडा युद्ध, जिससे lasted लिये the अगला 46 सालो.
Meanwhile, the influence of European great powers started to decline, while the decolonisation of Asia and Africa began.
Most countries whose उद्योग had been damaged moved towards economic recovery.
Political integration, especially in Europe, उभरा as an effort to stabilise postwar relations and fight more effectively in the Cold War.
A limited liability company ( LLC ) is a लचीली रूप of एंटरप्राइज़ that blends elements of partnership and corporate structures.
Note than an llc is नहीं a corporation, and calling an LLC a corporation is technically incorrect.
An LLC is a विधिक form of company that provides limited liability to its owners in the vast majority of United States jurisdictions.
llcs do नहीं need to be व्यवस्थित लिये लाभ.
Five k-cups
The अंदर of a used K-Cup, with the top foil and the used coffee grounds removed.
This shows the filter inside the k-cup.
K-Cup portion पैक हैं प्रयुक्त साथ keurig or अन्य सिंगल cup brewing systems to brew a cup of coffee, tea, or hot chocolate.
Each K-Cup is a plastic container with a कॉफी filter inside.
Ground coffee beans are packed in the K-Cup and sealed air-tight साथ a संयोजन plastic and foil lid.
When the K-Cup is placed in a Keurig brewer, the brewer punctures the foil ढक्कन और the bottom of the K-Cup and forces hot water under pressure through the K-Cup and into a mug.
Keurig licenses its K-Cup प्रौद्योगिकी to कॉफी roasters और चाय makers ऐसे as Green Mountain Coffee Roasters, Diedrich/ Gloria Jeans, Timothy 's World Coffee, Van Houtte, Caribou Coffee, Celestial Seasonings, Bigelow Tea Company, Twinings, Tully 's, Coffee People and Newman 's Own.
Keurig 's patents on the असली k-cup डिज़ाइन expired in September 2012.
Keurig holds at least one additional, still-active US patent and another patent application, detailing improvements that have subsequently been incorporated in उनके k-cup design.

A chronograph is a specific type of watch that is used as a stopwatch संयुक्त with a display watch.
A basic chronograph रै an स्वतंत्र स्वीप दूसरी हाथ ; it can be प्रारंभ, रोका, और लौटे to शून्य by successive दबाव on the स्टेम.
लुई moinet invented the chronograph in 1816
Conventional PCI ( PCI is an initialism formed from Peripheral Component Interconnect, part of the PCI Local Bus standard and often shortened to just PCI ) is a local computer bus for attaching hardware devices in a computer.
The PCI bus supports the functions found on a processor bus, but in a standardized format that is independent of any particular processor.
Devices कनेक्ट to the बस appear to the processor to be connected directly to the processor bus, and are assigned addresses in the processor 's address space.
Attached devices can take either the रूप of an एकीकृत सर्किट fitted onto the motherboard itself, called a planar device in the PCI specification, or an expansion card that fits into a slot.
The PCI Local Bus was first implemented in ibm pc compatibles, जहाँ it विस्थापित the combination of ISA plus one VESA Local Bus as the bus configuration.
It has subsequently been adopted लिये other computer types.
PCI and PCI-X are being replaced by PCI Express, but, most motherboards are still made with one or अधिक पीसीआई स्लॉट, जिससे हैं sufficient for many uses.
The PCI specification covers the physical size of the bus ( including the size and spacing of the सर्किट फलक किनारे विद्युत contacts ), electrical characteristics, bus timing, and protocols.
The specification can be purchased इससे the PCI Special Interest Group ( PCI-SIG ).
Typical PCI cards used in PCs include : network cards, sound cards, modems, अतिरिक्त पोर्ट such as USB or serial, TV tuner cards and disk controllers.
PCI video cards replaced ISA and VESA cards, until growing bandwidth requirements outgrew the capabilities of PCI ; the preferred interface for video cards became AGP, and then PCI Express.
PCI video cards remain available for use with old PCs बगैर AGP or PCI Express slots.
Many devices previously provided on PCI expansion ताश हैं अभी commonly एकीकृत onto motherboards or available in universal serial bus and PCI Express versions.
Michael Whitaker Smith ( born October 7, 1957 ) is an American समकालीन ईसाई संगीतकार, जो रै charted primarily in the contemporary Christian and occasionally in the mainstream charts.
उसके biggest कामयाबी in मुख्यधारा म्यूज़िक was in 1991 when `` Place in this World '' hit No. 6 on the Billboard Hot 100.
Smith is a three-time Grammy Award winner, and has अर्जित 40 dove पुरस्कार.
Over the course of his career, he sold more than 13 लाख एल्बम और recorded 29 No. 1 Hit songs, fourteen gold albums, and five platinum albums.
Smith is an American Music Award recipient ; he was also named one of People magazine 's `` सबसे Beautiful People ''.
An American poster from the World War II -era that was used to inform people about कया वे should do if they suspect sabotage.
Sabotage is a deliberate action aimed at weakening another entity through subversion, obstruction, disruption, or destruction.
In a workplace setting, sabotage is the conscious वापसी of दक्षता generally directed at causing some change in workplace conditions.
One who engages in तोड़फोड़ is a saboteur.
As a rule, saboteurs कोशिश to conceal their identities because of the consequences of their actions.
For example, whereas an environmental pressure group might be happy to be identified with an act of तोड़फोड़, it होता नहीं want the व्यक्तिगत identities of the perpetrators known.
Patrick Henry College ( PHC ) is a private, independent college with an Evangelical Christian basis that focuses on शिक्षण शास्त्रीय उदार arts and government, located in Purcellville, Virginia, United States.
Patrick Henry is known for its रूढ़िवादी evangelical Christian focus.
As of April 17, 2007, the college was accredited by the Transnational Association of Christian Colleges and Schools, a national faith-related accrediting संगठन पहचाना by the विभाग of शिक्षा and the Council for Higher Education Accreditation.
The school was founded with the help of the Home School Legal Defense Association, and now serves as the headquarters for the संगठन, साथ जिससे it is still closely connected.
The history of television comprises the work of numerous engineers and inventors in several countries over many decades.
The earliest proposal was in 1908, in a paper by A. A. Campbell-Swinton and postulated the use of cathode rays.
The first practical demonstrations of television, however, were developed using electromechanical विधि to स्कैन, संचारण, और reproduce an image.
As electronic camera and display tubes were perfected, electromechanical टेलीविज़न दिया रास्ता to all-electronic systems in nearly all applications.

A ठेठ multiplex ( AMC Promenade 16 in Woodland Hills, Los Angeles, U.S. )
A movie theater ( also called a cinema, movie house, film house, film theater or picture house ) is a स्थान, प्रायः a building, for viewing films.
Most but not all movie theaters are commercial operations catering to the सामान्य पब्लिक, जो attend by purchasing a ticket.
the फिल्म is प्रक्षिप्त with a movie projector onto a large projection screen at the front of the auditorium.
Most movie theaters are now equipped लिये डिजिटल सिनेमा projection, removing the need to create and transport a physical film print.

A मोटरसाइकिल club is a group of individuals whose primary interest and activities involve motorcycles.
Lyme disease, Lyme borreliosis is an infectious disease caused by at least three species of जीवाणु belonging to the genus Borrelia.
Borrelia burgdorferi sensu stricto is the main cause of Lyme disease in North America, whereas borrelia afzelii और Borrelia garinii cause most European cases.
The disease is named after the towns of Lyme and Old Lyme, Connecticut, USA, where a number of cases were identified in 1975.
हालांकि एलन steere एहसास कि lyme disease was a tick-borne disease in 1978, the cause of the disease remained a mystery until 1981, when B. burgdorferi was identified by Willy Burgdorfer.
Lyme disease is the सबसे आम tick-borne disease in the Northern Hemisphere.
Borrelia is transmitted to humans by the bite of infected ticks belonging to a few species of the genus Ixodes ( `` hard ticks '' ).
Early symptoms may include fever, headache, fatigue, depression, और a characteristic circular skin rash called erythema migrans ( EM ).
Left untreated, later symptoms may involve the joints, heart, and सेंट्रल बेचैन system.
In most cases, the संक्रमण और इसके लक्षण हैं eliminated by antibiotics, especially if the illness is treated early.
विलम्बित or inadequate treatment can lead to more serious symptoms, which can be disabling and difficult to treat.

Penis ( plural penises or penes ) is a general term for the अंगों साथ which male and hermaphrodite animals introduce sperm into receptive females during copulation.
Such organs occur in many animals, both vertebrate and invertebrate, लकिन males do नहीं bear a penis in every animal species, and in those species in which the male does bear a so-called penis, the penes in the various species are not necessarily homologous.
For example, the penis of a mammal is at most analogous to the penis of a पुरूष कीट or barnacle.
The term penis applies to अनेक reproductive intromittent organs, but not to all ; for example the intromittent organ of most cephalopoda is the hectocotylus, a specialised arm, and male spiders use their pedipalps.
In most species of animals in which there is an organ that might reasonably be described as a penis, it has no major function other than intromission, or at least conveying the sperm to the मादा, लकिन in the placental mammals the penis bears the distal part of the urethra, which discharges both urine during urination and semen during copulation as the occasion requires.
Artists and repertoire ( A & R ) is the division of a record label or music publishing company that is responsible for talent scouting और overseeing the कलाकारी विकास of recording artists and/or songwriters.
It also acts as a liaison between artists and the record label or publishing company ; every activity involving artists to the point of album रिलीज is generally considered under the purview of, and responsibility of, A & R.
A furlong is a measure of distance in इम्पीरियल इकाई और u.S. प्रथागत इकाई बराबर to one-eighth of a mile, equivalent to 220 yards, 660 feet, 40 rods, or 10 chains.
The exact value of the furlong varies slightly among English-speaking countries.
Five furlongs हैं लगभग 1 kilometre ( 1.0058 km is a closer approximation ).
Since the original definition of the metre was one-quarter of one ten-millionth of the परिधि of the Earth ( along the great circle coincident with the meridian of longitude passing through Paris ), the circumference of the Earth is about 40,000 km or about 200,000 furlongs.

लिथियम बैटरी हैं डिस्पोजेबल ( primary ) batteries that have lithium metal or lithium compounds as an anode.
They स्टैंड अलावा इससे अन्य batteries in their high charge density ( long life ) and high cost per unit.
Depending on the design and chemical compounds used, lithium cells can produce voltages from 1.5 V ( comparable to a zinc–carbon or alkaline battery ) to about 3.7 V. Lithium बैटरी हैं widely प्रयुक्त in products such as portable consumer electronic devices.
Raymond `` Ray '' Charles Jack LaMontagne ( ; born June 18, 1973 ) is an American singer-songwriter.
LaMontagne has released four स्टुडियो एल्बम, ट्रबल, तक the Sun Turns Black, Gossip in the Grain and God Willin ' & the Creek Do n't Rise.
He थी born in नई Hampshire and was inspired to create music after hearing an album by Stephen Stills.

He lives in मैसाचुसेट्स with his wife and two children.
